loans.name: Mebakari

texts.en:
Mebakari is from Likoni, Kenya. She and her husband, a security man, have four children attending school. Mebakari opened a food stall in the market twenty years ago, and she now has many customers in the area. She comments that she’d like her children to finish their schooling so that she can expand the business.

Mebakari is asking for a loan to buy beverages, foodstuffs, canned goods, and other supplies so that she can keep her store well stocked and cook a wide variety of food for her customers. She is grateful for the opportunity she’s getting because it will enable her business to continue to grow.

loans.use: to buy beverages, foodstuffs, and canned goods.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha has her sewing workshop in Likoni, Kenya, where she works hard each day to be able to fulfill the orders of all her customers.

She is applying to Yehu Microfinance Trust and to Kiva for the loan, to be able to buy different fabrics and some materials she urgently needs in order to fill an important uniform order for school children.

Asha defines herself as a very hard-working and enterprising person, who wishes to be able to work, and that way keep helping her family through her work.

loans.use: to buy different fabrics and some materials

loans.name: Ehab

texts.en:
Ehab is a 27-year-old single young man. He is a bank employee and the salary he gets isn't enough to cover all his needs and costs.
Ehab is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing a new laptop. This will enhance his skills in using a computer and help him to complete requested reports to work quickly and on time. This will bring Ehab a bright future in his work.
Ehab is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase a laptop

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is married and her husband is a plumber by profession. They have three children, all of whom attend school. 

For the past one year, Rose has had an itinerant clothing business where she sells all types of products, and in her house she has a convenience store that her husband tends to. She is a very hard-working and entrepreneurial person who does not fear work or challenges.

She is applying for the loan to buy bales of clothing, so that she will have a good variety to offer her customers. She comments that in the future, she wants to expand her store until it becomes a self-service store.

loans.use: to buy bales of clothing

loans.name: Nelis Del Carmen

texts.es:
Nelis, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, para la compra de materiales agrícolas, pues se dispone a trabajar la agricultura y para esto deberá tener los insumos como el abono y los herbicidas para poder aplicarlos al cultivo y prevenirlos de las plagas.
Ella manifiesta que el préstamo anterior le ayudo para realizar tambien una manzana de cultivo, con el aporte del préstamo logro comprarse lo necesario y obtener una siembra libre de plagas.
texts.en:
Nelis has decided to take out a new loan so that she can buy farming supplies.  She is getting ready to start farming and needs supplies such as fertilizer and herbicides to apply to her crops so that she can protect them from pests.

Nelis tells us that her previous loan helped her to grow a 'manzana' (1.72 acres) of crops.  The support of the loan meant she was able to buy what she needed and ensure her crops were free from pests.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicides

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: La señora Sonia, tiene 49 años,  nacida en Monteagudo-Chuquisaca, actualmente vive con su esposo en la ciudad de Santa Cruz y sus dos hijos de las edades de 25 y 23 años,  ya  hace muchos años que se vino de su ciudad natal buscando nuevas oportunidades, La señora Sonia se dedica al alquiler de mesas y sillas para eventos sociales también a la decoración de los salones, es la única actividad con la que se mantiene económicamente. El crédito otorgado a la señora es para la compra de sillas y mesas para seguir creciendo en su negocio, la Sra. Sonia cuenta que le fue muy bien con el anterior crédito,  La clienta está muy agradecida con  la institución por confiar en ella.
texts.en: Sonia is 49 years old.  She was born in Monteagudo-Chuquisaca and currently lives in the city of Santa Cruz with her husband and her two children who are 25 and 23 years old.  Sonia came here from her home town many years ago in search of new opportunities.  Her business is hiring out tables and chairs for social events.  She also decorates event rooms.  This is the only business with which she supports herself financially.  She will use her loan to buy tables and chairs so that she can continue growing in her business.  Sonia tells us that her previous loan was very useful.  She is very grateful to the institution for trusting in her.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs

loans.name: Delmer

texts.es:
Delmer tiene 34 años, es un muy trabajador, además de amable y solidario. Su pareja es Lidia, quien es profesora y la madre de sus dos hijos: Walter de 3 años y Charlise de 5 años. Juntos viven en su casa propia.
Su actividad es la venta de mercadería variada (abarrotes, ropa, artículos de ferretería, envases de plástico y otros). Todos estos productos los vende en los caseríos ubicados en las riveras de los ríos. Empezó por la necesidad económica que atravesaban, ya que los ingresos de su pareja no les alcanzaba. Ahora cuentan con un ingreso adicional que le da un alivio, además de ver crecer su negocio en estos 3 años, contando con la ayuda de su pareja en sus momentos libres.
Le gusta su trabajo porque realiza viajes cortos y conoce nuevos lugares, lo que no le agrada es cuando algunos de sus clientes le solicitan crédito, pues él no acepta este tipo de venta. Por otro lado, con el resultado positivo que evidencia su negocio tiene planes de hacerlo crecer e incrementar sus productos.

Este es su cuarto préstamo con la institución MFP, por tanto espera continuar con sus objetivos. Además de estar a gusto con su banco comunal, pues ha observado que es un grupo unido y colaborador, logrando tener bastante apoyo de todos.
Con el monto solicitado, de 1200 nuevos soles, invertirá comprando más mercadería en abarrotes, ropa y utensilios para el hogar a menor precio para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Delmer, 34, is very hardworking as well as pleasant and supportive.  His partner is Lidia, who is a professor and the mother of his two children: Walter, 3, and Charlise, 5.  They live together in their own house.

His job is selling a variety of merchandise (groceries, clothing, hardware, plastic containers, and other things).  He sells all these products in the hamlets located on the banks of the rivers.  He started because of an economic necessity they were going through because his partner's income was not enough.  Now they have an additional income that gives them relief, besides seeing his business grow in these three years and having the help of his partner in her free time.

He likes his job because he makes short trips and gets to know new places.  What he doesn't like is when some of his customers ask him for credit, because he doesn't make sales on this basis.  On the other hand, with the positive result that his business has shown, he has plans to make it grow and expand his products.

This is his fourth loan with MFP.  He hopes to continue with his goals.  Also, he is comfortable with his communal bank because he has observed that it is a close and collaborative group, managing to have a lot of support from everyone.

With the requested sum of 1200 nuevos soles [PEN] he will invest in buying more merchandise at lower prices to get better income.

loans.use: to purchase fresh food, clothes, and utensils for the home

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 59 years old. She lives in a small village in Kutaisi District with her family, her husband Goderdzi, their 28-year-old daughter, and 6-year-old grandchild. Her daughter is a seller in the village shop and gets a salary. Elena and her husband are busy with agricultural activities. They have a milking (dairy) cow. Elena produces cheese every day and sells it at the local market. Also, they have a plot of land where maize is grown. The family’s total average monthly income is 700 Laris. Although the family members work hard, they still don’t have enough income to put away some savings for purchasing additional needed household goods or renovation of the house.

Elena requested a loan for purchasing construction materials. They are going to repair the house, because the existing one is old and uncomfortable. As a result, the family will be able to spend their evenings after a day of hard work in a more comfortable environment and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to repair her house

loans.name: Ma Del Rosario

texts.es: LA SRA. MARIA DEL ROSARIO ESTA SOLICITANDO EL 1ER CREDITO PARA INVERTIR EN SU NEGOCIO DE ALGUNOS TINTES Y TRATAMIENTOS PARA EL CABELLO Y MATERIAL PARA PONER UNAS, ELLA ES ESTILISTA`PROFESIONAL Y ASI HA LOGRADO GANARSE A SUS CLIENTES Y SU LUGAR EN EL MERCADO.  DESDE QUE TENIA 25 AÑOS HA TRABAJADO EN ESTETICAS PERO ACTUALMENTE TIENE SU PROPIO NEGOCIO  EN SU PROPIO DOMICILIO Y ESTA LOGRANDO CUMPLIR SU SUEÑO, VE EN EL CREDITO LA OPORTUNIDAD DE MEJORAR SU NEGOCIO Y OBTENER MAS INGRESOS, ESTA ACTIVIDAD ES SU UNICA FUENTE DE INGRESOS Y APARTE DE SER ASI ES ALGO QUE LE APASIONA HACER Y TRABAJA EN LO QUE LE GUSTA APARTE DE TODO SE CONVIRTIO EN SU PROPIO JEFE.
texts.en: Maria del Rosario is requesting her first loan to invest in her business.  She will buy some dyes, hair treatments and materials for doing nails.  Maria del Rosario is a professional stylist and, as a result, she has managed to attract customers and gain a position in the market.  She has worked in the beauty business for 25 years.  She now has her own business in her own home and is managing to fulfill her dreams.  She sees this loan as providing her with the opportunity to improve her business and make more income.  This business is her only source of income.  It is something that she loves doing and she is happy to work in a business that she enjoys.  Also, she is able to be her own boss.

loans.use: to invest in her beauty salon

loans.name: Haydee

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “IMASUMAC II”, la socia sigue dedicandose a la venta de helados,ella vende de forma ambultoria por las calles de Cusco,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa con muchas ganas de salir adelante por su familia,la socia trabaja todos los dias desde las 09:00am hasta las 05:00pm aproximadamente,siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el credito para la compra de helados de diferentes sabores.

La socia se siente agradecida por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the "Imasumac II" communal bank. She continues to sell ice cream on the streets of Cusco. She is a responsible and hard-working person with a great desire to move ahead for her family. She works every day from 9:00 a.m. until approximately 5:00 p.m. This is the way in which she moves her family ahead. 

She is asking for the loan to buy various flavors of ice cream. 

She is grateful for the loan and she promises to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to purchase various flavors of ice cream

loans.name: Samuel

texts.es:
El socio Samuel pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen Concebida De Arin” y el banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Arin en la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco. Él vive en los campos verdes de la comunidad de Arin, ubicado en la Valle Sagrado de los Incas. Desde muy niño sus padres le enseñaron a trabajar en la agricultura y ganadería. El socio se dedica a la brindar servicio de mototaxi. En esta oportunidad El socio Samuel requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento de su mototaxi osea va comprar llantas.  

El socio Samuel agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Samuel is a member of the 'Virgen Concebida De Arin' community bank which is located in Arin district, in Calca province, in Cusco department.  He lives amongst the green fields of Arin community which is located in the Sacred Valley of the Incas.  When he was very young, Samuel's parents taught him to farm and raise livestock.  He currently provides a motorcycle taxi service.  On this occasion, he needs a loan to have maintenance work carried out on his motorcycle taxi (to buy tires).

Samuel is grateful for the loan and pledges to make his repayments according to schedule.

loans.use: to have maintenance work carried out on his motorcycle taxi (to buy tires)

loans.name: Giovanna

texts.es:
Giovanna tiene 36 años, es una mujer amable y muy trabajadora. La casa donde vive es propia, allí habitan ella, su pareja y sus dos hijos.
Su trabajo es la venta de bebidas, posee una fuente de soda en su casa. Lleva en esta actividad por 4 años y en algunas ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su hijo, pero casi siempre ella lo atiende sola. Cuando se inició en este negocio solo tenía unas cuantas variedades de productos, pero ahora maneja bastantes marcas. Además de esto, ella cuenta con el sueldo por trabajar en una entidad del estado. Le está yendo muy bien, tiene muchos planes a futuro, y desea más adelante poder agrandar su negocio.

Este es su crédito número 6 con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero y avanzar con su negocio. Se compromete a seguir siendo puntual, como en los anteriores créditos que tuvo. Se siente muy alegre de pertenecer a un banco comunal tan bueno y sólido como el suyo, desea seguir trabajando más tiempo ahí, ya que es bueno que todos sean muy solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado, 2000 soles, comprará bebidas para su negocio, además de refaccionar algunas partes de la casa para mayor comodidad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Giovanna, 36, is a kind, hardworking woman. She lives in her own home with her husband and two children.

Her work is selling beverages; she has a soda fountain at home.  She’s been in this activity for four years and her son helps her occasionally but most of the time she works alone.  

When she started the business she only had little variety of products but now she handles quite a few brands.  In addition to this, she also earns a salary working for a state entity.  She’s going very well and she has many plans for the future; she hopes in future to be able to enlarge her business.

This is her MFP loan #6 and she’s very happy to know that she’ll have financial support to make progress with her business.  She commits to continue to be punctual like she was with previous loans.  She feels very happy to belong to such a good, solid communal bank like hers and wants to continue working more time there since it’s good that they are all so mutually supportive.

She will use the requested 2000 soles to buy beverages for her business as well as to do some improvements to some parts of her house for better customer comfort.

loans.use: to purchase more sodas for resale

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda tiene 37 años, es una mujer trabajadora, decidida y con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Su pareja es Wilder, con quien tiene cinco hijas: Jennifer de 15, Tania de 12, Dalixa de 9, Olga de 7 y Vanesa de 5 años. Juntos viven en su casa propia.
Ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de artesanías nativas (mantas, faldas, collares y otros), las cuales prepara en su casa y las vende de forma ambulatoria en la plaza a los turistas, quienes son sus principales clientes. Cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijas mayores, quienes le apoyan en la preparación y venta de las artesanías. Empezó hace más de 4 años, aprendiendo esta actividad de su madre. Considera rentable su negocio por las buenas ganancias que le deja para solventar los gastos de su hogar y apoyar a su pareja. Lo que no le gusta es que es cansado tener que caminar todos los días buscando clientes, por eso quisiera alquilar un local donde tendría todo listo para la atención.

Este es su quinto préstamo con la institución MFP, por lo que espera cumplir con sus objetivos. Además de estar bien con su banco comunal, pues pudo observar que es un grupo unido y espera que sigan de la misma manera.
Con el monto solicitado, de 1200 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de material para la elaboración de mantas con diseños nativos, collares, pulseras y los otros artículos que vende.
texts.en:
.Yolanda is 37 years old. She is a woman who is hard-working and purposeful and has a great will to advance. Her partner is Wilder, with whom she has five daughters: Jennifer, 15, Tania, 12, Dalixa, 9, Olga, 7, and Vanesa, 5. They live together in their own house.

Her work is making and selling indigenous handicrafts (blankets, skirts, necklaces, and other items), which she makes at home and sells as a walking vendor in the tourist plaza; tourists are her principal customers. She has the help of her older daughters, who help her in the preparation and sale of the handicrafts. She began more than 4 years ago, learning this business from her mother. She considers her business profitable because of the good earnings that it leaves her to pay the household expenses and help her husband. What she doesn't like is that it is tiring to have to walk every day looking for customers; for that reason, she would like to rent a shop where she would have everything ready to be seen.

This is her fifth loan with the MFP institution, so she hopes to meet her goals. In addition to getting along well in her community bank, since she was able to note that it is a united group, she hopes that they will continue in the same way.

With the 1200 PEN that she has applied for, she will invest in the purchase of materials to make tablecloths with indigenous designs, necklaces, bracelets, and other articles that she sells.

loans.use: to buy materials for her handicrafts

loans.name: Fany

texts.es:
Fany es una joven alegre de 32 años. Su pareja es Geiner, ellos viven en una casa alquilada. 
Su negocio es la venta de medicamentos en la comunidad donde reside desde hace 10 años. Ella y su pareja están permanentes durante todo el día atendiendo su farmacia. A Fany le gusta recomendar los medicamentos más adecuados para que sus clientes puedan mejorar de cualquier mal que tengan. Sin embargo, sus dificultades son cuando se termina su stock, es por ello que acude a los préstamos como un apoyo para seguir con su labor. Para el futuro, desea comprar su propio terreno para tener su casa propia donde implemente su farmacia, más amplia y cómoda.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, se siente muy contenta por el apoyo recibido, por lo que se compromete a ser puntual con sus cuotas de pago. Asimismo, agradece a su banco comunal por ser socios solidarios y responsables.
Con el préstamo que esta vez solicita, de 1,000 nuevos soles, comprará las medicinas necesarias para incrementar el stock de su farmacia.
texts.en:
Fany is a cheerful 32-year-old woman.  Her partner is named Geiner, and they live in a house that they rent.  

Fany makes a living selling medicine in the community where she has lived for the past 10 years.  She and her partner work all day attending to her pharmacy.  Fany enjoys recommending medicines to her customers so they can recover from any illnesses they have.  However, there are problems when her stock runs out, and that is why she is seeking a loan to help her continue with her work.  In the future she wants to purchase land so she can have her own house where she can set up her pharmacy and make it larger and more comfortable.  

This is Fany’s first loan with MFP, and she is very happy to receive the support.  She promises to be punctual in making her payments.  She is also grateful to her communal bank, since the other members are all very supportive and responsible individuals.

Fany will use the 1,000 soles she has requested to purchase the medicines she needs to increase the stock at her pharmacy.

loans.use: to purchase more medicine to increase the stock at her pharmacy.

loans.name: Aida Maria

texts.es: Aida María casada con 55 años edad, con  un hijo mayor de edad, tiene por actividad económica un laboratorio clínico desde hace 25 años, experiencia con la que cuenta, Aida ha tenido créditos con fundación desde hace varios años el cual ha demostrado ser responsable y buena paga , en la actualidad su negocio ha ido creciendo gracias al esfuerzo propio y  los financiamiento que fundación le ha brindado, el financiamiento lo quiere para comprar equipo de trabajos como : analizador quinientos, baños maría, tubos para muestra.
texts.en: Aida María is 55 years old, married, and has an adult son.  Her business is a clinical laboratory.  She has 25 years experience.  Aida has been receiving loans from Fundación León 2000 for several years.  She has shown herself to be responsible and makes her repayments on time.  Her business has been growing recently thanks to her own efforts and the loans that she has received from Fundación León 2000.  She would like this loan to buy work equipment such as a chemical analyzer, double boilers and test tubes.

loans.use: to buy a chemical analyzer, double boilers and test tubes

loans.name: Endi

texts.en:
Endi is 53 years old, married, and has one child. She lives in Tkibuli District with her family, her daughter-in-law, and two grandchildren. The family members are busy with agricultural activities. They have beehives with bee colonies and produce ecologically clean honey. They make honey twice a year and sell it on the local open market. They also have a plot of land where they grow mushrooms. The total average monthly income of the family is 1,000 Lari.

Endi is requesting a loan to expand the family’s agricultural business. They plan to cultivate the land and sow more mushrooms. They hope to increase their harvest and sales from their business. With the increased profit, Endi will be able to reinvest in the family agricultural business to expand it and make it more profitable as well as improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase mushroom seeds.

loans.name: Carlos Orlando

texts.es:
Carlos, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para la crianza de ganado,  pues se comprara tres terneros, para incrementar el número, este préstamo le ayudara a aumentar el hato ganadero.
Él considera que el préstamo anterior, le ayudo a la compra de terneros, luego logro venderlos ya un poco más grandes, de esto gano lo necesario en un buen margen, las condiciones en su familia han mejorado.
texts.en:
Carlos is requesting a new loan for his livestock business.  He will buy three calves to increase his number.  This loan will help him to increase the size of his herd.  

Carlos' previous loan helped him to buy calves which he then managed to sell when they had grown a little.  This made him good profits and he managed to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy three calves

loans.name: Santos Jamileth

texts.es: Santos Jamileth es casada, con tres hijos, tiene como actividad económica una venta de pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación  desde hace diez años, en la cual se ha desempeñado, y tiene mucha experiencia, este negocio inicio por la necesidad de tener una herramienta de trabajo para suplir con las necesidades del hogar, el financiamiento lo quiere  para comprar productos de consumo diario como: arroz, azúcar, pan, leche, huevos, frijoles, entre otros.
texts.en: Santos Jamileth is married and has three children.  She has her own grocery store that is located in her home, and she has been in this business for the past ten years.  She has a great deal of experience in this business.  She started the business as a means of making income to cover her household expenses.  She is currently seeking a loan in order to buy groceries such as rice, sugar, bread, milk, eggs, beans and more.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, bread, milk, eggs, beans and other grocery items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase sheep

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is from Likoni, Mombasa. As a mother responsible for her home, she has operated a firewood selling business for the past two years. This activity has allowed her to raise her two children and to build her own home. 

Asha is requesting her first loan, which she will use to purchase bundles of firewood to sell.  With the increased inventory of firewood, she wants to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of firewood to sell.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “IMASUMAC II”,la socia continua dedicandose a la compra y venta de artesania,la socia lleva años en este su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,la socia trabaja todos los dias para de esta manera poder seguir apoyando a su familia,la socia es una persona emprendedora con muchas ganas de continuar adelante.

La socia solicita el prestamo para la compra de mercaderia para su negocio como chompas de alpaca.

La socia se siente agradecida por el prestamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This member is part of the Communal Bank "Imasumac II". She continues with her business of buying and selling handicrafts. She has been in this business for many years and has done very well thanks to the effort she puts into her business each day. The members works every day so that she can continue supporting her family. This member is an enterprising person who has the drive to continue forward. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy merchandise for her business, such as alpaca sweaters.

The member is grateful for the loan that has been provided and promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy handcrafted merchandise, such as alpaca sweaters.

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de Mujeres Emprendedoras denominado Kuña Katupyry actualmente tiene 12 integrantes, ellas se encuentran en el 1° ciclo del programa, es un grupo de mujeres muy activas y honestas , que se esfuerzan por salir adelante y ayudar a sus familias.
La Sra. Marciana tiene 25 años, y nos cuenta que se dedica a la venta de frazadas y hamacas confeccionadas por su marido, ella realiza las ventas por las zonas de Carapeguá y otras ciudades en forma ambulante. Ella es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante y de seguir creciendo como microempresaria. Tiene como meta poder seguir ayudando a su familia con todo lo que necesitan.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de frazadas y hamacas, con lo que podrá complementar los productos que ya tiene y de esa manera poder tener un buen stock de esos productos. Agradece a la fundacion y a kiva por la ayuda que están recibiendo.
texts.en:
This group of Entrepreneurial Women is called 'Kuña Katupyry'.  The group has 12 members who are currently in their first loan cycle within the program.  This is a group of very active and honest women who work hard in order to make progress and help their families.

Marciana is 25 years old.  She tells us that she sells blankets and hammocks that are made by her husband.  She sells her products around Carapeguá  and in other cities, working as an itinerant street vendor.    She is a person who has a great desire to do well in life and continue growing as a micro-businesswoman.  Her goal is to be able to continue helping her family by providing them with everything they need.

Marciana is requesting a loan to buy blankets and hammocks.  This will enable her to complement the products she already has and have a good stock available.  Marciana is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for the help that she and her group are receiving.

loans.use: to buy blankets and hammocks to sell

loans.name: Jesús

texts.es:
Jesús tiene 54 años, es una mujer trabajadora  y con muchos deseos de superación. Su pareja es René, quien es agricultor y el padre de su único hijo, que ya es independiente.  La casa que habitan es propia.
Tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su vivienda, donde ofrece los comestibles de primera necesidad. Además de vender desde su tienda, también lleva sus productos a los caseríos a la rivera de los ríos. Se inició hace más de 5 años con la ayuda de su pareja, de quien fue la idea, empezaron con un capital propio más un pequeño préstamo con lo que logró comprar los primeros productos, en pocas  cantidades, luego fue creciendo de pocos. Le gusta su negocio porque le permite contar con los ingresos económicos para apoyar a su pareja con los gastos del hogar, ya que antes no les alcanzaba. Ahora tiene planes de continuar e implementarlo más, ampliando la diversidad de sus productos.

Este es su tercer préstamo con la institución MFP, por tanto espera continuar con sus objetivos. Comenta estar a gusto con su banco comunal, pues conoce a todos sus miembros y no tiene problemas con ninguno de ellos, hay amistad.
Con el monto solicitado, de 2500 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de más abarrotes a precio por mayor para surtir su bodega.
texts.en:
Jesús is 54 years old, she is a hard-working woman with a big desire to succeed. Her partner is René, who is a farmer and the father of her only child who is already grown up. They own the house in which they live. 

She owns a grocery store in her home where she sells basic foodstuffs. As well as selling in her store, she brings her products to the very small villages on the edge of the rivers. 

Jesús started more than five years ago with the assistance of her partner, whose idea it was, they started up with their own capital plus a small loan with which she managed to buy the first products, in small quantities, and then went on to increase slowly. She likes her business as it enables her to rely on the financial income to support her partner with the household costs, as beforehand, they didn't have enough. Jesús now has plans to continue and implement those more, expanding the range of her products. 

This is her third loan with the MFP communal bank, as such, she hopes to continue achieving her aims. Jesús states that she likes this communal bank as she knows all its members and encounters no problems with anyone, only friendship.

With the requested amount of 2,500 Peruvian nuevos soles, she will invest in the purchase of more groceries at a wholesale price to stock her small grocery store.

loans.use: to increase the goods for her store.

loans.name: De Confianza Los Cerritos Group

texts.es: El Banco De Confianza Los Cerritos está conformado por 9 integrantes en el cual formaron este grupo de  emprendedores que luchan por seguir sus metas y objetivos de crecer con el negocio y en lo personal. La actividad económica de estos integrantes  de grupo es diferente. La señora Ileana José es una emprendedora exitosa, ella se dedica a la venta de cosa de hornos, tortas toda la vida ha luchado para salir adelante y brindarle a sus hijos una vida mejor. Ileana José  desde hace tiempo está trabajando con Fundación León 2000, ahora está nuevamente solicitando financiamiento para invertir en el negocio comprara materia prima y poder realizar las elaboración de la cosa de horno.
texts.en:
The "Confianza Los Cerritos" communal bank is made up of nine members. These entrepreneurs are striving to reach their goals, and to grow personally and in their businesses. 

The group members have various businesses. Ileana José is a successful entrepreneur. She sells pastries and cakes. She has struggled all her life to succeed, and to provide her children with a better life. 

Ileana José  has been working with Fundación León 2000 for some time, and now she is again requesting a loan in order to invest in her business. She will buy ingredients for making pastries.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for making pastries.

loans.name: Joel Antonio

texts.es: Joel Antonio, casado, con tres hijos menores de edad, de la localidad de león tiene por actividad económica el servicio de bar y comedor ubicado en su cas de habitación desde hace 7 años en el cual ha adquirido mucha experiencia, herramienta que inicio por la falta de empleo en el la localidad donde vive y la necesidad de sacar adelante a su familia, en la actualidad se ha superado en muchos espetos de su vida, Joel Antonio ha cumplido metas y sueños como es hacerle mejoras a su casa de habitación, el financiamiento lo está solicitando para comprar productos de consumo diario como: granos básicos, vasos, servilletas, platos verduras, frutas, jugos naturales, gaseosas, especies entre otros.
texts.en:
Joel Antonio is married and has three dependent children.  He lives in the town of León and his business is a bar / diner which is located in his home and which he has been running for seven years.  He has gained a lot of experience over the years.

Joel started his business as he couldn't find a job in the town in which he lives and he needed to provide for his family.  He has done well in many aspects of his life.  He has accomplished goals and fulfilled dreams such as making improvements to his home.  He is requesting this loan to buy products such as basic grains, cups, napkins, plates, vegetables, fruit, natural juices, soda, spices, etc.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, cups, napkins, plates, fruit, vegetables, natural juices, soda, spices, etc.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
La socia Martha pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen Concebida De Arin” y el banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Arin en la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco. Ella vive en los campos verdes de la comunidad de Arin, ubicado en la Valle Sagrado de los Incas. Desde muy niña sus padres le enseñaron a trabajar en la agricultura y ganadería. La socia se dedica a la venta de verduras como por ejemplo zanahorias, cebollas, lechugas y otros.  En esta oportunidad la socia Martha requiere el préstamo para comprar verduras como papas, lechuga, asnapa y otros productos.       

La socia Martha agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Martha belongs to the 'Virgen Concebida De Arin' community bank which is located in Arin district, in Calca province, in Cusco department.  She lives amongst the green fields of Arin community, in the Sacred Valley of the Incas.  Martha's parents taught her to farm and raise livestock at a very young age.  Her current business is selling vegetables such as carrots, onions and lettuces.  On this occasion, she needs a loan to buy vegetables such as potatoes, lettuce, 'asnapa' (herbs), etc.

Martha is grateful for her loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy vegetables such as potatoes, lettuce and 'asnapa' (herbs)

loans.name: San Pedro Group

texts.es:
El comite de San Pedro está integrado por 26 integrantes de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, ellas son mujeres muy luchadoras y con ganas de salir adelante y ayudarse las unas a las otras. Todas son mamas muy responzables y trabajadoras se reunen siempre para resolver cualquier problemita del grupo y también ayudan a su comunidad.
Graciela es la presidenta del grupo, ella comenta que siempre trata de poner lo mejor de ella para poder apoyar a sus amigas a que sigan trabajando por sus metas. Graciela se dedica a la costura y cuenta que ya tiene una clientela bien definida, ya que siempre les ofrece un buen servicio y de buena calidad. Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, hilos, agujas, encajes y demás insumos con los cuales podrá seguir trabajando y cumpliendo con los pedidos de sus clientes.
Está contenta por la oportunidad que recibe, pues le será de mucha ayuda para poder seguir creciendo en lo que hace.
texts.en:
The San Pedro Committee consists of 26 members who are from the city of San Lorenzo. They are very determined women who have the drive to move forward and help one another. All of them are responsible and hardworking mothers who always get together so that they can resolve any problem as a group and also help their community.

Graciela is the group president. She says she always tries to do her best to support her friends as they continue to work toward their goals. Graciela is a seamstress and says that she has a well-established clientele. She always offers her customers excellent service and good quality. Graciela is requesting a loan in order to buy fabrics, thread, needles, lace, and other supplies so that she can continue working and complete the orders from her customers. She is pleased with the opportunity she has received since the loan will be a great help in growing her business.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, thread, needles, and other supplies.

loans.name: Angel Grabiel

texts.es:
Ángel, está solicitando un préstamo para la compra materiales para la carpintería, como lijas, barniz, también le dará manteniendo a las herramientas, este préstamo le ayudara a mejorar las condiciones del taller, ya que comprara lo necesario y su maquinaria estará en optimas condiciones.
El préstamo anterior le permitió crecer en el negocio, ya que obtuvo materiales para enfrentar una serie de compromisos con los clientes, con los que salió bien, en su familia sus condiciones se mantienen, y en este periodo sus ingresos han sido estables.
texts.en: Ángel is asking for a loan in order to purchase materials for carpentry, like sanders, varnish, and also to pay for maintenance of his tools.  This loan will help him to improve the conditions of his shop, since he will buy the necessary items and his equipment will be in optimal conditions.  The previous loan allowed him to grow the business, since he obtained materials in order to meet a series of orders from his clients, orders which went well.  In his family their condition remains the same.  In this period his income has been stable.

loans.use: to purchase materials for carpentry like sanders, varnish, and also to pay for maintenance of his tools.

loans.name: Maria Francisca Alicia

texts.es:
María, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para poder continuar creciendo con  negocio pues invertirá en la compra de mercadería como detergentes, productos de aseo personal, boquitas, dulces, galletas, embutidos y pastas, esto le ayudara para poder atender mejor a los clientes.
Ella manifiesta que con el préstamo anterior logro realizar una buena inversión, aumentando los productos para mejorar sus ventas, esto le ha permitido mejorar los ingresos a su familia.
texts.en:
María is requesting a new loan so that she can continue growing her business.  She will invest in buying merchandise such as detergents, toiletries, snacks, sweet treats, cookies, cold cuts and pasta.  This will enable her to better serve her customers.

María mentions that her previous loan was a good investment.  She was able to increase her stock of goods and improve her sales.  This allowed her to improve her family's income.

loans.use: to buy detergents, toiletries, snacks, sweet treats, cookies and cold cuts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy firewood and corn

loans.name: Maria Cleofe

texts.es:
María, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo debido a que considera tener la necesidad en su negocio de la compra de artículos y de productos de primera necesidad, para esto invertirá en la compra de refrescos, gaseosas, bolsas, golosinas, maíz y leña, que son los que va ofrecer a la clientela.
El efecto que tuvo María con el préstamo anterior fue muy importante pues le ha dado una mayor estabilidad al negocio, ha logrado de sus ventas obtener buenas ganancias y cubrir las necesidades de estudios de su hijo y también cubrir los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
María has decided to request a new loan because her business is in need of merchandise and basic necessities. She will invest in the purchase of soft drinks, sodas, bags, candy, corn, and firewood that she can offer to her customers.

Her previous loan had a very important effect since it allowed her to have a more stable business. María was able to generate good profits, which helped to cover her son's studies and the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, sodas, bags, candy, corn, and firewood.

loans.name: Joel Elias

texts.es:
Joel, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, porque necesita comprarse materiales para su trabajo y además estará realizando el cultivo de maíz, él comprara específicamente abono, semilla mejorada, herbicidas, también comprara hierro, chapas, electrodos, entre otros que son necesarios.
Él  manifiesta que el préstamo anterior le ayudo a obtener los materiales para el taller, realizo los trabajos, dando un buen servicio a los clientes,  creando una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Joel is requesting a new loan, because he needs to buy materials for his work. In addition he will be growing corn, and will buy fertilizer, improved seed, and herbicides. 

He will also buy steel, sheet metal, electrodes and other necessary items. He says that the previous loan helped him obtain materials for his workshop. He carried out the jobs, giving good service to his customers, and creating better financial stability in his business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, improved seed, herbicides, steel, sheet metal and electrodes.

loans.name: Natela

texts.en:
Natela is 53 years old. She lives in a small village in Kobuleti District with her husband, Nugzar, and her 30-year-old son. The family members earn their living through agricultural business. They run a dairy farm with four milking cows and five calves. They produce cheese and curds. Part of the milk products is used by the family and the other part is sold locally. Along with the above-mentioned activities, the family owns a plot of the land. The family is especially busy with the plot in spring and summer seasons. They grow maize, potatoes and nuts. During spring and summer months, they perform seasonal agricultural works to get a good harvest in late summer. The family sells the harvested product in the local open market. The total average monthly income of the family is 500 Laris. 

Natela requested a loan to purchase calves. She will raise them and after one year will have more cows on the farm.  She will get more milk and increase her cheese and curds production. It will increase the income of the family. With the increased profit, she will be able to reinvest in the family agricultural business to expand it and make it more profitable. Taking into account the above-mentioned, the living conditions of the family will improve.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Michola

texts.en:
Michola is from the Negev. For many years, she has managed a small mini-market that serves her neighbors and some women from the surrounding neighborhoods. Michola is expanding her business and beginning to raise sheep. The extra income will help her family each month.

Michola needed this loan to buy stock for her mini-market and to buy lambs.

Michola wants to see her business continue and one day wants the opportunity to make the pilgrimage to Mecca.

loans.use: To buy stock for her minimarket and to buy lambs.

loans.name: Mtama

texts.en:
Mtama is married with three children.  She lives with her three children, who attend school.

Mtama manages a clothes trading business in her town. She started her business 1 year ago. Now she sells Khanga's for resale. She buys her inventory twice in a month from Mombasa. She is a responsible woman who wants to have her own clothing manufacturing business in the future. She is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to purchase bales of Khanga's for her business.

loans.use: buy clothing to resell

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en: Dorcas is 34 years old, married and has two children, aged 5 and 12.  She has been in the clothes selling business for four years. Besides that, she also runs a cereal shop. Previously, she used to operate a cafeteria.  Since she became a client with Faulu Kenya, Dorcas has been able to manage her business because she has been trained on financial management.  She hopes to open another outlet of her business in a different location and employ people.  She needs a loan of 50,000 KES to buy more clothes.

loans.use: buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 36 years old, married and has one child. He has been selling timber and firewood for two years. Previously, he acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya which helped him expand his business.

Through Faulu Kenya, Peter has also learned how to save because he has been trained on financial management. He hopes to grow his business in five years. He needs a loan of 30,000 KES to buy timber.

loans.use: buy timber to resell

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a single woman who lives in Likoni, Mombasa. Catherine has operated a hairdresser business for the past three years, renting a shop counter in the trade center.  In 2011, she changed and improved her workplace. She has a plan to further develop her business by having more supplies in the salon. 

Catherine is a professional and hardworking person who says, "I would like to expand the business by buying supplies in different types, like more options for hair color and different shampoos and such." The total amount she is requesting is 20,000 KES to buy salon supplies.

loans.use: buy salon supplies

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is a single woman. She describes herself to be an ambitious woman. She operates a retail store where she sells home products such as sugar, tea leaves, steel wire, maize flour, bread, salt, cooking oil, etc. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located within a conducive business environment and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more home products. Her business goal is to run a wholesale shop.  Catherine hopes to buy a piece of land with the anticipated profits which she will get from the business.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Pilar

texts.es:
Pilar, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para poder iniciar la siembra de granos básicos, ya que cultivara dos manzanas de terreno y una media mas donde incluirá tomates, el necesita comprar abono, herbicidas, insecticidas, para poder prevenir de las plagas.
El manifiesta que con el préstamo anterior logro comprarse lo necesario y realizar la siembra, pues esto le permitió recibir una buena cosecha, la que pudo comercializar, en su familia sus condiciones han mejorado, gozando de buena salud.
texts.en:
Pilar is asking for a new loan in order to begin planting bulk grain crops. As he will cultivate on 14 square kilometers of land for grain, and a further 3500 square meters where he will grow tomatoes, he needs to buy manure, herbicides and insecticides in order to prevent pests.

He states that with the previous loan he managed to buy the necessary products and succeed with the sowing, which allowed him to achieve a good harvest, which he could sell. Conditions have improved for his family and they enjoy good health.

loans.use: to buy manure, herbicides and insecticides.

loans.name: Dagbozounkou Dénagan

texts.fr: Dagbozounkou Dénagan est âgé de 49 ans et est marié à un certain Houmè. Dagbozounkou Dénagan n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Le couple a quatre enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a six autres enfants à charge. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Dagbozounkou Dénagan a appris la maçonnerie, activité qu’il exerce depuis une trentaine d’année et qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille. Parallèlement à cette activité, Dagbozounkou Dénagan vend des clous sur les chantiers de travail. Dagbozounkou Dénagan achète ses produits dans sa région. En vue d'élever le niveau de son activité et de mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Dagbozounkou Dénagan sollicite pour la troisième fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé. Les crédits précédemment obtenus ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Dagbozounkou Dénagan is 49 years old and is married to Houmè. Dagbozounkou Dénagan did not go to school. The couple has four dependent children who all go to school. In addition to their own children, they have six other dependent children. 

The couple takes care of the various household expenses together. Dagbozounkou Dénagan learned masonry, which he's practiced for 30 years. This allows him to meet his needs and the needs of his family. 

In parallel, Dagbozounkou Dénagan sells nails at construction sites. Dagbozounkou Dénagan buys his products in his region. 

With the goal of growing his business and to better satisfy the demands of his clients, Dagbozounkou Dénagan is asking for the financial support from ALIDé for the third time. His previous loans were reimbursed.

loans.use: to buy nails and masonry tools.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is a 24-year-old single woman. She has a son who is 4 years old. She describes herself to be risk-taker. She operates a retail store where she sells items such as bread, sugar, salt, etc. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located along a road and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high prices of household items . She will use the KES  20,000 loan to buy more household goods to sell. Her business goal is to run a supermarket within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have increased her customer size by selling a variety of household products to them.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: La Sra. Rosa tiene 30 años y es casada con 2 hijos que son de las edades de 1 y 6 años,  ella se dedica a la confección de buzos deportivos, su taller se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Villa Salome, este préstamo es su segunda secuencia dentro de la institución, La Sra. Rosa va a utilizar  este préstamo para la compra de tela por rollo para la confección de buzos deportivos,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de capital para la compra de tela ya que tiene un contrato con un colegio y tiene que entregar una gran cantidad de deportivos, la Sra. Rosa enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la de crecer en su taller y seguir comprando maquinas que le hacen falta y equiparlo mas, ella va a utilizar los beneficios en el ahorro para la compra de una casa propia ya que ese es su deseo.
texts.en:
Rosa is 30 years old and is married with 2 children, aged 1 and 6, she sews sweatpants for a living and her workshop is located in the Villa Salome area.

This loan is her second from the institution. Rosa will use it to buy fabric by the roll in order to sew sweatpants, her reason for requesting the loan is a lack of the capital she needs to buy fabric, as she has a contract with a school and has to deliver a large number of sweatpants. 

Rosa faces challenges in her business, amongst which are growing her workshop, buying more machines, as she has a lack of them, and better equipping the workshop. She is going to use the profits by saving to buy her own home, which is her dream.

loans.use: to buy fabric in order to make sweatpants

loans.name: Mujeres Al Triunfo Group

texts.en:
Juana is the coordinator of her group Mujeres al Triunfo (Women to victory) 1, 2 & 3 . This group is composed of 15 people and is located in the urban slums surrounding Santo Domingo.  Juana makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner. She says that her biggest challenge is to have savings, because with it she can reinvest, provide for her children or to have a plan for the future. 

Juana has a Pica Pollo (fried chicken restaurant), where the principal dish is chicken with fried plantains or potatoes. She has been running her business for three years. Using some savings, she started selling fried food. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying many pounds of chicken, plantains, potatoes, cooking oil, and other items like disposables. She will use the profits to save and reinvest in her business. She thanks you all for your support!!!

loans.use: buy food for her food stall

loans.name: Juan Alberto

texts.es:
EL SEÑOR JUAN A. UN HOMBRE Y UN PADRE TRABAJADOR  VE SIEMPRE LA MANERA DE QUE NO LE FALTE NADA A SUS HIJOS Y ESTA VEZ NECECITA PAGAR LAS COLEGIATURAS DE SUS HIJOS Y QUE SIGAN ESTIDIANDO.
TRABAJA DURO TODOS LOS DIAS Y CON MUCHA RESPONSABILIDAD ES ADMINISTRADOR DE UNAS OFICINAS Y ESO HABLA MUY BIEN DE EL.
QUEDARA AGRADECIDO CON LA AYUDA QUE SE LE PUEDA BRINDAR YA QUE PARA JUAN NO HAY NADA MAS IMPORTANTE QUE SUS DOS HIJOS.
texts.en:
Juan A., a hard working man and father is always looking to ensure that his children do not go without anything. This time he needs to pay his children's school fees so that they can continue studying.

He works hard everyday and has a responsible role as an office administrator, which says good things about him.

He is grateful for the help he can receive as there is nothing more important to him than his two children.

loans.use: to pay school fees

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria forma parte del Banco Comunal “Emprendedores del Futuro” perteneciente a la ciudad de San Fernando.
Ella se dedica al rubro del comercio, cuenta con un kiosko de abarrotes, y a la vez vende artículos escolares, libros lo que su clientela le solicite. Se dedica a este rubro desde hace 2 años, comenta que trabaja sola en su casa de lunes a domingo con horario continuado.
Su mercadería la compra en  distribuidora y supermercados, ya que están a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente. 
Con el crédito comprará aceite, azúcar, salmón, harina, bebidas, y artículos de escolaridad.
Una de las metas de Maria son comprar una camioneta, para poder comprar su mercadería en la cuidad de Santiago por la gran variedad en productos, y precios más convenientes, así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Maria vive junto a su marido y 2 hijos de 15 y 10 años de edad quienes se encuentran estudiando. Sus sueños son adquirir una camioneta para poder comprar sus productos ya que el flete de sus compras le sale un poco costoso.
Ella está muy agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que el crédito le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Además se siente cómoda con el grupo del Banco Comunal del cual forma parte, ya que éste es muy unido y solidario. Respecto a las capacitaciones impartidas en las reuniones, ha aprendido administrar su negocio de mejor manera.
San Fernando es una ciudad ubicada en la región del Libertador General Bernardo O´Higgins , zona centro de Chile. La actividad económica de la ciudad se basa principalmente en la agricultura (viñedos, cultivo de remolacha, frutales, tabaco, trigo y cultivo tradicional), la agroindustria (empresas exportadoras de frutas, conserveras, de lácteos, etc.) y el comercio.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Communal Bank "Emprendedores del Futuro" (Entrepreneurs of the Future), which is located in the city of San Fernando. She is in the retail trade and has a grocery kiosk where she also occasionally sells school supplies and books that her customers request. Maria has been in this business for two years. She says that she works alone from home Monday through Sunday on a continuous schedule. Maria buys her merchandise from a distributor and at the supermarkets at low cost, which is financially convenient for her. She will use her loan to buy oil, sugar, salmon, flour, beverages, and school supplies. One of her goals is to buy a truck so that she can acquire her merchandise in the city of Santiago, which has a wide variety of products at very affordable prices. This will help her have a better quality of life.

Maria lives with her husband and two children (ages 15 and 10) who are in school. Her dreams include buying a truck so that she can transport the products she buys at low cost. She is very grateful to Fondo Esperanza for the opportunity to receive a loan that she can invest into her business. Maria also feels comfortable working with her Communal Bank group, which is very unified and supportive. With respect to the training classes that are offered during the meetings, she has learned how to better manage her business.

San Fernando is a city located in the region of Libertador General Bernardo O´Higgins, an area in central Chile. The main business activities in this city are agriculture (vineyards and the cultivation of beets, fruits, tobacco, wheat, and other traditional crops), agro-industries (companies that export fruit, preserves, dairy products, and other commodities), and general trade.

loans.use: to buy oil, sugar, salmon, flour, beverages, and school supplies.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Emprendedoras  se formó con la unión de 15 vecinas de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso. Todas las miembros del comité desarrollan actividades independientes, pero también hacen actividades juntas con las cuales se ayudan y se apoyan mutuamente. Ellas formaron un grupo muy unido que se destaca en el barrio.
La Señora Odina es una de las integrantes del comité, ella es modista, hace todo tipo de trabajos, en lo cual recibe la ayuda de su hija. Tiene 2 hijos ya casados, que con mucho sacrificio crío, ya que ella es madre soltera.
Odina pide la ayuda de la fundación y de kiva para la compra de telas, hilos, gomas, cierres, y demás insumos para poder seguir trabajando y cumpliendo con los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The "Mujeres Emprendedoras" communal bank was formed as a union of 15 neighbours in the city of Mariano Roque Alonso. All the members of the communal bank of independent businesses, but they also work together when they can so they can have mutual help and support. They are a very united group which stands out in their neighbourhood.

Odina is one of the group members, she is a dressmaker and does all kinds of jobs with help from her daughter. She has two children who are already married, who she sacrificed a lot to raise as she is a single mother.

Odina is asking for the help of Kiva and the foundation so she can buy fabrics, threads, bands, fasteners and other supplies to be able to continue working and fulfilling her customer's orders.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, threads, bands, fasteners and other supplies.

loans.name: Vikindu Group

texts.en:
Mwajuma, who is in her late 40s, is a widow with four grown-up children.  She has a retail shop business and also sells salt at wholesale price.  She works from 6:00 am to 9:00 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Mwajuma's 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to start selling salt at wholesale price and to pay household expenses.  She has repaid back all her loans successfully.  Mwajuma wants a new loan to increase the stock in her retail shop stock and buy more salt to resell.  Her dream is to increase her retail shop stock, buy more salt to resell and start selling cigarettes at wholesale price.  Her dream is to one day be able to finish building her house.

Mwajuma will share this loan with her loan group "Vikindu", which has a total of 15 members who will hold each accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: restock her store and buy salt to resell

loans.name: Canal De Bendicion 6, 7 & 8 Group

texts.en:
Dignorah is the coordinator of her group Canal De Bendicion (Channel of Blessing) 6, 7 & 8.  This group is located in the rural areas surrounding La Romana, where the economy is dominated by the sugarcane harvest and luxury tourism.  Dignorah makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their two children. She says that her most difficult challenge has been to improve her business.

Dignorah is excited to be taking her sixth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and expanded her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling miscellanous products.  She will use this loan to buy clothes, shoes, cosmetics, women´s accessories and others products to resell. She will use the profits to improve her quality of life. 

Dignorah and her group thank you for your help in achieving their dreams by funding this loan!

loans.use: buy personal products to resell

loans.name: Kisiwani Group

texts.en:
Rose, who is in her late 30s, is married with four children, three of them go to school and the last one is still small.  She has had a charcoal business for three years now.  She works from 7:00 am to 8:00 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Rose's 7th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to start selling charcoal at wholesale price, selling wheat flour and rice at whole sale price, and pay household expenses.  She has repaid back all her loans successfully.  Rose wants a new loan to  buy more sacks of charcoal to resell.  Her dream is to one day be able to build her own house.

Rose will share this loan with her loan group " Kisiwani", which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: buy charcoal to resell

loans.name: Ferit

texts.en:
Ferit is in his early sixties. His children and grandchildren have been living overseas for the past decade.  He and his wife live in a greenly beautiful village in Central Albania.  

Ferit has been in the agricultural business for the past twenty-two years and has been enjoying it so far.  He owns a few “dynyms” of land where he plants beans and lentils.  Through the years, he has been able to establish a steady clientele -- his major clients are wholesale buyers and the minor ones are random people in the city's market.   

For plowing the field, planting and harvesting, Ferit does it himself with his wife. They also own a cow and use the dairy for their needs.  However, now that one of their sons and his family is coming back to Albania after all these years, they plan to buy another cow to fulfill all of their dairy needs. They are excited that they will finally have them back.  This is why they are requesting a loan. Their promise is that they will pay it off on the scheduled dates, just like the previous one.

loans.use: buy a cow

loans.name: Uran

texts.en:
Uran is forty-seven years old, married and has two children, a twenty-one and a nineteen-year-old who are both attending university in another city. His residence is in a little central east town with a population of approximately 10,000 people. 

Uran has been carrying out a transportation business for the past fifteen years. He owns a bus and he makes two trips a day, with the final destination as the capital city. This type of business has proved to be profitable in general in Albania, and so has been for Uran so far. However, just a month back, he had to pay tuition fees and living arrangements for his children, and that made him lack the money at the moment to buy some spare parts for his bus. This is why Uran is requesting a KIVA loan via VisionFund Albania for the first time.  He is grateful to KIVA for the opportunity he has been granted, because this loan will be a great help to him.

loans.use: buy spare parts for his bus

loans.name: Diamantes 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Yesenia is the coordinator of the Diamantes (Diamond) 1, 2 & 3 group. This group is composed of 15 micro-entrepreuners located in the city of La Santo Domingo. Yesenia's family is made up of two children and her husband. She runs a beauty salon and also sells products from a well-known brand catalog. She said that her most important challenge is to provide for her children's needs. She enjoys to read.

Yesenia is very excited to receive her first loan through Esperanza International. Receiving it, she will be able to expand her business, which she started by taking small loans from other lenders 4 years ago. She will invest by purchasing hair and beauty products for her beauty salon, to use and sell them to her clients.  She will also buy different products like cosmetics, natural medicine, and other items from a catalog to sell. 

One of Yesenia's dreams is to have a successful business and her own house. She thanks you all for your support!!

loans.use: buy beauty products for her salon

loans.name: La Richesse 2 (#1) Group

texts.en:
Judicael, age 35, is married and has a 9-month-old baby.  He also cares and provides for his father.  Judicael is representing the La Richesse 2 #1 group. 

Judicael owns a barbershop for men. He has had this business for 4 years and has been able to acquire many loyal customers. He will use the loan to buy a generator for his shop because the electricity in Brazzaville is very inconsistent. He will use the rest of the loan to buy general hair supplies that he uses often. His business strategy is to offer friendly customer service and to keep his shop clean and looking nice.

Judicael has received 3 previous loans from Kiva’s partner, HOPE Congo. He has a good repayment record. He hopes to use future loans to buy comfortable salon chairs for his shop. He is also saving some profits to help pay for his child’s future education.

loans.use: buy a generator and hair supplies

loans.name: Mujeres En Esperanza 1, 2 & 5 Group

texts.en:
Raysa is the coordinator of her group, called Mujeres en Esperanza (Hopeful Women) 1, 2, & 5 Group. The group is comprised of 15 members. Each one of them works day-to-day in their business activities in Santo Domingo.  This is one of the communities with scant resources located to the north of the city.

Raysa is a young businesswoman who is 24 years old. She is dedicated to selling shoes (footwear, men's casual shoes and women sandals, slippers and shoes), purchased at wholesale and by catalog. She used her first loan from Esperanza to expand her business and now she is receiving her fifth loan, allowing her to increase her sales and access to more clients. She will use her new loan to buy merchandise wholesale.

Raysa's family is comprised of her parents and some of her siblings. Her house is built as a simple structure with a zinc roof and block walls. She is focused on finishing her studies and working to help her parents. She is very thankful for your support!!!

loans.use: buy shoes to resell

loans.name: La Richesse 2 (#2) Group

texts.en:
Padou, age 24, is single and has no children. Padou is representing the La Richesse 2 #2 group. 

Padou owns a grocery shop in a local market in Brazzaville. He has had this business for 6 years. He is a young, savvy, and motivated entrepreneur.  He will use the loan to buy more merchandise for his shop, including drinks, milk, sardines, soap, and sugar. His business strategy is to stock quality merchandise in his shop as well as a large variety of products.
 
Padou has received 3 previous loans with Kiva’s partner, HOPE Congo. He has a good repayment record. He wants to one day build a large boutique for his grocery shop.

loans.use: restock his store

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
María, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, el cual necesita para invertir en la compra de materiales para la pupuseria, comprándose chicharrón, quesillo, condimentos, bebidas, estos otros productos que intervienen en la  producción y venta de las pupusas.
Con el préstamo anterior logro fortalecer el negocio, manteniendo lo necesario para la elaboración de pupusas, que hasta la fecha ha podido mantener esta situación.
texts.en:
María is requesting a new loan, which she needs to invest in buying materials for her tortilla stand: pork rind, soft cheese, condiments and drinks. Other products which are involved in the productions and sale of tortillas.

With the previous loan she succeeded in strengthening her business and maintaining the required items for making tortillas that until now she had been able to maintain the situation.

loans.use: to buy pork rind, soft cheese, condiments and drinks.

loans.name: Victor Antonio

texts.es:
Víctor está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas, pues se encuentra en la temporada donde se inicia el trabajo en la tierra, el deberá comprarse de fertilizantes, pago de trabajadores, abono y semilla, considera que con este nuevo préstamo tendrá la oportunidad de realizar una buena siembra.
El efecto que tuvo con el préstamo anterior fue la realización de la compra de los insumos agrícolas que utilizó en la cosecha pasada, la cual le trajo una buena producción de maíz con la que se ha mantenido con su familia.
texts.en: Víctor is seeking a new loan to buy agricultural supplies as the growing season is just starting. He will need to buy fertilizer, hire laborers, buy manure and seeds. Victor believes that this new loan will give him the opportunity to get a good crop. With his previous loan he bought agricultural supplies for the last growing season which resulted in a good maize harvest and enabled him to provide support for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure and seeds, and to hire laborers

loans.name: La Richesse 2 (#3) Group

texts.en:
Jean, age 40, is married and has a 12-year-old child. He also cares for his father in his home.  Jean is representing the La Richesse 2 #3 group. 

Jean owns a drink store and has had this business for 2 years. He will use the loan to restock his store with local and imported drinks. His business strategy is to keep his store clean and organized. He wants to keep the atmosphere in his store pleasing for the customers.
 
Jean has received 3 previous loans from Kiva’s partner, HOPE Congo. He has a good repayment record. In the future, he wants to expand his business and products by buying a soft-serve ice cream machine and an ice machine. He wants to continue to grow his business because it is helping him to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: buy softdrinks to resell

loans.name: Lela

texts.en:
Lela is 37 years old. She lives in a small village in Lanchkhuti District with her husband, Zurab, her mother-in-law, who is a pensioner, and her two children (12 and 17 years old). Both of the children study in the village school. Lela is busy with her dairy farm. She has three milking cows and four calves. She produces dairy food like cheese, curds and yogurt, and sells it in the local open market. In addition, Lela and Zurab are busy with farming. They have a plot of land where maize and 400 nut trees are grown. Lela and Zurab work hard during spring and summer seasons to get a good harvest. They sell the harvested products in the local open market. According to government estimates, the family belongs to the vulnerable poor category and they get monthly social assistance in the amount of 125 Laris. The total average monthly income of the family is 500 Laris. 

Lela requested a loan to cultivate her agricultural land . After cultivation, she will sow the maize. Lela and Zurab will work hard. After the seasonal work is properly done, they hope to get a larger harvest. This will increase their sales of corn. With the increased income, she will be able to reinvest in the family agricultural business and purchase additional household goods to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to cultivate land

loans.name: Maia

texts.en:
Maia is 26 years old and lives in the village of Kobuleti District. She is married and lives with her husband, Nugzar, and her two children (3 and 5 years old). Both of them go to kindergarten. Nugzar is a policeman and gets a salary. Maia is involved in agricultural activities. She has a milking cow and a calf. She sells milk in nearby villages. In addition, she owns a plot of land, where corn, nuts, mandarins are grown. She takes the harvested fruits and vegetables to the local open market to sell. The total average monthly income of the family is 800 Laris.

Maia requested a loan to purchase agricultural land. She will sow more fruits and vegetables there and increase her harvest. This will increase the income of the family. With an increased income, she will be able to reinvest in the family agricultural business. Due to the above-mentioned, living conditions of the family will improve.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural land

loans.name: Ruth Magaly

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “IMASUMAC II” ,la socia continua con su negocio de venta de productos de belleza como cremas,colonias,perfumes entre otros,la socia a la vez se dedica  a la compra  y venta de ropa,la socia vende su mercaderia de forma ambulatoria a todos sus clientes que le solicitan,la socia es una persona alegre y responsable con muchas ganas de continuar adelante por su familia.

La socia solicita el prestamo para la compra de ropa como casacas y chompas.

La socia se siente agradecida por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: Ruth is a member of communal banl IMASUMAC II. She continues with her business of selling beauty products such as creams, perfumes, colognes, and others. She also trades in clothing: she buys clothes that she sells door-to-door to all the customers who ask for her products. Ruth is a cheerful and responsible person who wants above all to keep going for the sake of her family. She asks for this loan to buy clothes such as jackets and jumpers. She is grateful for this loan and she promises to honour her repayment schedule.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Jonatan Enrique

texts.es:
Jonatán, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, pues considera que es necesario un nuevo reforzamiento al negocio, comprándose mas medicamentos para mantener surtido el negocio, se comprara vitaminas, pastillas y productos medicinales, con los que espera tener más aceptación de sus clientes.
Con el préstamo anterior logro mejorar la disponibilidad en el negocio, aumentando el inventario y con la oportunidad de generar mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Jonatán is seeking a new loan as he believes his business needs new stock. He plans to buy more merchandise such as vitamins, tablets, and medicinal products and increase his customer base.

With his previous loan, Jonatán succeeded in improving his business and generating more income.

loans.use: To buy vitamins, tablets, and medicinal products

loans.name: Nazi

texts.en:
Nazi is 48 years old. She is married and lives in a small village in the Tkibuli District with her husband, Jumber, her 25-year-old son, daughter-in-law and two grandchildren (2 and 3 years old). Her husband and son are construction workers. Nazi does agricultural activities. She has four milking cows and three calves and produces cheese every day. Part of the cheese is used by the family and the other part is sold in the local open market. She also has 600 nut trees. She picks nuts in the late summer and sells it in nearby villages. The total average monthly income of the family is 800 Laris.

Nazi requested a loan to purchase a milk cow. She will be able to produce and sell more dairy products such as cheese, curds and yogurt.  Thus, she plans to expand her business in order to earn a good profit. With increased profits, she will be able to reinvest in her family's agricultural business, as well as spend more on the family's daily needs and the living conditions of the family will be improved.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Karen

texts.en: Karen is married and lives with her husband and two children. She started her food-selling business two years ago. She cooks her own food and sells at retail to her neighbors and passersby. Her food is delicious and her kitchen is surprisingly clean. Her customers' satisfaction is good. However, the raw materials are getting too expensive. Therefore, she's requesting KES 50,000 to purchase meat from local herders, bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and rice, which will save her money. She will use half of the meat for her food business. She's a sharp and hardworking woman who says, "If I couldn't get my raw materials cheap, I could lose my business."

loans.use: to purchase meat, wheat flour, maize flour and rice

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “IMASUMAC II”, la socia se sigue dedicando a la elaboracion de jugos ,ella vende en uno de los mercados de la ciudad del Cusco desde las 07:00am hasta las 05:00pm aproximadamente,la socia lleva buen tiempo en su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,la socia es una persona empeñosa con mucha ganas de continuar trabajando.

La socia solicita el prestamo para la compra de insumos para su negocio como platanos,naranjas y papaya.


La socia se siente agradecida por le prestamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This member is part of the Communal Bank "Imasumac II". She continues with her business of making juices. She sells her products at one of the markets in the city of Cusco approximately between the hours of 7am and 5pm. The member has a good time working and has done very well as a result of the effort she puts into her business each day. She is an industrious person who has the desire to continue working. Therefore, she is requesting a loan in order to buy supplies for her business such as bananas, oranges, and papayas.

The member is grateful for the loan that has been provided and promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to purchase bananas, oranges, and papayas.

loans.name: Mwanauru

texts.en: Mwanauru is married and lives with her husband and five children. Her husband helps with her business. She started her food-selling business four years ago by renting a shop in the market. Since she started the business, she has expanded her shop and gained many regular customers. She anticipates an increase in demand for her products and she plans to increase her supplies in order to meet the market demand. In the future, she plans to build her own house. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says, "Since my business is the only income in the family, I need to make the best of it". She is requesting 40,000 KES to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and rice..

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, maize flour and rice.

loans.name: Bintiomar

texts.en: Bintiomar is married with one child who attends school. Her husband is a hotelier and he contributes to the family's basic needs with his earnings. She started her food stall business a year ago. Her shop location is good and her food stall is well known around the neighborhood for her nice service and quality food. Ever since she opened her shop, her business has been expanding steadily. Many buildings have been built around the neighborhood; therefore, her market demand is increasing. She is requesting 20,000 KES to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, rice and beans.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, rice and beans.

loans.name: Ignasia

texts.es:
Ignacia, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para invertirlo en materiales para la siembra de maíz y también en la compra de productos para la tienda, los materiales a invertir en la siembra son el abono, herbicidas, semilla y la preparación de la tierra para la tienda se comprará aceite, condimentos, embutidos, boquitas, gaseosas.
