She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Mercedes operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5 worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and then selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Mercedes hopes her earnings will help her to complete the construction of their house and wishes to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work every week and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario tiene 49 años, está casado con Constanza, con quien tiene ocho hijos, viven con siete de ellos. Su casa es propia y la que construyó a base de con esfuerzo, se ubicada en la comunidad de Sanchirio.

Él es uno de los pobladores más antiguos de su comunidad, por eso siente un gran cariño por su zona. En todo este tiempo, según afirma, pudo salir adelante junto con sus vecinos debido a la siembra de café. Adicionalmente, también cultiva plátanos. En coordinación con los pobladores, abrieron una cooperativa cafetalera, donde acopian sus cosechas para luego venderlas a empresas de otros países, quienes les pagan un buen precio. De esa manera puede mantener a su familia y darse algunos gustos. Así también, con sus ahorros, puedo abrir una tienda de abarrotes y comestibles, la cual atiende cuando las labores del campo cesan.

Este es el quinto préstamo que tiene con MFP y está contento de pertenecer al banco comunal “Progreso del Palomar” porque sus socios son igual de responsables.
Mario destinará este crédito en la compra de bolsas de abono naturales, como guano de corral, para fertilizar sus cafetales.
texts.en:
Mario is 49 years old and married to Constanza. They have eight children, but live with seven of them. They own their home, which was built with great effort. Mario resides in the community of Sanchirio.

He is one of the long-time residents of his community, so he feels great affection for this area. Throughout this entire time, according to Mario, he has been able to move forward with his neighbors by growing coffee. In addition, he grows bananas. By coordinating with one another, Mario and the other residents opened a coffee cooperative where the harvested products are collected and sold to companies from other countries that pay them a good price. By working in this manner, Mario is able to support his family and provide them a few luxuries. With his savings, he also opened a grocery and food store that he manages when the farm work is completed.

This is his fifth loan with MFP and he is pleased to be part of his Communal Bank "Progreso del Palomar" because all of the members are equally responsible. Mario will use this loan to buy bags of natural compost, such as chicken manure, for fertilizing his coffee plants.

loans.use: to buy natural compost for his coffee plants.

loans.name: Gabina

texts.es:
La socia Gabina pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen Concebida De Arin” y el banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Arin en la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco. Ella vive en los campos verdes de la comunidad de Arin, ubicado en la Valle Sagrado de los Incas. Desde muy niña sus padres le enseñaron a trabajar en la agricultura y ganadería. La socia se dedica a la agricultura y tiene varios terrenos de cultivos donde siembra papa, maíz, verduras y otras cosas más de  acuerdo  a la temporada. En esta oportunidad la socia Gabina requiere el préstamo para comprar abono y fertilizantes.       

La socia Gabina agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Gabina belongs to the “Virgen Concebida De Arin” communal bank located in Arin district, in Calca province, Cusco department. She lives in the green countryside of the Arin community, located in the Sacred Valley of the Incas. From a very young age her parents taught her to farm and raise livestock.

She farms and has several plots of farmland where she grows potatoes, corn, vegetables and other crops, depending on the season. On this occasion, Gabina requires the loan in order to buy manure and fertilizers. 

Gabina is grateful for the loan and promises to make her installment payments in accordance with the payment schedule.

loans.use: To buy manure and fertilizers.

loans.name: Aristides

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “IMASUMAC II”, el socio continua trabajando en su negocio de compra y venta de artesania,el socio lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,el socio vende su mercaderia a sus clientes que le solicitan como por ejemplo polos,chompas de alpaca,trabajos hechos en ceramica entre otros, el socio desea poder continuar trabajando para de esta manera poder continuar apoyando a su familia.

El socio solicita el credito para la compra de mercaderia de ceramicas.

El socio se siente agradecido por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This member is part of the Communal Bank "Imasumac II". He continues to work in his business of buying and selling handicrafts. The member has been in this business for years and has done very well thanks to the effort he puts into his business each day. He sells merchandise that his customers request such as pullovers, alpaca sweaters, ceramic works, and other items. The member wants to continue working so that he can support his family. Therefore, he is requesting a loan to buy ceramic merchandise.

The member is grateful for the loan that has been provided and promises to complete his payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy ceramic merchandise.

loans.name: Maria Cleofe

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de verduras,ella vende tomates,zanahorias,cebollas y zapallos,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es ampliar y mejorar el ngeocio de venta de verduras.La socia solicita el credito para comprar tomates,cebollas,zanahorias y zapallos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member continues to work in the business of selling vegetables. She sells tomatoes, carrots, onions, and pumpkins and works from 8am to 6pm. Through this business, she is able to move her children ahead in life. Her dream is to increase and improve her vegetable sales business. She is requesting this loan to buy tomatoes, onions, carrots, and pumpkins.

She is happy for the loan and promises to make her loan payments.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, onions, carrots, and pumpkins

loans.name: Emmalyn

texts.en:
Emmalyn is 48 years old with 2 children who are in school. Emmalyn works very hard to provide for them.

Emmalyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell. She has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items such as soap, soft drinks, canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc.. 

In the future, Emmalyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional stock to sell

loans.name: Cecille

texts.en:
As a married parent of 5 children, Cecille works hard to support her family. She has a plastic wares retail business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening and rice retail. Cecille is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more stocks of plastic wares to sell for her business.

Cecille has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy more stock of plastic wares to sell

loans.name: Adela Del Carmen

texts.es:
Adela, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para comprarse más materiales para el taller, se comprará hierro, lámina, y algunas herramientas necesarias para darle un buen servicio y calidad en el trabajo a los clientes, este préstamo les servirá para que cuente con lo necesario a través del dinero que invertirá ella podrá mantener un taller competente.
Con el préstamo anterior realizó una buena inversión también en el taller y en la venta de mariscos, esto le ha ayudado para que su trabajo continúe siendo constante y poder tenerlo mejor con su familia.
texts.en:
Adela is requesting a new loan in order to buy more materials for her workshop. She will buy steel, sheet metal and some tools she needs for providing good service and quality work for her customers.  

She will use this loan to have what she needs. Through the money she will invest, she will be able to maintain a competent workshop.

With the previous loan, she also made a considerable investment in the workshop, and in her business selling seafood. This has helped her have steady work, enabling her and her family to have it better.

loans.use: To buy steel and sheet metal.

loans.name: Zoljargal

texts.en: Zoljargal is 27 years old and lives with her husband and daughter, who is 4 years old, in a ger (a Mongolian felt housing tent) that lacks access to the basic infrastructure available in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia's capital. In 2007, she graduated from the Mongolian State University of Education with a major in teaching Japanese. She supports her family by operating a grocery store located in her family's yard, and regularly gets help from her husband. They began their business in 2006, and today have 4,000,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) in working capital. She is applying for a loan for 3,000,000 MNT to increase their capital and buy more products to sell during the summer holiday. In the future, Zoljargal wants to expand the store and enlarge their house.

loans.use: to buy items to sell during the summer holiday.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her food-vending business.

Jovita has been in this business for nine years. Jovita earns more income from a general store.

Jovita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Bonifacia

texts.en:
Bonifacia is 69 years old and married with 9 children. Bonifacia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell. Bonifacia has borrowed and paid 22 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 19 years and also earns an income from ready-to-wear and plastic wares.

Bonifacia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional items to sell

loans.name: Ailen

texts.en:
Ailen is 43 years old and married with 5 children. With 2 children in school, Ailen works very hard to provide for them.

Ailen runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell. Ailen has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, eggs, milk, spices, toothpaste, etc.. 

In the future, Ailen would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional stock to sell

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a restaurant business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 28,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her restaurant business. Analyn has been in this business for 14 years. She earns additional income from a general store.

Analyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients for her restaurant

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, soap, shampoo and beverages.

loans.name: Babylyn

texts.en: Babylyn is 38 years old and married with 3 children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Babylyn is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. Babylyn has been farming rice for 20 years and also earns additional income from making nipa (woven palm mats) and food vending. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celia is 63 years old and has 5 children. Celia is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines. She requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. Celia has been farming rice for 10 years now, and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Celia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, soap, shampoo and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools to use in repairing phones

loans.name: Than

texts.en:
Than, age 31, generates her income by engaging in rice and hog husbandry. She works on her farm alongside her husband, annually growing rice crops for both sustenance and for sale. She has been managing these two businesses for more than 10 years. She aims to raise their status of living so that she can ensure a bright future for her three children.

Than hopes to strengthen her hog-raising business and make it a viable source of income. Because of insufficient capital, she is asking for a loan of 1,500,000 KHR to buy more pigs, feed and vitamins needed for hog-raising. She believes that her loan will enable her to make improvements in her business and hopes that she will be able to make a good income from this type of business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more pigs, feed and vitamins needed for hog-raising.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 33 years old with one child who is in school. Cristina works very hard to provide for the family.

Cristina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 29,500 Philippines pesos loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Cristina has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, noodles, sugar, milk, coffee, etc. 

In the future, Cristina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Cristine Joy

texts.en:
Cristine Joy is 22 years old and married with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Cristine Joy has a fishing business in the Philippines. Cristine Joy requested a 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan amount through NWTF to purchase materials for fishing boat maintenance.

Cristine Joy has been in this business for one year. In the future, Cristine Joy would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase materials for fishing boat maintenance.

loans.name: Karina Del Carmen

texts.es: Con el ánimo de realizar una actividad que le generara ingresos para contribuir con los gastos familiares, Karina, decidió en el año 2010, cuando aún era una menor de edad, comercializar jeans, blusas, vestidos de baño, entre otras prendas que le daba su madre para que se ganara un porcentaje por venta.   Fue así como emprendió su camino como comerciante, distribuía la mercancía entre sus conocidos, amigos y vecinos del barrio Terranova del municipio de Soledad que le cancelaban a crédito con plazos quincenales y mensuales.  En el mes de mayo del año 2011, se vinculó a dos empresas muy reconocidas de venta por catálogo ya que deseaba ofrecer no solo ropa sino productos de tocador como cosméticos, perfumes, bisutería y otros para el cuidado personal.  Con su credikiva quiere tener capital disponible para seguir comprando los productos, trabajando tranquilamente sin importar los plazos otorgados a sus clientes; algunas veces en estos catálogos se presentan productos con muy buenos precios ofertados que desea adquirir para vender y ganar un buen margen de rentabilidad. Actualmente cuenta con 20 clientes fijos y algunos ocasionales a quienes también les ofrece mercancía. Karina tiene 19 años, vive en unión libre y tiene un hijo de 3 años pero aunque su vida gira rápidamente alrededor de su familia y su negocio, no le falta tiempo para soñar.  Ella quiere en un futuro no muy lejano y así como va, ir introduciendo nuevas líneas de productos para vender de todo un poco y comprar una vitrina en la que pueda exhibirlos, todo esto pensando siempre en el crecimiento económico de su familia y de su negocio.
texts.en:
Wanting to do a job that would generate income for her to help with the family expenses, when she was still a minor in 2010, Karina decided to sell jeans, blouses, bathing suits, and other garments that her mother gave her so she could earn a percentage per sale.  This was how she set out on the road as a merchant.  She distributed the merchandise to her acquaintances, friends, and neighbors in the Terranova neighborhood in the town of Soledad, and they paid them off on credit with bimonthly and monthly deadlines.

In May 2011 she connected with two very well-recognized catalogue-sales businesses because she wanted to sell not only clothing but also beauty products such as cosmetics, perfume, costume jewelry, and other personal-care products.  Sometimes in these catalogues there are products on special offer with very good prices that she wants to get, to sell and earn a good profit margin.  Currently she has 20 steady customers and some occasional ones whom she also want to offer merchandise.

With her Kiva loan she wants to have disposable capital to continue buying products, working peacefully without worrying about the deadlines given to her customers.

Karina, 19, lives in a common-law relationship and has a three-year-old child.  Although her life revolves quickly around her family and her business, she doesn't lack time for dreaming.  In the not-too-distant future she wants to be introducing new lines of products, to sell a little bit of everything, and buy a display case in which to show them--in all of this, always thinking about the economic growth of her family and her business.

loans.use: to buy products from catalogues and clothing to sell.

loans.name: Kerin Fernando

texts.es:
Kerin, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para poder iniciar una nueva inversión en el negocio de helados, comprándose una variedad de sabores en sorbetes, conos, paletas, y otros productos que son necesarios en variedad para poder ofrecer a sus clientes.
El manifiesta que con el préstamo anterior pudo realizar una buena inversión de la cual agregó un vendedor más que le ayuda a distribuir en otras zonas de la ciudad, considera que su negocio hoy en día es más rentable y por lo mismo ha mejorado su situación económica y ha podido contribuir a las necesidades del hogar.
texts.en:
Kerin is requesting a new loan so that he can start another investment in his ice cream business. He will buy sorbets in different flavors, cones, popsicles, and other products that he needs to offer variety to his customers.

Kerin said that his previous loan resulted in a good investment. He hired another salesperson to help with distributing products in other parts of the city. Today he considers his business to be more profitable. This has improved his financial situation and he is now able to contribute toward the needs of his household.

loans.use: to buy sorbets, cones, and popsicles.

loans.name: Nidia Esperanza

texts.es: Nidia  Esperanza de 47 años de edad, casada con un hijo menor de edad tiene por actividad económica un librería desde hace catorce años, esta emprendedora inicio con este negocio para tener una herramienta de trabajo propia la cual ha podido sacarla adelante con mucho esfuerzo y perseverancia, Nidia ha demostrado ser responsable y trabajadora de buenas costumbres, en la actualidad Nidia está solicitando el financiamiento para la compra de materiales de librería para el negocio como: cuadernos a rayas, cuadernos cuadriculas, cuaderno doble rayas, cuadernos escribt, lapiceros, crayolas, reglas, papel lustrio,libros de diferentes categorías entre otros.
texts.en:
Nidia is 47 years old, married, and has a young son. Her business is a bookstore that she has managed for 14 years. This entrepreneur started this business as a means of providing a job for herself so that she could get ahead through hard work and perseverance. Nidia has demonstrated responsibility and good work habits.

At the moment, she is requesting a loan in order to buy bookstore merchandise for her business such as single-ruled notebooks, grid notebooks, double-ruled notebooks, journals, ballpoint pens, crayons, rulers, glossy paper, books of different categories, and other items.

loans.use: to buy single-ruled notebooks, grid notebooks, double-ruled notebooks, journals, ballpoint pens, crayons, rulers, glossy paper, books, and other items.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
José, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para realizar la compra de insumos agrícolas como abono, semilla, herbicidas, el pago de mozos para preparar el terreno, esto le servirá para poder iniciar las labores agrícolas en la siembra de pipían.
El manifiesta que con el préstamo anterior logró tener un cultivo muy productivo, con una cosecha sana, de la cual ha logrado mantener a su familia en este periodo, su familia le sigue ayudando apoyándolo para que continúe trabajando.
texts.en:
José is requesting a new loan so that he can buy farming supplies such as compost, seeds, and herbicides. He will also pay hired hands to prepare the land. This will enable him to start the farm work required for planting squash.

José says that his previous loan resulted in a very productive crop and a healthy harvest. This allowed him to sustain his family for this past period. His family continues to offer their support so that he can continue working.

loans.use: to buy compost, seeds, herbicides and to pay for workers.

loans.name: Fermina

texts.es:
Fermina, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo como un recurso de apoyo económico para poder realizar la siembra en 8 tareas de maíz, ella se decidió pues considera que es una buena alternativa para crecer en agricultura ya que se le facilitan los recursos económicos para invertirlo en la compra de insumos como el abono, insecticidas, y mano de obra, pues la temporada está por iniciar y debe comprarse todo lo necesario.
Manifiesta que con el préstamo anterior le permitió comprarse lo necesario para los cerdos trabajando de una mejor manera en la granja, esto le ha ayudado a seguir con su familia y que sus hijos continúen estudiando.
texts.en:
Fermina is requesting a new loan as economic support for planting eight fields of corn.  She believes it is a good alternative way to expand her farming activity, and helps her to buy supplies such as fertilizer and insecticides, and hire workers.  The sowing season is about to begin and she must buy everything she needs.

She claims the previous loan allowed her to buy what she needed to work better on her pig farm, which helped the family, and allowed her children to continue their education.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticides, and hire workers.

loans.name: Luis Orlando

texts.es:
Luis es un hombre de 33 años, se encuentra felizmente casado, vive en la ciudad de Ica, distrito de Santiago con su esposa y su pequeño hijo de 1 año a quienes dedica todos sus esfuerzos para salir adelante; él es una persona muy entusiasta, alegre y trabajador que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por la necesidad de trabajar y solventar sus gastos, no pudo cursar la carrera de mecánica automotriz, pero desea poder hacerlo algún día; en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos y vecinos y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo “Arroz Chaufa” para compartir con su familia.
Gracias a su espíritu emprendedor y al apoyo de su esposa, desde hace 1 años, Luis puso en marcha su pequeño negocio de venta de comida, el brinda desayunos y almuerzos al personal que trabaja en un fundo cercano a su vivienda, él dedica a su negocio un aproximado de 12 horas diarias, en las cuales puede atender un promedio de 25 clientes, él cree que su negocio marcha bien por su buena sazón y trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Luis se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una mototaxi, la cual le servirá para transportarse y cumplir con sus entregas de comida; de esta manera Luis podrá reducir sus gastos de movilidad e incrementar sus ventas, así como sus ingresos económicos, con los cuales poco a poco espera ahorrar el dinero suficiente para poder cumplir su gran sueño de tener un restaurant y su casa propia.
texts.en:
Luis, 33, is happily married and lives in the city of Ica, in the district of Santiago, with his wife and one-year-old son, for whom he works hard to get ahead.  He is very enthusiastic, cheerful and hard-working and has a great desire to become successful.  Unfortunately, he had to get a job to cover expenses and was unable to study auto mechanics, although he would like to some day.  In his free time he enjoys playing soccer with friends and neighbors, and sometimes cooks the delcious rice dish "Arroz Chaufa" to share with family.

Thanks to his enterprising spirit and support from his wife, a year ago Luis set up a small food business.  He offers breakfast and lunch meals to people who work on a large farm near his home.  He works around 12 hours a day and attends to an average 25 customers.  He thinks the business is doing well because he is a good cook and is kind to the clients.

Luis is very grateful to Kiva lenders, because through their help he will be able to buy a motor-taxi to deliver the food.  This will allow him to reduce transport costs and increase sales and income.  He hopes to be able to save enough money to have his own home and a restaurant one day.

loans.use: To buy a motor-taxi.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy corn and firewood.

loans.name: Jose Cesilio

texts.es:
Don Jose tiene 60 años de edad, vive en una aldea de San Marcos Santa Bárbara junto con su esposa y un hijo.
Anteriormente él se dedicaba a realizar trabajos de albañilería y hace 12 años decidió dedicarse a comprar y vender granos básicos como maíz y frijoles para venderlos en la comunidad al detalle. Este producto que vende es comprado a los productores de la zona a un mejor precio, es por eso que le queda buenas ganancias. Este negocio es su fuente de ingresos de donde mantiene a su familia. Ha solicitado varios préstamos, actualmente solicita el quinto préstamo por 6,000 Lempiras, el cual va invertir en la compra de maíz y frijoles para la venta. El quiere  ver su negocio siempre surtido y que las ganancias le ayuden a darle una calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Jose is 60 years of age, and lives in a small village in San Marcos Santa Bárbara with his wife and son.

He used work as a builder, and 12 years ago he decided to start buying and selling basic grains such as corn and beans, to sell them on a retail basis in the community. The products he sells are bought from producers in the area at a lower price, and he therefore makes a good profit. This business is the source of income he uses to provide for his family. 

Jose has requested a number of loans, and this is his fifth. He has requested 6,000 Lempiras, which he will use to by corn and beans to sell. He wants his business to be constantly stocked, and plans to use the profits to provide his family with a good quality of life.

loans.use: To buy corn and beans to supply his business.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es: Claudia  es socia del Bancomunal  Orcasitas II y tiene 60 años de edad. Es casada y madre de 7 hijos y es socia de FINCA Perú hace 17 años. Se dedica a la fabricación de ladrillos. Durante todo este tiempo como socia y gracias a las capacitaciones que recibe en su Bancomunal ella ha aprendido mucho sobre todo a como ahorrar y ser responsable con sus inversiones  financieras. Ella está agradecida con la Institución por todo el apoyo y las facilidades de préstamo que le brindan, ella dice que gracias a ello sus hijos son profesionales, uno de ellos es médico. Su próxima meta es abrir una tienda. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de insumos para la fabricación de ladrillos.
texts.en:
Claudia is partner of the Orcasitas II village bank, and is 60 years of age. She is a married mother of seven children, and has been a partner of FINCA Perú for 17 years. She works making bricks.

Throughout the time that she has been a member, and thanks to the training she receives from her village bank, she has learned a lot about how to save and be responsible with her financial investments. She is grateful to the institution for the support and loan facilities they provide, and says that thanks to this her children are professionals – she has one son who is a doctor. Her next goal is to open a store. She plans to use this loan to buy supplies to make bricks.

loans.use: To buy supplies to make bricks.

loans.name: Kennya Joseth

texts.es: Kennya Joseph tiene  24 años. Su actividad es la venta ofrecer los servicios de cyber. Tiene mucha experiencia en dicha actividad la cual inicio por la necesidad de tener una herramienta de trabajo para poder salir adelanta con su hijo por lo que ha sido muy difícil pero ha logrado superar los desafíos que enfrenta. Este financiamiento es para la compra de muebles para computadora, abanicos, computadoras, mauses, teclados, almohadillas, sillas  cables ya que necesita ofrecerles a sus clientes el mejor servicio. Desea incrementar su inventario y mejorar las condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Kennya Joseph is 24 years of age, and she works offering internet services in an internet café. She has lots of experience in this business, which she started as she needed to work to get ahead with her daughter. It has been very difficult, but she has managed to overcome the difficulties she faced. 

She plans to use this loan to buy computer tables, fans, computers, mice, keyboards, mouepads, chairs and cables, as she needs to provide her customers with the best service. She wants to increase her stock and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy computer tables, fans, computers, mice, keyboards, mousepads, chairs and cables.

loans.name: Liliana Sara

texts.es: Liliana es socia del Bancomunal Los Sauces y tiene 25 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene un hijo varón y es socia de FINCA hace 5 años y medio. Ella tiene dos negocios: es dueña de una cabina del Internet y también tiene un pequeño salón de belleza. Gracias a las capacitaciones que recibe en su Bancomunal ella ha aprendido como ahorrar y a ser solidaria. Le gusta asistir a las reuniones de su Bancomunal porque allí cuenta con la ayuda y apoyo de sus compañeras, y también ella les brinda su ayuda. Ella dice que gracias a FINCA Perú ya ha cumplido con su sueño de tener su propio negocio, pero aún tiene mas metas que desea cumplir. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de materiales para sus negocios como teclados, mouses y monitores para sus cabinas de Internet y tintes, cremas para su salón de belleza.
texts.en:
Liliana, 25, is a member of the communal bank Los Sauces and has belonged to FINCA for five and a half years.  She has a common-law husband and son.  She runs two businesses: an Internet cafe and a small beauty salon.  Thanks to the training received through her communal bank, she has learned to save and be supportive.  She enjoys attending the group meetings because she receives the support and help from the other members and also provides help herself.  

She says that thanks to FINCA Perú she has been able to realize her dream of having her own business.  But she still has goals to reach.  The loan will be used to buy supplies for her Internet business, such as keyboards, monitors, etc., and hair color and creams for the beauty salon.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her Internet business, such as keyboards, monitors, etc., and creams for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Tomas Regalado

texts.es:
Tomás, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo porque considera que necesita dinero para comprarse algunos terneros y también los materiales para iniciar la siembra de maíz y frijol, invertirá específicamente en cuatro terneros, en abono en herbicidas y semílla, dándole este préstamo lo necesario para que él pueda seguir trabajando.
Considera que la inversión anterior le ha ayudado para poder mantener una condición estable con su familia, logró realizar una buena inversión de la que hasta el momento ha recibido solamente beneficio.
texts.en:
Tomás has decided to request a new loan because he needs money to buy calves and supplies to plant corn and beans.  Specifically, he will buy four calves, fertilizer, weed killer and seeds; so this loan is providing what he needs to continue working.

He feels the previous investment helped provide stability for his family, so it was a good one and has been beneficial.

loans.use: To buy four calves, fertilizer and weed killer.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy es socia del Bancomunal  Orcasitas II y tiene 33 años de edad, es casada y  madre de 3 hijos, y es socia de FINCA Perú hace 12 años. Se dedica a la fabricación de ladrillos. Ella está agradecida con la institución  porque gracias  a las capacitaciones que recibe en su Bancomunal ha tenido la educación financiera que necesitaba  y también aprendió a ser responsable y sobre todo a ahorrar. Su sueño es brindarles un mejor futuro a sus hijos. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de insumos para la fabricación de ladrillos como la arcilla.
texts.en:
Nancy is a member of Bancomunal Orcasitas II.  She is 33 years old, she is married, she has three children, and she has been a member of FINCA Peru for 12 years.  She makes bricks.  She is thankful to the institution because thanks to the training she received from Bancomunal, she got the financial education she needed and learned to be responsible with money and to save money.

Her dream is to provide a better future for her children.  The loan she is seeking will be used to buy supplies for the making of clay bricks.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for making clay bricks.

loans.name: Paula Natalia

texts.es: Paula es socia del Bancomunal  Orcasitas II y tiene 70 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijos, y es socia de FINCA Perú hace un año. Es dueña de una chacra y se dedica a la siembra y cosecha de alfalfa y de una variedad de legumbres, que luego trae al mercado local para venderlos. Durante todo este tiempo de experiencia trabajando con FINCA Perú  las lecciones más destacadas que ella ha aprendido son las de la responsabilidad y la puntualidad. Su sueño es comprar ganado para que también pueda vender su carne en el mercado al lado de sus otros productos. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de semillas y materiales necesarias para la siembra de sus productos.
texts.en: Paula is a member of the Orcasitas II communal bank. She is 70 years old and the single mother of two children. She has been a member of FINCA Perú for a year. She is the owner of some cropland and she plants and harvests alfalfa and  a variety of vegetables. Later, she brings it to the local market to sell. During all of the time she has been working with FINCA Perú, the lessons that have stood out the most for her have been the ones about responsibility and punctuality. Her dream is to buy cattle so that she can also sell their meat in the market with her other products.The loan she is asking for is to invest in buying seeds and the materials she needs to plant her products.

loans.use: to buy seeds and materials necessary to plant her crops.

loans.name: Betzabeth

texts.es: Betzabeth es socia del Bancomunal  Orcasitas II y tiene 24 años de edad. Es conviviente y tiene un hijo varón. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 4 años y se dedica a la fabricación de ladrillos. Ella dice que FINCA Perú le enseñó a ahorrar, trabajar, y no gastar las ganancias., que su experiencia ha sido  muy buena porque aprendió a ser responsable. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá para la compra de materiales e insumos para la fabricación de ladrillos.
texts.en: Betzabeth is a member of Bancomunal Orcasitas II.  She is 24 years old.  She is married and has a son.  She has been a member of FINCA Peru for 4 years and her job is to make bricks.  She says that FINCA Peru taught her how to save money, how to work, and how to avoid spending her income.  Her experience has been a good one because she learned to be responsible.  The loan she is seeking will be spent on the purchase of materials and supplies for the making of bricks.

loans.use: to buy materials and supplies for the making of bricks.

loans.name: Sarabia Juana

texts.es: Sarabia es socia del Bancomunal  Orcasitas II y tiene 26 años de edad .Es conviviente y tiene un hijo varón. Ella es socia de FINCA Perú hace 8 años y se dedica a la compra y venta de tara (planta medicinal). Su experiencia como socia de FINCA Perú ha sido muy buena, gracias a su oportunidad de aprender con las capacitaciones de su Bancomunal sobre la importancia de los ahorros y la puntualidad. Ya tiene 16 años emprendiendo en su negocio y su sueño es tener una casa propia. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de tara.
texts.en: Sarabia is a member of the Orcasitas II communal bank. She is 26 years old. She lives with someone and has a son. She has been a member of FINCA Perú for 8 years and she buys and sells tara ( a medicinal plant). Her experience as a member of FINCA Perú has been very good, thanks to the opportunity to learn from her communal bank about the importance of savings and punctuality. She has worked at her business for 16 years and her dream is to have her own house.The loan she is asking for will be invested to buying tara.

loans.use: to buy tara (a medicinal plant) to sell at her business.

loans.name: Anda Yolanda

texts.es: Anda Yolanda tiene 56 años, tiene un  negocio que es una pulpería. En la cual tiene mucha experiencia ya ha tenido créditos anteriores con león 2000 y gracias al apoyo que le han brindado es que ha podido que su pulpería sea rentable porque le invierte constantemente, en la actualidad el financiamiento lo quiere para comprar productos de consumo diario como: pan, mantequillas, huevos, leche, cuajadas, tiste, arroz, azúcar, frijoles,
texts.en: Anda Yolanda is 56 years old and has her own small grocery store.  She has a lot of experience managing her store and she has had previous loans.  Thanks to the support that she has received, she has been able to keep her store profitable because she is constantly investing.  With this financing she will buy daily consumer products such as bread, butter, eggs, milk, curd, tiste, rice, sugar, and beans.

loans.use: to buy bread, butter, eggs, milk, curd, tiste, rice, sugar, and beans.

loans.name: Inocenta

texts.es: Inocenta es socia del Bancomunal  Orcasitas II y tiene 51 años de edad. Es casada, y tiene un hijo varón de 21 años. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 4 años y se dedica a la siembra, cosecha, y venta de cereales como trigo, alverja, y linaza. Ella está muy agradecida con la Institución por todo el apoyo que le brinda y porque se solidarizan con ella. Su sueño es progresar al lado de su familia y tener u futuro mejor. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de materias para la fabricación de ladrillos y en abrir una tienda de abarrotes donde podrá vender lo que cosecha también.
texts.en: Inocenta is a member of the Orcasitas II communal bank. She is 51 years old, married and has a 21 year old son. She has been a member of FINCA Perú for 4 years. She works planting, harvesting and selling cereal grains such as wheat, peas, and linseed. She is very grateful to the institution for all of the support that it has offered her and because it supports her. Her dream is to progress with her family and have a better future. The loan she is asking for will be invested in buying materials to make bricks and to open a little grocery store where she can sell her harvest as well.

loans.use: to buy materials to make bricks.

loans.name: María Pricila

texts.es:
La señora María tiene 55 años de edad, es madre soltera de tres hijos. Ella lleva un año dedicándose a la compra y venta de ganado. Todos los días miércoles ella se traslada al tiangue que esta a unos 12 kilómetros del lugar donde vive a comprar el ganado. Como son varias personas las que van a comprar al tiangue pagan un camión para trasladar los animales a sus casas. 

Doña Maria solicita el préstamo para comprar dos terneros, para darles mantenimiento hasta que se desarrollen como bueyes. Luego ella podrá proporcionar sus servicios a los agricultores con los bueyes y recibir nuevos ingresos. Ella desea que su negocio siga aumentando el número de animales, ya que de los que tiene una parte es para el negocio y la otra los mantiene más tiempo para ella.
texts.en:
María is 55 years old.  She is a single mother with three children.  For one year she has been buying and selling livestock.  Every Wednesday she travels to a market, some 12 kilometers from her home, to buy livestock.  As there are a few of them who travel to the market, they pay a truck to transport the animals  back to their homes.

María is requesting a loan to buy two calves.  She will care for them until they grow up into oxen and then she will be able to provide their services to farmers and make new income.  She would to continue increasing the number of animals she has for her business as some of the animals she keeps are for her business and the rest she keeps longer for herself.

loans.use: to buy two calves

loans.name: Otilia

texts.es: Otilia es socia del Bancomunal Pacaycasa y tiene 39 años de edad. Es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos: una mujercita de 16 años y un hijo varón de 9 años. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 20 años. Es dueña de una tienda y también se dedica a la fabricación de ladrillos. Ella dice que empezó desde cero y que ahora tiene su negocio y 2 carros. Está agradecida con la Institución porque le enseñó a saber invertir en su negocio y sobre todo a respetarse ella misma como mujer. Su sueño es seguir ahorrando más para brindarle un mejor futuro a su familia. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en una campaña de Tara (planta medicinal).
texts.en: Otilia is a member of the Pacycasa community bank.  She is 39 years old, lives with her partner, and has two children: a 16-year-old girl and a 9-year-old boy.  She has been a member of FINCA Peru for 20 years.  Otilia owns a store and also makes bricks.  She says that she started from scratch and now has a business and two cars.  She is grateful to the institution because they taught her how to invest in her business and, above all, how to respect herself as a woman.  Otilia's dream is to continue saving further so that she can provide her family with a better future.  She will invest the loan she is requesting in buying tara (a medicinal plant).

loans.use: to buy 'tara' (a medicinal plant) to sell

loans.name: Ana Luz

texts.es:
Ana es una mujer de 37 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Santiago con su esposo y sus 4 hijos, cuyas edades oscilan entre los 2, 8, 11 y 18 años; ella siempre ha sido una persona muy trabajadora, entusiasta y emprendedora, dedicada junto con su esposo a sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado poder estudiar la carrera de secretariado;  en sus ratos libre le gusta relajarse escuchando un poco de música y en algunas ocasiones cocina una riquísima “Carapulcra con Sopa Seca” para engreír a su familia. 
Con mucho empeño y gracias al apoyo de su familia, Ana se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y al mismo tiempo se dedica a la agricultura, ella cuenta con un pequeño terreno donde cultiva algodón; Ana labora en las mañanas vendiendo abarrotes y con el apoyo de su esposo e hijos pueden turnarse para atender las labores de su cultivo.
Ana se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir los gastos de abono (fertilizantes) y de riego de su cultivo, así cuando la cosecha de su cultivo terminé, podrá obtener buenas ganancias de las ventas realizadas, favoreciendo de esta manera a que poco a poco Ana cumpla su gran sueño de poder asegurar el bienestar y futuro de sus hijos, para que sean buenos profesionales y hombres de bien.
texts.en:
Ana is a 37-year-old woman who lives in the city of Ica, in Santiago district, together with her husband and four children who are 2, 8, 11 and 18 years old.  Ana has always been a very hard-working, keen, entrepreneurial woman who, together with her husband, is committed to providing for her family.  Sadly, as her family lacked financial resources, she was not able to study for a degree.  She would have liked to have studied for a secretarial qualification.  In her free time, Ana enjoys relaxing, listening to a little music and, sometimes, she cooks a delicious dish called 'carapulcra con sopa seca' to spoil her family.  

With a lot of determination and thanks to the support of her family, Ana works selling groceries. In addition, she also farms.  She has a small plot of land where she grows cotton.  Ana sells groceries in the mornings and, with the help of her husband and children, they are able to take it in shifts to carry out the farming work.

Ana is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their help, she will be able to cover the cost of buying fertilizers and irrigating her crops.  This means that when she harvests her crops, she will be able to make good profits on her sales.  In this way, Ana will gradually be able to fulfill her dream of guaranteeing her children's well-being and future so that they become good professionals and upstanding citizens.

loans.use: to cover the cost of buying fertilizer and irrigating her crops

loans.name: Puka Pukayoc  De Pachar Group

texts.es:
Un grupo de vecinos y amigos formaron el banco comunal “Puka Pukayoc  de Pachar” en la comunidad de Pachar distrito de Ollanytaytambo de la provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco. Este banco comunal está conformado por personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las actividades económicas de los socios son por ejemplo; compra y venta de gallinas, crianza de animales menores como cuyes y chanchos, compra y venta de frutas. Otros socios brindan servicios asistencia de salud y construcción de casas.  

(La señora Brígida está levantando la mano en la fotografía). La socia Brígida nació en la comunidad de Pachar y vive en la misma comunidad de Pachar, ella tiene 48 años de edad y es casada y fruto de unión tiene cuatro hijos. Su actividad económica principal de la Brígida es la agricultura y crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas. Ya son cinco varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad Brígida requiere el préstamo para comprar animales menores cuyes.  
 
Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos. (La socia que aparece en la parte inferior de la fotografía llego tarde a la reunión del banco comunal).

Cusco está ubicado en el distrito y provincia del Cusco del departamento del Cusco en pleno corazón de la antigua ciudad de los Incas y se caracteriza por ser una zona turística por sus centros arqueológicos por su centro histórico por sus paisajes por su historia y siendo una ciudad encantadora de la Región del Sur del país. Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
A group of neighbors and friends formed the Communal Bank "Puka Pukayoc de Pachar" in the community of Pachar in the District of Ollantaytambo, Urubamba Province, Department of Cusco. This Communal Bank consists of individuals who view each moment as an opportunity to get ahead, so they strive each day to provide a better future for their children. The business activities of these members include buying and selling chickens, raising small animals such as guinea pigs and pigs, and buying and selling fruits. Other members provide health services and build houses.

Sra. Brigida (who has her hand raised in the photo) was born in the community of Pachar and still lives there. She is 48 years old, married, and has four children. Her main business activities are farming and raising small animals such as guinea pigs and chickens. Brigida has been in these businesses for five years and has done very well. She is taking this opportunity to request a loan in order to buy small animals, such as guinea pigs.

The members are grateful for the opportunity that has been provided and promise to complete their various payments according to the established terms. (The member who appears in the smaller photo arrived late to the Communal Bank meeting.)

Cusco is located in the District and Province of Cusco in the Department of Cusco. The heart of this ancient city of the Incas is where many archaeological sites are located. The historical center and the landscapes help make Cusco the most enchanting city in the southern region of Peru. Cusco is known for being a tourist and commercial area. It is also known for the traditional festival of Inti Raymi and for being the home of one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machu Picchu.

loans.use: to buy small animals, such as guinea pigs.

loans.name: Dominga Clementina

texts.es:
Dominga sigue con su comercio de venta de ropa, zapatos, cosmeticos, siendo de apoyo en su hogar, hoy en dia, ah aumentado sus ventas, captado mas clientela al ofrecer mas productos con los prestamo obtenidos en Afodenic, siendo el ochenta por ciento para infraestructura. Su esposo tambien continua comprando y vendiendo ganado.
Dominga ha venido mejorando su casa, logrando mejor comodidad, con este nuevo prestamo sera para poner pantry en su pequeña cocina, y ceramica, teniendo una mejor higiene y mejor ambiente para el bien comun de la familia.
texts.en:
Dominga continues working in her business selling clothing, shoes and cosmetics which helps support her household.  Her sales have increased and she has been able to gain more customers because she has more products to sell as a result of the loans she has obtained from Afodenic. 80% is for infrastructure.  Dominga's husband also continues buying and selling livestock.

Dominga has been improving her home and providing her family with better comfort.  She will use this new loan to fit a small kitchen and lay tiles so that she can enjoy better hygiene and a better environment for the good of her family.

loans.use: to fit and tile a kitchen so that she can enjoy better comfort and hygiene

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es:
Luz es una mujer de 46 años, vive en la ciudad de Pisco, caracterizada por sus hermosas playas y clima cálido; por diversas circunstancias desde hace muchos años Luz tomó la decisión de separarse de su pareja, desde entonces ella se dedicó por completo a sus 2 hijos, quienes gracias a sus esfuerzos logró sacar adelanta, ahora ellos son mayores de edad y cada uno tiene su propia familia. 
Gracias a su espíritu emprendedor y con mucho entusiasmo, desde hace mas de 4 años Luz trabaja brindando servicios de taxi, así también en algunas ocasiones alquila su vehículo a otros choferes, ella se encuentra a gusto con el trabajo que realiza, ya que desde muy joven ha realizado diversos trabajos y ahora a pesar de su edad ella siente la necesidad de seguir siendo una persona útil, trabajadora y perseverante.
Luz se encuentra muy a gusto con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mantenimiento general y la compra de accesorios para su vehículo; de esta manera Luz podrá contar con un auto en mejores condiciones y podrá brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes e incrementará sus ingresos económicos y así con ellos poco a poco espera poder culminar la construcción total de su vivienda para poder alquilar habitaciones, para con esos ingresos poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su querida madre, quien esta bajo su cuidado.
texts.en:
Luz is a woman who is 46 years old and lives in the city of Pisco, which is known for its beautiful beaches and warm climate. Many years ago, due to various circumstances, Luz made the decision to separate from her partner. Since then, she has been completely devoted to her two children. Thanks to her efforts, she has been able to move forward. Her children are now adults and have their own families.

With an enterprising spirit and great enthusiasm, Luz has been providing taxi services for the past four years. On a few occasions, she rents out her vehicle to other drivers. She enjoys what she does and has worked in a number of jobs since she was a young woman. Despite her age, Luz still feels the need to be a useful, hardworking, and persevering individual.

Luz is glad to know that the Kiva lenders are out there. Thanks to the support that they will provide, she will be able to pay for general maintenance and also buy accessories for her vehicle. This will help her have a car that is in better condition, thus allowing her to provide better service to her customers and giving her a chance to earn more income. Over time, she hopes to completely finish the construction of her home so that she can rent out rooms. The additional income will improve the quality of life for her beloved mother who is under her care.

loans.use: to buy accessories for her vehicle and to pay for general maintenance.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, soap, shampoo, detergents and beverages for her store.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 51 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Editha runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her store.

Editha has been in this business for seven years. She sells a variety of items such as soap, sugar, milk, coffee, canned goods, soft drinks, etc. 

In the future, Editha would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Sodbileg

texts.en:
Mr. Sodbileg is 30 years old and lives with his wife, daughter and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Since his family does not have their own housing yet, they live in a rental apartment. His daughter attends primary school. 

Since 2008, Mr. Sodbileg has been operating a retail business selling mobile phones in a small stall. At his stall, he sells mobile phones to local residents. 

Mr. Sodbileg works hard and is known to be very friendly to his customers. Compared to the other stalls around him at the market, Mr. Sodbileg's mobile phones are of better quality. He also sells a wider variety of mobile phone model choices. 

He has been successfully expanding his business and was able to improve his living conditions gradually. He says, "I wish to have own apartment next year, because to live in a rental apartment is very hard." 

In order to increase the variety of mobile phones for his customers, Mr. Sodbileg is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan.

loans.use: to buy mobile phones for his retail business.

loans.name: Suta Pertiwi Group

texts.en:
The Suta Pertiwi Group is located in the village of Melaya, West Bali. Most of the inhabitants work as farmers who are today contending with a dry season. This requires them to find different types of plants suitable for the dry season to increase their income. 

The group plants beans and other types of crops. They need additional funds to purchase seeds and fertilizers. So, nine men who have similar businesses have joined together in a group to apply for a loan.

In addition to receiving venture capital loans, they also have received training from MUK.

The Suta Pertiwi Group is led by Wayan. He will use the loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers. With this loan, he hopes he can cultivate the land properly in order to produce the maximum results to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
This is Adelaida, age 56, who is a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite City, Philippines. A widow, she is the mother of three children, one of whom is working while the other two stay at home. She and her children manage their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.                             

Adelaida maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller Life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealers' prices are lower than those in the catalog, and this is how they make their profit. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community members. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operating her business, Adelaida is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000. She will be utilizing the loan to buy orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Adelaida dreams of being able to give all her children a good and high-quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies. 
 
* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group comprises 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional merchandise needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, soap, shampoo and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, soap, shampoo, rice, spices and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, soap, shampoo and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, soap, spices, rice and beverages

loans.name: Lewelyn

texts.en:
This is Lewelyn, 39, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Cesar, and a mother to a three children; two of whom are in high school, while the youngest is still in elementary grade. By the grace of God, she has managed to support their daily expenses. 

Lewelyn has operated a farm for almost 7 years now. She plants seasonal fruits that are native to the Philippines like pineapples, peanuts, bananas and other Filipino fruit staples which are grown mostly in the south region of Luzon. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy fertilizers, seeds and other tools for maintenance of the farm. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Lewelyn dreams to be able to send all her children to college. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for farming materials and other supplies needed in her business

loans.name: Saniman

texts.en:
Saniman owns a mobile phone counter and a small shop. At his mobile phone counter, he sells prepaid cell phone airtime. Ruma Pulsa (or Ruma's prepaid airtime) is one of the products he sells along with sim cards and some grocery items. He is married and has four kids. Their age range is very wide, from a 9-year-old to a 29-year-old. 

The reason why Saniman wants to become a Loket Ruma agent is because he has been in Ruma's network for quite some time. He sees that with this new product, he will be able to earn more income for the family. With the EDC machine, Saniman hopes that his shop will be able to be the payment point for electricity bills, motorcycle installment payments, water bills, credit card bills, and train tickets. So, his shop will have more services to offer to the customer.

loans.use: To pay for a deposit on an electronic data capture (EDC) machine for his bill payment business

loans.name: Rahmat

texts.en:
Rahmat is one of Ruma's micro enterpreneurs that has a small shop in Serang. Serang itself is about a one or one and half hour drive from Jakarta. In Serang, he is not only selling Ruma's prepaid cell phone airtime but also sells a couple of types of fertilizers. He is married and has one child. 

By becoming a Loket Ruma agent, Rahmat is expecting to become a payment point. Meaning that he will be using the EDC machine to provide a bill payment service in his shop. He is hoping that people (old and new customers) will come to him to pay their motorcycle installments, electricity bills (prepaid and post-paid), land-line phone bills, and Internet bills. In the end he is hoping that by becoming a Loket Ruma agent, his business will expand.

loans.use: To pay for a deposit on an electronic data capture (EDC) machine for his bill payment business

loans.name: Lkhagvasuren

texts.en:
Lkhagvasuren is a 38-year-old married man and lives with his wife, son and daughter in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. The family lives in a small house which is located in the outer ger district and lacks the basic infrastructure of the city. 

Lkhagvasuren supports his family by operating small grocery store at the local outer ger district. Today he has 2.8 million MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) in working capital. With his last few years' profit he built the small house where the family currently lives. In the future he plans to enlarge his store and increase his working capital more. 

So he s requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase a variety of goods to sell at his store in order to enlarge and improve his store in the future.

loans.use: to buy a variety of goods to sell in his store during the summer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of rice and rice hulls to sell

loans.name: Reyner

texts.es:
Reyner tiene 29 años, es un joven soltero que vive con su madre. Su casa es propia y se ubicada en la comunidad cafetalera de Sanchirio.

Desde que cumplió 20 años decidió independizarse económicamente y dedicarse a la agricultura como principal fuente de ingresos. Sus principales productos son el café y los plátanos; y en todo este tiempo dedicado al cuidado de sus terrenos pudo conseguir muchas cosas; como comprar su propio terreno, por lo que pudo invertir mayor capital para sus siembras. Sin embargo, lo que más le gusta es vender su producción, pues ve el fruto de sus esfuerzos. Así también, gracias a su empeño, logró comprar una moto con la que puede desplazarse con facilidad hacia sus terrenos de cultivos.

Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP y agradece la confianza depositada en él. A su vez, siente que con su banco comunal “Progreso del Palomar” logrará con mayor facilidad sus objetivos.
Reyner invertirá este dinero en la compra de bolsas de abono para fertilizar sus cultivos de café y para pagar a los jornaleros, quienes lo apoyarán en estas cansadas labores.
texts.en:
Reyner is 29 years old. He is a single young man who lives with his mother. Reyner owns his house, which is located in the coffee-growing community of Sanchirio.

When he turned 20, Reyner decided to become financially independent, so he dedicated himself to agriculture as his primary source of income. His main products are coffee and bananas. Throughout this entire time, he has devoted himself to taking care of the land that has produced many things. With the land that he purchased, Reyner was able to invest more capital into his crops. However, what he enjoys most is selling what he produces because he can see the fruit of his efforts. Thanks to his hard work, he was also able to buy a motorcycle so that he can travel easily to different plots of land where his crops are located.

This is his second loan with MFP and he is grateful for the trust that has been demonstrated to him. In addition, he believes his Communal Bank "Progeso del Palomar" will be able to accomplish its goals rather easily. Reyner will invest the money in bags of compost so that he can fertilize his coffee crops. He will also pay the workers who help with the backbreaking labor.

loans.use: to buy compost and to pay his workers.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
This is Rowena, 39, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Luisito, an OFW, and mother to their three children. She, together with her children, manages their household while operating the business. She works hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Rowena operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which sells groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighbourhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, five peso's-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbours and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Rowena hopes to be able to expand soon. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El comité Kuña Guapa, se formo a partir del contacto con una de las miembros quien al enterarse del programa invito a sus vecinas muchas de ellas comerciantes a formar parte del grupo. Ellas trabajan unidas y se ayudan en todo lo que pueden para de esa forma mejorar sus vidas.
Mirna es la presidenta del grupo, y comenta que se dedica a la venta ambulante de todo tipo de productos, como ser sabanas, frazadas, y demás tipos de productos. Mirna cuenta que en todo lo que hace siempre trata de motivar a sus amigas para seguir dentro del grupo, el cual les es de mucha ayuda.
Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de sabanas, frazadas y demás productos para venderlos, y de esa forma poder seguir creciendo como microempresaria.
texts.en:
The 'Kuña Guapa' committee was formed when one of its members found out about the program and invited her neighbors (many of whom are saleswomen) to join the group.  The ladies work together and help each other as much as they can so that they can improve their lives.

Mirna is the group's president and she says that she sells all kinds of products, including sheets and blankets, as an itinerant vendor.  Mirna says that she is always trying to motivate her friends to remain within the group as it is very helpful.  She is requesting this loan to buy sheets, blankets and other products to sell.  This will enable her to continue growing as a micro-businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy sheets, blankets, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy animal feed for pigs.

loans.name: Ehouédé Émilienne

texts.fr: Ehouédé Émilienne est âgée de 23 ans et est mariée à un certain Sylvestre. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Ehouédé Émilienne a arrêté l'école au niveau secondaire. Ehouédé Émilienne vit avec ses enfants. Ehouédé Émilienne vient en aide à son mari en supportant avec lui les diverses charges familiales. Depuis sept ans, Ehouédé Émilienne mène comme activité la vente de poissons dans sa région. Par contre Ehouédé Émilienne achète ses produits dans une autre région du Bénin. C’est la cinquième fois que Ehouédé Émilienne sollicite auprès de ALIDé un crédit, crédit qui lui servira à élever le niveau de son activité et à mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Ehouédé Émilienne is 23 years old and married to a man named Sylvestre. They have two children, both in school and in their care. Ehouédé Émilienne dropped out of secondary school. She lives with her children. She helps out her husband in covering the diverse household expenses. 

For seven years, she has been selling fish in her region. But she purchases her products from another region of Benin. 

This is the fifth time that Ehouédé Émilienne has requested a loan from ALIDé. It will serve to boost her business and to satisfy her customers further. The previous loans have indeed been paid back.

loans.use: to buy fish

loans.name: Mujeres Al Poder Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo está integrado por 20 mujeres, todas ellas amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad, que vieron una gran oportunidad, no solo para ellas sino también para sus familias.
Adolfina es una de las miembros de este grupo, y ella nos comenta que con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo ha ido creciendo y mejorando su negocio de venta de zapatos. Ella es una persona que tiene muy buena onda a la hora de hacer sus ventas, es por ello que tiene ya una clientela bien definida. Su meta es poder tener una gran zapatería y de esa forma ir creciendo. Solicita el crédito para la compra de calzados, para hombres y mujeres, y de esa forma estar siempre con mucha variedad que poder ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
This group, from the city of Coronel Oviedo, is comprised of 20 women who are all friends and neighbors of this city. They saw a great opportunity, not only for themselves, but also for their families.

Adolfina is one of the group's members. She tells us that with sacrifice and effort, she has been growing and improving her shoe sales business. She is a person with a great spirit when she does her job, and therefore she has a well-defined customer base. Her goal is to be able to have a large shoe store and, in this way, to continue growing. She is requesting this loan to buy men's and women's shoes. This way, she will always have a large variety to offer to her customers.

loans.use: to buy men's and women's shoes

loans.name: Ysapy Group

texts.es:
4 mujeres de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso se unieron con la esperanza de poder crecer, no solo en lo económico, sino también en lo personal. Son mujeres jefas de familia que luchan por sus hijos, para poder darles todo lo que necesitan para una vida sin privaciones.
Gladys es parte del grupo, y cuenta que se dedica a la venta de comestibles de todo tipo que ella misma prepara. Comenta que tiene una buena clientela, ya que tiene muy buena sazón.  Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de carne, condimento, verduras y demás productos para poder seguir ofreciendo alimentos frescos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Fourteen women from the city of Mariano Roque Alonso joined together in the hope of making progress not only from a financial point of view but also from a personal point of view.  They are all heads of household who work hard for their children so that they can give them everything they need in order to live a life without hardship.

Gladys is a member of this group and she tells us that her business is selling all kinds of food that she prepares herself.  She says that she has a good customer base because the food she prepares is very tasty.  She is requesting this loan to buy meat, seasonings, vegetables and other products so that she can continue offering fresh food to her customers.

loans.use: to buy meat, seasonings, vegetables and other food products

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es: La Sra. Rosario  tiene 56 años y es soltera, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad como abarrotes, fideo, arroz y azúcar, su tienda se encuentran ubicado en la zona Libertad, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Rosario  va a usar este préstamo de para compra de abarrotes por mayor como fideo, arroz y azúcar y así de esta manera incrementar su capital de trabajo,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir ampliando su  negocio, la Sra.  Rosario va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando mercadería y así mejorando sus ingresos, su deseo para su negocio es tener una amplia gama de productos de primera necesidad.
texts.en: Rosario is 56 years old and single.  Her business is selling basic household products such as groceries, noodles, rice and sugar.  Her store is located in Libertad district.  This loan is her second one from the institution.  Rosario will use her loan to buy groceries such as noodles, rice and sugar wholesale so that she can increase her working capital.  She is requesting this loan so that she can continue expanding her business.  Rosario will use the profits to continue buying merchandise and thereby continue improving her income.  Her wish for her business is to have a wide range of basic household products in stock.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, soap, etc.

loans.name: Joey

texts.en:
This is Joey, he previously availed a loan of 12,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) that he used to buy spare parts and accessories and to maintain his jeepney unit. His earnings were a big help in the education of his child and in his personal household and business expenditures. 

He would like to apply for a PHP15,000 loan in order to buy spare parts and to maintain his jeepney unit as well as to buy some equipment in the repair shop. The profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain his daily needs and to pay for the educational expenses of his child. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart. 

Joey dreams to be able to buy another jeepney. He also dreams that his child will finish their education. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from his study of the Word of God.*

Curiously, jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines to throw off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn and they modified the Jeep into a 20-seater jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for everyday travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, jeepneys are one of the things that makes the Philippines truly Philippines.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and maintain a jeepney.

loans.name: Badriddin

texts.en:
Badriddin is a hardworking man who is married and has five children. The children are still small. The eldest is 10 years old and the youngest is 8 months. 

Badriddin goes to Russia to work each year in the season. Arriving home in the off-season, he deals with cattle breeding and agriculture. He mainly grows wheat, potatoes and other agricultural products. For over eight years he has been in this business. His caring wife helps him in business. The resulting crops he sells to local citizens. 

He would like to get a loan for purchasing mineral fertilizers and he also wants to buy cattle in order to increase the number of livestock.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizers and cattle.

loans.name: Suisala

texts.en:
Suisala is 29 years old and married. She has four children. 

She owns and operates a small store, selling items such as packs of chicken, mutton flaps, sausages, sack of sugar, etc. She has been doing this for two years.  

Suisala needs a loan to buy boxes of chicken, soft drinks, snacks, sugar, rice and noodles. She hopes to use her profits to expand her shop. She became a member of SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to purchase box of chicken, soft drinks, snacks, sugar, rice and noodles.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia is a 26-year-old married woman with six children.
 
She has a small plantation and grows vegetables to earn a living. She has been doing this for one year. Amelia has requested a loan to buy vegetable seeds, gloves and a wheelbarrow for her garden.

She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. With her profits, Amelia hopes to improve her business.
