Loans from Kos Invest to the Roma Community in Kosovo, have helped to improve their life and business. They have had the opportunity to improve their different businesses and to create working environments. The area looks different from the way it looked before. 

One of the people who has benefited, is Hidajete and her family. She is married and is a mother of five children. She bought a cultivator with the loan. She also works together with her husband to transport various items, such as construction materials and other items that are needed in their community. They also collect metals and plastics in order to sell them. Her children are also involved in this business. They are very happy to have the possibility of getting a loan as they have the chance to improve their living conditions and have healthy food.

loans.use: to buy a cultivator.

loans.name: Grâce De Dieu Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GRÂCE DE DIEU est formé de quatre personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Le représentant de ce groupe, nommé Symplice Codjo, est celui dont la main est levée sur la photo. Symplice Codjo est âgée de 41 ans et a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Symplice Codjo est marié à un certain Léa. Le couple a quatre enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Symplice Codjo vit ensemble avec ses enfants et sa femme. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la maison. Pour  faire face à ses différentes charges, Symplice Codjo cultive divers produits alimentaires (choux, carottes, légumes), qu'il met en vente dans sa région. Symplice Codjo exerce cette activité depuis près de quinze ans. Symplice Codjo s’approvisionne dans un marché du Benin. Dans le souci de renforcer davantage son activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Symplice Codjo désire augmenter le stock de ses produits. Pour ce faire, Symplice Codjo sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe GRÂCE DE DIEU, un crédit auprès de ALIDé
texts.en: The Grace of God group is made up of four people from the same neighborhood.  The representative, named Symplice Codjo, has his hand raised in the photo.  Symplice Codjo is 41 years old and left school at the primary level.  He is married to a woman named Léa and the couple has four children, all in school and under their care.  Symplice Codjo lives with his wife and children, and the couple share the household expenses.  To meet their expenses, he cultivates various food products (cabbage, carrots, vegetables), which he sells in the area.  He has been in this business for almost 15 years.  Symplice Codjo buys his supplies at a market in Benin.  With the goals of strengthening his business and better responding to his customers' needs, he would like to increase his stock.  To do this, he and the other members of the Grace of God group are requesting a loan through ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy seeds, insecticides, and fertilizers.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en: Elvira is from Kosovo. She is married and is a mother of two children. She lives in a Serbian Community. Elvira is a regular client of KosInvest. She started with a small store selling clothes and by taking loans from KosInvest her business has expanded, and she is planning expand it further. Elvira’s business is the main source of income for her family. She also plans to expand her family because now she has better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Zorica

texts.en: Zorica is from Kosovo. She is married and is a mother of three children. She lives in a Serbian Community. Zorica is requesting a new loan to buy a range of coffees, beverages, refrigerated food and other things for her small grocery shop. These purchases will help her to better meet the needs of her customers from all communities in her village. She hopes that the loan will assist her in increasing the size of her shop and improving her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy goods to sell.

loans.name: Hisni

texts.en: Hisni is from Kosovo and is the married father of four children. Hisni‘s main business is selling fresh milk, cheese and other dairy products made with goat milk at the central market in the area. He has been in this business for a long time. He started with one goat and through loans from KosInvest he managed to expand the number of goats. Hisni hopes to continue improving his living conditions and ensuring better education for his children.

loans.use: to buy goats.

loans.name: Armando

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 2 filhos que ainda frequentam Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta sua mãe enviando algum valor para ajudar nas despesas de casa. 	
Trabalha como professor e quadro do Ministério da Educação, com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (ferro, cimento, areia, pedra, janelas e outros) para remodelar a sua casa e o salão de cabeleireiro.
No futuro deseja terminar a sua faculdade e concluir a sua casa, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é obter um financiamento suficiente para poder cobrir com seus encargos.
texts.en:
Armando is married and the father of 2 children who still attend School, lives in his own home with his family and supports his mother by sending her some money to help with household expenses.

He works as a tenured teacher with the Ministry of Education and with this loan he plans to buy construction material (iron, cement, sand, stone, windows and other) to remodel his house and his hair salon.

In future, Armando hopes to finish university and finish building his house. To this end, he commits to duly paying off his loan so that he can solicit further loans from Hluvuku. 

His challenge is to obtain enough funding to be able to cover his responsibilities.

loans.use: buy construction material (iron, cement, sand, stone, windows and other) to remodel his house and his hair salon.

loans.name: Leonel

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 2 filhos ainda frequentam Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém. 	
Trabalha como motorista numa empresa privada, com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (varões de ferro, cimento, pá, carinha de mão e outros) para construir o murro de vedação da sua casa.
No futuro pretende construir outra casa no outro terreno, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é trabalhar ainda mais para aumentar a sua renda mensal e garantir um futuro melhor para os filhos.
texts.en:
Leonel is married and the father of 2 children who still attend School, lives in his own house with his family and doesn't support anyone else.

He works as a driver for a private company and with this loan he plans to buy construction materials (iron rods, cement, shovel, wheelbarrow and others) to build a wall around his house.

In future, Leonel intends to build another house on another piece of land and to this end, he commits to duly paying off his loan so that he can solicit further loans from Hluvuku. 

His challenge is to work even harder in order to increase his monthly income and guarantee a better future for his children.

loans.use: buy construction materials (iron rods, cement, shovel, wheelbarrow and others) to build the wall around his house.

loans.name: Zipporah

texts.en:
Zipporah is married and a mother of two children. They are both school-aged children who are dependent upon her. Zipporah has a well-known fast food business where she offers her customers and neighbors, flat bread, beans, cooked rice and soft drinks. She also has a delivery service for customers who request that her products be delivered to their homes.

Zipporah has been doing this work for 3 years, providing her customers with excellent service. She is a person who has a strong desire to get ahead and to help her family through her work.

Zipporah is requesting a loan to do some repairs to her business premises and to purchase more chairs and tables. This will allow her to provide more comfortable service to her customers. She appreciates Yehu Microfinance and Kiva for the help that she is receiving.

loans.use: to do some repairs to her business premises and purchase more chairs and tables.

loans.name: Fiapito

texts.en: Fiapito is 61 years old and she is married with 5 children. She makes and sells printing materials, Samoan handicraft, to earn a living and has been doing this for 5 years. Fiapito has requested a loan to buy paints, brushes, screen prints and others. She plans to use her profits to expand her business and to renovate her home. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy paints, brushes, and screen prints for her elei printing.

loans.name: Dulcina Del Socorro

texts.es: Siendo todavía una niña de 9 años, Dulcina llegó con su familia a trabajar como empleada del servicio doméstico a la ciudad de Barranquilla, proveniente del municipio de San Juan Nepomuceno en el departamento de Bolívar.  Con el producto de lo ahorrado en sus empleos, hace 10 años decidió invertir en la venta a crédito de ropa por encargos entre sus vecinos y amigos, sin embargo, ella seguía trabajando y fortaleciendo su capital.  Hoy en día ofrece mayor variedad de productos como lencería, electrodomésticos menores, ropa interior y queso que le traen cada 2 días de su pueblo natal.  Solicita su primer crédito Kiva ya que pretende invertir en la compra de abanicos, ropa en general, paraguas, leche en polvo, arroz, entre otros artículos para satisfacer la demanda actual.  Hace dos años, Dulcina se separó de su compañero de años, sin embargo, esta difícil situación la llenó de mucho valor y fortaleza.  Decidió no amedrentarse por la adversidad, no seguir trabajando como empleada para así tener mayor tiempo disponible y poder concentrar toda su atención en la familia y el negocio.  Desde entonces viaja periódicamente a Maicao- Guajira donde compra algunos de los productos que vende, se han incrementado sus clientes notablemente ya que se ha dado más a conocer en el barrio. Vende principalmente a crédito, rotando su cartera 13 y 15 días y compra también en varios almacenes de la ciudad semanalmente.   A sus 61, es una persona muy dinámica y activa, tiene su negocio muy organizado y sueña con que crezca cada día más para alcanzar un margen de rentabilidad más alto del que hoy maneja, esto es, el 40%.  Vive en casa propia en el barrio Santa María con uno de los 7 hijos que tuvo, hoy en día todos mayores de edad. Otro de sus sueños es hacerle algunos arreglos a su vivienda para mejorar su condición habitacional.
texts.en:
Being still a 9-year-old girl, Dulcina came with her family to work as a maid on the city of Barranquilla. They came from the municipality of San Juan Nepomuceno, part of the county of Bolivar. 

With the money she saved from her jobs, 10 years ago she decided to invest in the sale of clothes through a catalog, to sell to her neighbours and friends, however she kept working and strengthening her capital. Today she offers better variety of products, like lingerie, small household appliances, underwear and cheese that she gets every 2 days from her native town.

She requests her first loan with Kiva that she wants to use to buy fans, clothes in general, umbrellas, dried milk, rice and other products to satisfy the present day demands.

Dulcina broke up her relationship with her partner 2 years ago, however this situation filled her with courage and strength, she decided not to let herself be scared by the adversity and to stop working as a maid to have more time available to be able to focus all her attention to her family and business. 

Since then she travels periodically to Maicao, a city from the county of Guajira where she buys some of the items she sells. 

She has gained many new customers because she's made herself known in her neighbourhood. Her sales are mostly on credit, charging customers every 13 to 15 days. She also buys new products weekly in various stores from her city.

Being 61 years old she is a very dynamic and active person, Her business is very well organised and she dreams with making it grow more so she can have a bigger profit margin than the one she has today of 40%.

She lives in her own house in the neighbourhood of Santa Maria with one of her seven children, all of them adults.  Another of her dreams is to fix her house to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy merchandising like: clothes in general, fans, umbrellas, dried milk and other items for selling.

loans.name: Iva

texts.en: Iva is 38 years old and she is married with 10 children. She makes and sells printed materials and samoan handicrafts to earn a living and has been doing this for five years. Iva has requested a loan to buy paints, brushes, screen prints, and other items. She plans to use her profits to expand her business and to renovate her home. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy paints, brushes, and screen prints for her "elei" printing.

loans.name: Lilian Estela

texts.es:
Lílian, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para poder incrementar el negocio en la venta de comida y de refrescos, comprándose aquellos productos que le son necesarios para preparar platillos como el pollo, la carne, el arroz, gaseosas, refrescos, y otro que son necesario dar a la venta.
Ella manifiesta que el préstamo anterior le ha ayudado a mantener un negocio surtido con una mejor producción de alimentos de la cual ha logrado satisfacer a su clientela, además manifiesta que la superación en el negocio también ha sido un beneficio económico para su familia.
texts.en:
Lílian is requesting a new loan to be able to to increase her business of selling food and soft drinks.  She will buy the products she needs to prepare the dishes.  She will buy things like chicken, meat, rice, carbonated drinks, soft drinks, and others that she needs for her sales.

She says that the previous loan helped her to keep her business stocked with a better production of food.  With this food she managed to satisfy her customers.  She also says the growth of her business has also been a financial benefit for her family.

loans.use: to buy chicken, meat, rice, carbonated drinks, and sodas.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
El señor Fernando tiene 36 años de edad es soltero. Nos cuenta que es dueño de un  Cyber  donde presta servicios de internet, y también vende gaseosas, golosinas y demás, también  realiza mantenimiento de computadoras, que es lo que le da más ingresos.
Fernando es una persona muy trabajadora y con ganas de salir adelante y trabajar. Comenta que empezó con un pequeño negocio que con mucho sacrificio ha logrado sacar adelante su negocio. El solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de golosinas, bebidas e insumos para poder mejorar el servicio que da a sus clientes del cyber. Agradece por la ayuda que esta recibiendo de Kiva y de fundación paraguaya.
texts.en:
Fernando is 36-years-old and is single.  He tells us that he is the owner of a cyber café where he offers internet services and also sells sodas, sweets, and much more; as well as doing maintenance on computers, which is what brings in the most profit.

Fernando is a very hard-working person who is motivated to get ahead and work.  He began with a small business and with great sacrifices has been able to advance his business.  He is requesting the loan to purchase sweets, drinks, and supplies to be able to improve the service he offers to his customers.

He is thankful for the help that he is receiving from Kiva and the Fundación Paraguaya.

loans.use: to buy drinks, sweets, and supplies.

loans.name: Jose Benigno

texts.es:
José, se dedica a la agricultura y a la crianza de ganado, vive con su esposa y también con sus padres, él aprendió el trabajo al lado de su padre y tiene tres años de estar realizandolo, para el sostenimiento de su familia, a ganar experiencia y esto le da la facultad para que cada año lo realice.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de abono y herbicidas para poder cultivar maíz, este préstamo ayudará con el financiamiento económico que a él le hace falta y contar con el material necesario para poder realizar una buena siembra.
La aspiración de él es trabajar en lo propio, recibir una buena producción, ir progresando poco a poco con su familia.
texts.en:
José works in agriculture and raising cattle.  He lives with his wife and also his parents.  He learned to work alongside his father and has been working for three years so that he can support his family and gain experience which gives him the ability to do so each year.
He is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and herbicides to be able to grow corn.  This loan will help finance the money he is lacking so that he has the materials needed for a good planting.  
His goal is to work on what is his, have a good harvest, and make progress little by little with his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicides.

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
This is Perla, 36, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Benjamin, an auto mechanic, and a mother to her child, now in elementary school. She and her husband manage their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Perla operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighbourhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a 5 Philippine pesos (PHP) worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business she is requesting a 19,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Perla hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she hopes to send her child all the way to college. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Ha

texts.en: Mrs. Ha is 32 years old. She has two children. She sells pop rice to afford her family’s living fees and her children’s education fees. She has done this job for seven years and each month she gains from it 4,000,000 Vietnamese dong (VND). She has taken part in the credit program of SEDA since 2009. The last cycle she borrowed 9,184,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 9,632,000 VND to enlarge her business. Then she hopes she can pay for her children’s education fees to complete their school period.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for making pop rice and pop corn to expand her business.

loans.name: Lu

texts.en: Mrs. Lu is 23 years old. She has three children and they are all little babies. She is a carpenter with an income of 4,500,000 Vietnamese dong (VND) each month. She has participated in the credit program of SEDA since 2009. The last cycle she borrowed 8,288,000 VND and repaid this loan on time.  In this cycle loan, she wants to borrow 9,184,000 VND. She is too young with three children. She hopes this loan will help to enlarge her studio and her business. Then her children can be in good care.

loans.use: to enlarge her studio and her business of carpentry.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is taking out another Kiva loan, this loan is in the amount of KES 40,000. He will use this loan to purchase bricks and cement to be used to expand his house. With the previous loan, he purchased cereals and also added fish for sale in his shop. Since the previous loan, Patrick has been able to earn extra income to improve his standard of living and provide basic needs to his family.

loans.use: to buy bricks and cement to expand his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy potatoes, chicken, meats, seasonings, oil, cabbage and packing bags.

loans.name: 10Th Group Of Yen Hau

texts.en:
The tenth group of Yen Hau, Yen Phong commune, Bac Ninh province has three women. The leader is Mrs. Bac. She is 39 years old. She has three children. She raises chicken eggs for a living. Normally, she gains from this store 3,800,000 Vietnamese dong (VND) per month. She has taken part in the credit program of SEDA since 2009. In the last cycle she borrowed 5,152,000 VND and repaid this loan on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 6,944,000 VND to enlarge her business.

Mrs. Ke is 55 years old. She raises pigs for a living. She wants to borrow 5,152,000 VND.

Mrs. Thuy is 22 years old. She sells fruits for a living. She wants to borrow 6,944,000 VND.

loans.use: to raise more chicken eggs.

loans.name: Socheat

texts.en:
Socheat (in the photo), age 21, is single. She is a pedagogics student. She lives with her parents, one sister, and one brother in a suburb of Phnom Penh. 

Socheat is requesting her first loan in the amount of $600 to purchase a laptop computer. The laptop, which she will buy with money from the loan, will assist in Socheat’s studying.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop computer.

loans.name: Salimah

texts.en: Salimah is taking out another Kiva loan for her personal expenses. With the loan she wants to purchase iron sheets to roof her house which was blown by wind. She is giving thanks to Yehu and Kiva lenders for giving her an opportunity to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase iron sheets to roof her house.

loans.name: Jessamin

texts.en:
This is Jessamin. He previously borrowed a 41000 Philippine pesos (PHP) loan that he utilized to purchase farm inputs needed in his business. His earnings were a big help for the education of his children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

He would like to apply for a 40,000 PHP loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy fertilizers, seeds and other tools for maintenance of the farm. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain his family's daily needs and the educational expenses of his children. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart. 

Jessamin dreams to be able to send all of his children to college. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and farm inputs needed in his business.

loans.name: Toan

texts.en:
Toan is 35 years old and married with three children. Even though she is a woman, she has worked as a welder for seven years; welding is a hard job. This job has provided her 5,000,000 VND per month. 

She has participated in the SEDA credit program since 2009. During the last cycle, she borrowed 9,184,000 VND and repaid this loan on time. In this cycle loan, she is requesting to borrow 9,632,000 VND to enlarge her studio and her business. With this loan, she will be able to take good care of her children.

loans.use: to enlarge her studio and her metal welding business.

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es:
El Sr. Sergio es soltero vive con sus padres en Ciudad del Este. El es taxista; tiene un vehículo propio que había comprado con  mucho escuezo y sacrificio. Además de esto, él  trabaja como vendedor de ropas que trae de la Argentina y el Brasil  para ayudar a sus padres con los gastos del hogar.
Gracias al trabajo que está realizando cumple con sus obligaciones y sobresale en sus proyectos para un futuro mejor. Él ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable y honesta en sus compromisos. El ya tuvo otros créditos con fundación paraguaya, y cumplió en forma excelente con sus obligaciones.
Ella solicita el crédito para poder arreglar su taxi, en la chapería y pintura, y de esa forma poder brindar un mejor servicio  a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Sergio is single and lives with his parents in Ciudad del Este.  His is a taxi driver and has his own vehicle that he bought with much work and sacrifice.  In addition to this, he works selling clothing that he brings from Argentina and Brazil to help his parents with the household expenses.

Thanks to the work that he is doing he is meeting his obligations and getting ahead with his projects so that he will have a better future.  He has shown that he is a very responsible and honest person with regards to his commitments.  He has already had other loans with the Fundación Paraguaya and met his payments in excellent form.

He is requesting the loan to repair his taxi in a shop that does bodywork and painting so that he can offer better service to his customers.

loans.use: to repair his taxi in a bodywork and painting shop.

loans.name: Zouheir

texts.en:
Zouheir is a 30-year-old single man who has worked in transportation since three to four years ago. He used to be a soldier, but he preferred to make his own business.

Zouheir owns a small van. He uses it to transport people from Baalback to Beirut and the way back on a daily basis. This kind of transportation is very important in his region, since most of Baalback's citizens work in Beirut or attend a university in Beirut, and transportation to Beirut is very hard to find since the government didn't do anything new to ease this process on the villagers.

Zouheir plans his time upon his customers' schedules so that no one will be late in the morning and none will be left in the afternoon. He manages his time, and that's what attracted most of his customers.

Zouheir is applying for a YOUTH LOAN from Kiva partner Al Majmoua for the first time in order to make necessary maintenance to his van's body and mechanical situation.

Zouheir hopes to invest future loans in starting new businesses.

loans.use: to make necessary maintenance to his van's body and mechanical situation

loans.name: Phereak

texts.en:
Phereak (in the photo) is 25 years old and wife, Synath, is 25 years old. They live in a village about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2009 and just have one young son.  

Phereak’s business is in printing. He operates by investing with his brother. His wife is a garment worker. Phereak is asking for his first loan in the amount of $1,500 to buy additional materials need in his printing shop.

loans.use: to buy additional materials need in his printing business.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a 55-year-old married man. He is a farmer and mainly keeps cattle. He has been rearing cattle since 1992 in the outskirts of Entebbe town because the demand for milk was high and yet the supply was low. He thought he would utilize the opportunity to establish himself.

With the income realized from cattle rearing, he has been able to build rental rooms where he gets money for school fees and sustaining his family. He wants a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) so that he can finish his incomplete rental rooms. His dream is to build better rentals that will accommodate the corporate class.

His challenge is that his tenants are lower class citizens with families who are unable to maintain the rooms in good condition and he therefore has to keep spending on renovations.

Robert is honest and very hard working.

loans.use: to finish his house.

loans.name: Seiha

texts.en:
Seiha is 24 years old and his wife, Sreymao, is 23 years old. They have been married since 2010 and have no children yet. He lives with his parents in a village about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.  

Seiha is a construction worker; his wife is a cobbler in a shoe factory. He applied for his first loan in the amount of $500 so that he can buy a motorcycle to get to work. He currently commutes to work by bicycle, however riding his bicycle to work is tiring and makes it difficult for him to be on time.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle to get to work.

loans.name: Nonvissi Group

texts.fr: Le groupe NONVISSI est formé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Françoise, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Françoise est âgée de 41 ans et a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Françoise est mariée à un certain Jean-Eudes. Le couple a quatre enfants tous scolarisés, dont trois à leur charge. Françoise vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la maison. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Françoise vend des conserves, du lait et des sacs de riz à son domicile depuis près de cinq ans. Françoise s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le souci de renforcer davantage son activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Françoise désire augmenter le stock de ses produits. Pour ce faire, Françoise sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe NONVISSI, un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: The Nonvissi group is made up of three women from the same neighborhood.  The group representative, named Françoise, has her hand raised in the photo.  She is 41 years old and left school at the primary level.  Françoise is married to a man named Jean-Eudes.  The couple have four children, all of whom have attended or are attending school, and three of whom are under their care.  She lives with her husband and children, and the couple share the household expenses.  To pay their expenses, Françoise has been selling canned food, milk, and bags of rice at her home for about five years.  She buys her products in a market in Benin.  In order to strengthen her business and better respond to her customers' needs, Françoise would like to increase her inventory.  To do this, she and the other members of the Nonvissi group are requesting a loan through ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy canned foods, milk, and bags of rice.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es: El señor Cesar, nacido en la población de el torno hace 21 años, es soltero, el destino del crédito es  para   la siembra de yuca y lo que implica el preparado de la tierra, actualmente vive en  casa de su padre en el torno, pero con el crédito se ira a su parcela ubicado en la comunidad de Alto Villa Barrientos,  a 20 km. De Santa Rita para trabajar la tierra y poder subsistir de la venta de sus productos que lo comercializa directamente del productor al consumidor, con el fruto de sus ganancias desea comprarse una moto para poder movilizarse de un lugar a otro, después de cumplir con sus obligaciones. En sus tiempos libres juega al futbol y es fanático de blooming un equipo de la ciudad de Santa Cruz, el Sr. Cesar se siente feliz y agradecido ya que con el anterior crédito le fue muy bien, obtuvo buenas ganancias y sigue ahorrando para comprarse una moto que es su más grande deseo.
texts.en:
Sr. Cesar, born 21 years ago in the town of El Torno, is unmarried. He will use the loan to plant yucca (manioc) and prepare the land for cultivation. Currently he lives in his father’s home in El Torno. With the loan he will go to his plot located in the Alto Villa Barrientos community, 20 km. from Santa Rosa, to work the land and live from selling his crops. As a producer, he sells directly to the consumer. With his earnings he wants to buy a motorcycle so that, after meeting his obligations, he can get around from one place to another. 

In his spare time, Cesar plays soccer and is a fan of Blooming, a team from the city of Santa Cruz. He is happy and grateful because he did very well with the previous loan and made a good profit. He will continue saving his money so that he can buy a motorcycle, one of his greatest desires.

loans.use: to buy yucca seed and agricultural supplies

loans.name: Sina

texts.en:
Sina is a 25-year-old single woman with one child. 

She has a small plantation and grows cabbages, tomatoes, cucumbers and others to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. Sina has requested a loan to to buy seeds, a knife, a rake and fertilizer. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. With her profits, Sina hopes to improve her business and looks forward to renovating her house.

loans.use: to buy seeds, a knife, a rake and fertilizer.

loans.name: Chyndel

texts.en:
Chyndel is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. Chyndel has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has owned this business for nine years. 

Chyndel has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. She requested a loan for 8,000 PHP in order to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.  In the future, Chyndel hopes to improve her business so that she can provide an education for her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, soap and beverages.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is from Samburu, Kenya. She’s married and has children. She is a very hardworking, responsible and honest woman. Her dream has always been to have a food stall and to sell food in general at home. Today she has her own business; she has a regular clientele and a good income thanks to her work and effort.

Asha tells us that she wants to continue growing and this is why she always strives and works from sunrise to sundown. This is also the reason that she’s asking for a loan to buy beverages, meat, vegetables and other items for her food stall. She is thankful for the support that she’s getting from Kiva and Yehu Microfinance.

loans.use: to buy beverages, meat, vegetables and other items for her food stall.

loans.name: Sara Esther

texts.es: Sara Esther, casada, con dos hijos menores de edad, tiene por negocio propio venta de celulares y reparación del mismo desde hace siete años que se dedica a dicha  actividad, Sara ha demostrado ser responsable, trabajadora, de buenas costumbre, con ganas de superación personal, el negocio lo inicio como una herramienta de trabajo para poder sacara adelante a sus hijos, el financiamiento lo está solicitando para la compra de celulares y accesorios como:  celulares de motorolas, Samsung , cartucheras, forros para los celulares, carcasas, cordones colgantes entre otros.
texts.en: Sara Esther is married with two young children.  She has had her own business selling and repairing cell phone for the seven years that she has worked in this area.  Sara has shown herself to be responsible, hard-working, well-mannered, and motivated to get ahead.  The business started as a tool to improve life for her children.  The loan she is requesting is to buy cell phones and accessories including: Motorola and Samsung phones, cases and wallets for cell phones, and sleeves and straps among other items.

loans.use: to buy cell phones and accessories including: Motorola and Samsung phones, cases and wallets for cell phones, and sleeves and straps among other items.

loans.name: Lilita

texts.en:
This is Lilita, 58 years old. She lives in Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Rene, her business partner, and a mother to one child. She, together with her husband and children, manage their own household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Lilita makes a living operating a private pool resort. She owns a private pool that she offers to be rented on a daily basis. Usually a private pool resort has a single swimming pool with one to two rooms to accommodate five to ten people inside a private property. It is where family gets together to unwind and sometimes to hold special events like birthdays. She has been in this business for almost three years. Her customers are people in the community and local tourists. She earns a minimum of 2,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) from rentals every day. 

To help her continue operating her business, she is applying for a loan of 50,000 PHP. She will be using the money to buy supplies like tiles, chlorine and for the maintenance of the private pool resort as well. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. 

As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the supplies and maintenance of her private pool resort.

loans.name: Soklim

texts.en:
Soklim is a garment worker. Her husband, Sophorn, is a construction worker. They have been married since 2001 and have one young daughter. She and her family live in a suburb of Phnom Penh, which is approximately 25 kilometers outside of the city.

Soklim is requesting a loan of $1,000 to expand her property by buying the neighboring land.

She will also use part of the loan to finish the construction of her kitchen. She is in the process of building her kitchen where she cooks.

loans.use: to expand her property by buying the neighboring land; and to finish the construction of her kitchen.

loans.name: Maria Dilia

texts.es:
Doña Maria Dilia tiene  56 años de edad, es casada, tiene 2 hijos y vive con ellos y su esposo en una colonia periférica de San Pedro Sula, Cortes.
Doña Maria tiene desde hace 13 años un negocio de venta de comida, ella elabora baleadas, pastelitos, pollo con tajadas, pupusas, jugos naturales. Ella tiene establecido su negocio en su casa donde atiende a sus clientes vendiendo los alimentos que prepara. Doña Maria es muy conocida en la colonia, cuenta con sus propios clientes los cuales hasta el momento están satisfechos con el servicio que ella les brinda. Manifiesta que con los ingresos que obtiene ayuda a su esposo con los gastos del hogar.
Esta muy agradecida con Odef por brindarle la ayuda del préstamo de 10,000 lempiras el cual invertirá en surtir de insumos necesarios para elaborar las comidas como  harina de maíz, carnes, harina de trigo, bananos, condimentos, frijoles, huevos, lactaos , frutas para elaborar los jugos naturales.
Su sueño es seguir trabajando para tener la solvencia económica para ayudar a sus hijas terminar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Maria Dilia is 56 years old and married.  She has two children, and she lives with them and with her husband in a peripheral neighborhood of San Pedro Sula, Cortes.

Maria has had a business of selling food for 13 years.  She makes “baleadas” (flour tortillas with beans, eggs, butter, cheese and meat), pastries, chicken with plantain slices, “pupusas” (stuffed griddle corn cakes), and natural juices.  She has established her business in her house, where she tends to her customers and sells them the food that she prepares.

Maria is very well-known in the neighborhood, and she has her own customers.  So far her customers are satisfied with the service she provides.  She says that with the income that she gets she helps her husband with the household expenses.

She is very grateful to ODEF for giving her the help of the loan for 10,000 lempiras.  She will use the loan to stock the supplies she needs to make the food.  She will buy things like corn flour, meat, wheat flour, bananas, condiments, beans, eggs, dairy products, and fruit to make the natural juices.

Her dream is to continue working in order to have financial solvency and to help her daughters finish their education.

loans.use: to buy corn flour, meat, wheat flour, bananas, condiments, beans, eggs, dairy products, and fruit to make the natural juices for her food sales.

loans.name: Ayidotegbe Group

texts.fr: Le groupe AYIDOTEGBE est formé de trois personnes qui vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Anastasie, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Anastasie est âgée de 47 ans et n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Anastasie est mariée à un certain Christiano. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Anastasie vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Anastasie vend des liqueurs et des boissons locales depuis près de seize ans. Anastasie s’approvisionne dans un marché et une région du Bénin. Dans le souci de renforcer davantage son activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Anastasie désire augmenter le stock de ses produits. Pour ce faire, Anastasie sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe AYIDOTEGBE, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers crédits reçus ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The Ayidotegbe group is made up of three women from the same neighborhood.  The group representative, named Anastasie, has her hand raised in the photo. Anastasie is 47 years old and did not go to school.  She is married to a man named Christiano and the couple has three children, all in school and under their care.  She lives with her husband and children, and the couple share the household expenses.  To help pay these expenses, Anastasie has been selling drinks for about sixteen years.  She buys her products in a Benin market.  With the goal of strengthening her business and better meeting her customers' needs, Anastasie would like to increase her inventory.  To do this, she and the other members of the Ayidotegbe group are requesting their third loan through ALIDé.  The first two loans were paid back correctly.

loans.use: to buy drinks.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
This is Rosita, 59, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Bonifacio (a driver) and the mother of four children. She and her husband manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Rosita operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Rosita earns money by purchasing supplies at wholesale prices and re-selling individual items. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

In order to assist business operations, Rosita is requesting a Php 11,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Rosita hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams of her children finishing their studies up to college. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and other products for her business.

loans.name: Ersilia

texts.es:
La Sra. Ercilia es dueña de un comercio, donde vende todo tipo de productos agrícolas en general. Se dedica a esta actividad  hace más de 15 años, por lo que ya tiene una buena clientela fiel que siempre compra de ella sus productos.
Su esposo se dedica a la ganadería, compra venta, cría de animales menores, y de esa forma ellos se ayudan para poder salir adelante. Ercilia es una persona  muy trabajadora y emprendedora y con grandes deseos de salir adelante y progresar.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de hortalizas, verduras y demás insumos para poder surtirse y de esa forma poder seguir ofreciendo buena calidad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ercilia is the owner of a store where she sells all kinds of agricultural products.  She has worked in this business for more than 15 years and so she already has a loyal customer base that always buys products from her.

Her husband works in livestock buying and selling small animals and in this way they help each other to get ahead.  Ercilia is a very hard-working and entrepreneurial person with great hopes of progressing and getting ahead.  

She is requesting the loan to buy plants, vegetables, and more supplies to stock her business and to be able to offer good quality to her customers.

loans.use: to buy plants and vegetables.

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
La Sra Guillermina tiene 34 años de edad, está felizmente casada con el Sr. Fernando de 37 años, tienen la dicha de tener 2 hijos a quienes aman demasiado.
La Sra Guillermina es dueña de una despensa hace mas de 5 años empezó este negocio con el ahorro que contaba con su esposo y de a poco fueron fortaleciendo su negocio día a día y que en la actualidad es el sustento de la familia.
Solicitó de este crédito para la compra de harinas, fideos, azúcar, galletas, verduras, etc ya que cuenta con muy buena demanda en la venta de sus productos.   Ella tiene como anhelo que su negocio vaya prosperando como lo viene haciendo para poder brindarles una vida digna a su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Guillermina is 34 years old and happily married to Sr. Fernando, who is 37 years old. They have two children whom they love greatly.  Guillermina is the owner of a small store. She started the store more than five years ago with her and her husband’s savings. Gradually they began building the business and now it supports the family.

She requested this loan to purchase flour, noodles, sugar, cookies, vegetables, etc. because she has very good customer demand for the products she sells. Her wish is that the business continue prospering as it is doing now so that it can provide the family with a decent life.

loans.use: to purchase flour, noodles, sugar, cookies, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, soap, shampoo, detergents and beverages.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 28-year-old single woman. She has 3 children ranging in age from two to seven years old. She describes herself as a creative person. 

Beatrice operates a retail stall where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located within a market place and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as inadequate stock. She will use the 10,000 KES loan to buy cereals. Her business goal is to operate an additional retail store.

loans.use: to buy more cereals for selling.

loans.name: Alexis Geovanny

texts.es:
Alexis, se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos, vive con su esposa y su hijo quien es menor de edad, él se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos y también es empleado como fontanero de agua potable, este trabajo lo realiza desde hace 3 años.
Esta solicita un préstamo para la compra de los fertilizantes necesarios en el cultivo como el abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, que son necesarios para prevenir las plagas y que al mismo tiempo le ayuda a incrementar la producción.
El objetivo de él es que través de este préstamo pueda realizar un buen trabajo, del cual se obtengan grandes beneficios en su familia, con el préstamo espera poder salir en el pago de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Alexis plants basic grains. He lives with his wife and son, who is a minor. He not only cultivates basic grains but he is also employed as a plumber of drinking water. He has had this job for three years. 

He is applying for a loan to purchase the necessary fertilizers for farming, such as compost, herbicides, and pesticides, which are needed to prevent pests and at the same time to help increase production.

His objective is that with this loan he will be able to do a good job, which will earn a large profit for his family. With the loan, he expects to be able to make his payments on time

loans.use: to buy fertilizert, herbicides and pesticides.

loans.name: Sawsan

texts.en:
Sawsan is a 36-year-old Lebanese married woman who lives with her husband and with her two young children, who are still attending school. Her husband works in a local company to support the family financially. But, because her husband's income is insufficient, Sawsan decided to start working as a hairdresser, receiving customers at her house. 

Sawsan's story exemplifies the day-to-day challenges that Lebanese women are facing in running their businesses while raising children and managing their homes. At this time, Sawsan is working hard to continually provide income for everyday expenses. With her requested loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l., she will purchase new hairdressing tools and supplies so she can better serve her clients. 

Sawsan hopes her business will grow, and she dreams of giving her children a good future and high quality education through all her hard work.

loans.use: to purchase new hairdressing tools and supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers and pay for the cost of labor.

loans.name: Shadi

texts.en:
Shadi is a 32-year-old young man. He is married and a father of two sons and one daughter. He has a taxi and works as a taxi driver, which has been a profitable project and the only source of income for the family, but he also needs more support to cover the costs and the family's needs.
Shadi is requesting a 1,200 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of insuring and licensing his taxi. This will allow Shadi to travel from one area to another legally and work extra hours to improve the family's income.
Shadi is photographed next to his taxi.

loans.use: To pay for insuring and licensing his taxi

loans.name: Mario Antonio

texts.es:
Mario, es un agricultor vive con su esposa y cuatro hijos de 13, 10, 9 y 6 años de edad, él se dedica a la actividad agrícola desde hace 15 años, trabaja todos los días desde las seis de la mañana hasta las tres de la tarde o dependiendo de la temporada agrícola.
Actualmente está realizando la siembra de la época de invierno, para lo cual solicita un préstamo pues necesita realizar la compra de abono y de herbicidas para aplicarlos a la siembra de maíz y frijol, este préstamo ayudará con los recursos económicos para que pueda realizar su trabajo de una mejor manera.
En la aspiración de Mario es que a través de su trabajo y esforzándose diariamente pueda apoyar a sus hijos en el estudio y que esto pueda formarse académicamente.
texts.en:
Mario is a farmer living with his wife and four children aged 13, 10, 9 and 6 years old. He has been farming for 15 years. He works every day from six in the morning until three in the afternoon or depending on the farming season. 
He's sowing for the winter season, which is why he needs a loan to buy fertilizer and herbicides for planting corn and beans. The loan will help him economically to do a better job. 
Mario aspires through his work and daily efforts to support his children in their studies for them to grow academically.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicides.

loans.name: Narciso

texts.es:
Narciso es un comerciante de 66 años, se dedica a la venta de bebidas y artículos básicos de consumo familiar. Cuenta que este negocio lo tiene desde hace más de 10 años.
Su negocio está ubicado en un lugar estratégico de la ciudad de Pilar, donde tiene gran cantidad de clientes. Es gracias a su trabajo y su negocio que ha podido ayudar a su familia y darles todo lo que necesitan para una vida digna.
El solicita el crédito para poder abastecerse con bebidas en general, ya que tiene mucha demanda y quiere tener su producto en stock para poder ofrecerlo a sus clientes. Agradece a la fundación y a Kiva por la oportunidad que esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
Narciso is a 66-year-old business owner who works selling beverages and household staple goods.  He tells us that he has had this business for more than ten years.  
His business is located in a strategic place in the city of Pilar, where he has a great number of customers.  It is thanks to his work and his business that he has been able to help his family and give them all that they need for a dignified life.
He is requesting the loan to be able to stock his store with all kinds of drinks, as he has a lot of demand for this and wants to have his products in stock to be able to offer them to his customers.  He thanks the foundation and Kiva for the opportunity that he is receiving.

loans.use: to buy beverages to sell.

loans.name: Angelica Maria

texts.es:
La señora Angélica inició el proyecto de la ferretería la cual ya tiene más de 12 años funcionando solo que hoy en día lo hace solo con sus hijos ya que el que atendía era su esposo pero desgraciadamente él falleció dejando como jefa de familia. Y es el principal ingreso de la familia. Sus hijos le ayudan a atender la ferretería mientras ella trabaja en Laredo Texas. 
Obtendrán un beneficio inmediato al surtir el negocio y ese es que la ferretería volverá a tener la variedad de productos para los clientes y ellos tendrán la confianza de que lo que buscan esta en la ferretería de la señora Angélica. La ferretería de la señora angélica por el momento no cuenta con todos los artículos ni el material suficiente para dar un buen servicio, razón por la cual la señora solicita que la ayudemos para comprar material de ferreteria.
texts.en:
Angélica began her hardware store project more than 12 years ago and now she operates it alone with just her children, although her husband used to tend the store.  Unfortunately, he died, leaving her as the head of her family and the store provides the main income for the family.  Her children help her tend to the hardware store while she works in Laredo, Texas.  
They will gain an immediate benefit from stocking the business as it will once again have a variety of products for the customers and they will be confident that they will find what they are looking for at Angélica’s hardware store.  At the moment, her store does not have all of the items or materials needed to provide good service and this is why she is requesting the loan to help her buy hardware supplies.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her hardware store.

loans.name: Jose Arnulfo

texts.es:
José, Es agricultor, vive con su esposa y dos hijos de 15 y 10 años de edad, quienes dependen de el, es empleado de una joyería y los fines de semana realizan las labores agrícolas, sembrando maíz y maicillo.
Actualmente se encuentra preparando el terreno para realizar la siembra de la temporada de invierno, solicita un préstamo que le ayude a cubrir el gasto en la compra de abono, herbicidas, y semilla, esto le ayudará a poder fortalecer la siembra y prevenirla de las posibles plagas, ayudándole a mejorar en el futuro la producción de maíz y maicillo.
El objetivo de José es encontrar las alternativas de trabajo, para poder generarle a su familia una condición estable, que cuente con el alimento, la salud necesaria para el desarrollo.
texts.en:
José is a farmer living with his wife and two children of 15 and 10 years old who depend on him. He works in a jewelry store and during the weekend, he sows corn and sorghum.

He's preparing the land to sow for the winter season. He will use the loan to cover the expense of purchasing fertilizer, herbicides and seeds. This will help him to strengthen planting and prevent possible pests, helping him to improve the future production of corn and sorghum.

José's objective is to find alternate work to provide his family with stability, so that they can count on food and the health necessary for development.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides and seeds.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
Andrea, se dedica a atender una pupuseria, vive con sus dos nietos y su hija, el negocio lo comenzó por iniciativa propia, trabajando desde su hogar hasta el momento cuenta con una experiencia que le ayuda a realizar con calidad sus productos.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de maíz, aceite, gas, repollo, quesillo, que son los indispensables para realizar la venta, este préstamo le permitirá realizar la compra y tener lo necesario para continuar trabajando.
El objetivo de ella es permanecer en  un negocio con la capacidad de atender la demanda de los clientes, ayudándole también a generar mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Andrea works in a pupusería (a stand selling pupusas, a savory treat made from stuffed corn dough).  She lives with her daughter and grandchildren and began the business through her own initiative.  She worked from home and has the experience needed to help her make quality products.  

She is requesting the loan to buy corn, oil, propane, cabbage, and cheese; which are the essential supplies she needs to sell her product and have what she needs to keep working.

Her goal is to stay in business with the capacity to supply her customers’ demand, which will help her to make greater profits.

loans.use: to buy corn, oil, propane, cabbage, and cheese.

loans.name: Marina Noemy

texts.es:
Marina, administra una tienda de productos de primera necesidad, vive con tres hijos la casa es propia también realiza la venta de pescado, lleva 20 años en el negocio, lo heredó de sus padres desde pequeña.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de materiales de primera necesidad como lo es el aceite, azúcar, arroz, café, sal, jabón, detergentes, este préstamo ayudará a incrementar el inventario y estar más preparada para atender la clientela, contribuyendo al desarrollo del comercio.
El objetivo de ella es mantener una fuente de ingresos permanente, para su familia y al mismo tiempo poder realizar una buena inversión con este préstamo para seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Marina has a store selling staple household products.  She lives with her three children in her own house and also sells fish.  She has been in business for 20 years, having inherited it from her parents when she was young.

She is requesting a loan to buy staple household products such as: oil, sugar, rice, coffee, salt, soap, and detergents.  This loan will help her to increase her inventory and be more prepared to serve her customers, which will help her business develop.  

Her goal is to maintain a permanent source of income for her family and, at the same time, be able to make a good investment with this loan to continue to grow.

loans.use: to buy oil, sugar, rice, coffee, salt, soap, and detergents.

loans.name: Maria Idalia

texts.es:
María, administra una tienda, vive con su hija de seis meses de edad, la vivienda es propia, vive también con su esposo y juntos iniciaron el negocio de productos domésticos.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para poder surtir la tienda de productos que tienen mayor demanda como lo es las gaseosas, boquitas, dulces, detergentes, este préstamo le ayudará a variar la mercadería y a poder atender mejor a su clientela.
Uno de sus objetivos es estabilizar las ventas y poder crecer en clientes, ya que esto le permitirá superarse.
texts.en:
María runs a store and lives with her 6 month old daughter in her own house. She also lives with her husband and together they started a business selling basic food products. 
She will use the loan to stock her store with the most popular products, such as soda drinks, snacks, sweets, and detergents. This loan will help her to diversify her merchandise and offer a better service to her customers.
One of her objectives is to stabilize sales and increase her customer base, since this will allow her to excel.

loans.use: to buy products: soft drinks, snacks, sweets, and detergents.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es: La Sra. Virginia tiene 28 años, tiene su pareja con el que tienen dos hijos que son de las edades de 6 y 7 años, ella se dedica a la confección y arreglo de prendas de vestir en su taller que se encuentra en la localidad de Jorochito,  Este préstamo es su tercera secuencia dentro de la institución la Sra. Virginia va a usar este préstamo  para la compra de máquina de cortar tela que le será muy útil para realizar su trabajo,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir  equipando su taller, la Sra. Virginia enfrenta retos en su negocio que son salir de la pobreza y va a utilizar los beneficios para mejorar su calidad de vida y la  de su familia.
texts.en: Virginia is 28-years-old and has two children with her partner who are six and seven-years-old.  She works making and repairing articles of clothing in her sewing workshop that can be found in the town of Jorochito.  This loan is her third with this organization and Virginia will use the loan to buy a fabric cutting machine that will be very useful for doing her work.  Her reason for requesting the loan is to continue equipping her workshop.  Virginia faces challenges in her business such as getting out of poverty and she will use the benefits of it to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy a fabric cutting machine.

loans.name: Sugran's Group

texts.en:
Sugran is a 57-year-old illiterate woman. Unfortunately she couldn’t get an education due to her family's poor financial condition. Sugran is the mother of seven children. She has given them a good education, and now two of her sons are contributing financially to the family from their earnings. Sugran's husband is a very hardworking person who is involved in the animal sales business. He is very experienced and makes good sales from his business. His clients are mostly butchers.

Sugran has requested a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. He will use the loan to buy animals (buffalo) to sell. Sugran is hopeful that the business will grow further after this loan investment.

loans.use: To buy animals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools for the motorcycle and pay for the gasoline

loans.name: Enagnon Group

texts.fr: ENAGNON est un groupe de quatre personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Baï Vidékon Christiane(dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 31 ans. Baï Vidékon Christiane n’est plus avec son mari. Baï Vidékon Christiane est mère de deux enfants tous scolarisés et à sa charge. Baï Vidékon Christiane ensemble avec ses enfants. Baï Vidékon Christiane assure ensemble avec son mari, les différentes charges de la maison. Baï Vidékon Christiane n’a pas fréquenté l'école. Afin de contribuer aux divers besoins du ménage, Baï Vidékon Christiane vend du maïs, de la farine du manioc, et du pain à son domicile. Baï Vidékon Christiane achète ses produits dans un marché et une région du Bénin. C’est la deuxième fois que Baï Vidékon Christiane et les autres membres du groupe ENAGNON sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. Le premier crédit à été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
ENAGNON is a group made up of four people, who all live in the same neighborhood. The group's leader, Baï Vidékon Christiane, is 31 years old. She has her hand raised in the photo. Baï Vidékon Christiane is no longer with her husband. She is the mother of two children who go to school, and who are in her care. She lives with her children. Baï Vidékon Christiane shares the household's various expenses with her husband. She did not go to school.

In order to meet her family's needs, Baï Vidékon Christiane sells corn, cassava flour, and bread from her home. She obtains her supplies at a market in Benin. This is the second time that Baï Vidékon Christiane and the other members of the ENAGNON group have asked for financial support from ALIDé in order to increase their working capital and better meet customer demand. The first loan was fully repaid.

loans.use: to buy food products (corn, cassava flour, rice).

loans.name: Roxana Del Carmen

texts.es:
Roxana, vive con su familia, su esposo, dos hijos, ella se dedica a las labores del hogar y al mismo tiempo administra un molino de nixtamal, éste surgió con el apoyo de su esposo y de su madre, no tiene un horario fijo para atender a la clientela.
Actualmente solicitó un préstamo el cual invertirá en el mantenimiento al molino comprandole fajas, grasa, discos, que son necesarios para el buen funcionamiento de  esta maquinaria, este préstamo ayudará a tener buenas condiciones y poder seguir brindando un buen servicio.
El objetivo de ella es buscar las alternativas que sea necesaria para tener un negocio estable y apoyar a su familia.
texts.en: Roxana lives with her family; her husband and two children.  She is dedicated to housework and at the same time she administers a corn mill.  She started the mill with the support of her husband and mother.  She does not have a fixed schedule to attend to the clientele.  At present she requests a loan which she will invest in the maintenance of the mill, buying belts, grease, and disks that are necessary for the good operation of this machinery.   This loan will help to maintain the mill in good condition and to be able to continue offering good service.  Her objective is to seek the alternatives that are necessary to have a stable business and to support her family.

loans.use: to maintain the mill and purchase belts, grease and disks.

loans.name: Tam

texts.en: Mrs. Tam is 44 years old and she has two children. She operates a small Internet access room, earning a monthly income of about 3,500,000 VND from it. Mrs. Tam has taken part in SEDA's credit program since 2008. In her last cycle, Mrs. Tam borrowed 9,184,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. She now wants to borrow 9,632,000 VND to enlarge her business.

loans.use: to enlarge her business

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha is a 42-year-old married woman. She has 3 children whose ages range from 8 to 15 years old. Martha describes herself as a determined woman. For the past 6 years, she has operated a grocery store where she sells vegetables such as kale, cabbage, etc. Martha's business is located in a market area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be stiff competition within the area. Martha will use this KES 20,000 loan to buy kale. Her business goal is to run a wholesale grocery store within 5 years. Martha hopes that, in the future, she will have expanded her business into many grocery stores.

loans.use: to buy kale for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of rice and products from AVON and NATASHA

loans.name: Hien

texts.en: Mrs. Hien is 32 years old and she has three children. She is employed as a carpenter, earning a monthly income of about 4,000,000 VND. Mrs. Hien has taken part in SEDA's credit program since 2010. In her last cycle, she borrowed 7,392,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. Mrs. Hien now wants to borrow 8,288,000 VND to open her own carpentry studio at home.

loans.use: to open her own carpentry studio at home

loans.name: Marvin

texts.es:
Marvín, administra una pupuseria, vive con su madre y tres hijos ya que es madre soltera, ellos dependen de sus ingresos, su negocio inició gracias al apoyo de su madre y hasta el momento no ha tenido ningún inconveniente, lo atiende por las tardes en las afueras de su vivienda.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo como apoyo para poder mejorar el negocio, manteniéndo los materiales con los que prepara su producto de venta como es el maíz, quesillo, chicharrón, aceite, gas, que son materiales que a diario utiliza, esta compra le ayudará a poder generar una condición más estable en sus ventas.
Su objetivo es ampliar el negocio poco a poco, atraer nuevos clientes y generar una mayor rentabilidad para su familia.
texts.en: Marvín administers a cafe where she sells pupusas (The pupusa is a popular El Salvadoran dish made of a thick, corn tortilla filled with anything from meats to cheeses to refried beans to pork rinds).  She lives with her mother and three children.  Since she is a single mother, they depend on her income.  Her business started thanks to the support of her mother and up to now she has had no objection.  She tends it in the afternoons on the outskirts of her dwelling.  She is requesting a loan as support to be able to improve the business, mantaining the materials with which she prepares her product, such as corn, cheese, pork rinds, oil, and gas, which are materials that she utilizes daily.  This purchase will help her to be able to generate a more stable condition with her sales.  Her objective is to expand the business little by little, to attract new clients and to generate a greater profit for her family.

loans.use: to buy corn, cheese, pork rinds, oil and gas

loans.name: Felix Pedro

texts.es: El señor Félix cliente Kiva es originario del Rosario comarca Pueblo Nuevo municipio de  Estelí, de oficio agricultor, casado, padre de 3 hijos, el se dedica a la siembra de maíz, frijol y hortalizas.  Agradece a Kiva por el apoyo brindado atravez del préstamo pues ha sido de ayuda porque logro cumplir sus expectativas de obtener buenos rendimientos y calidad de su cosecha, el ultimo crédito lo utilizo para comprar insumos y pagar mano de obra para sembrar ½ manzana de pepino. Ahora requiere de un nuevo préstamo para invertir aun mas en sus productos en la compra de insumos y pago de mano de obra pero esta vez para  sembrar 2 manzanas de maíz y ½ manzana de frijol  ya que viene la temporada en que el producto se vende a un buen precio, el estima que esta inversión  será de ayuda pues podrá incrementar aun mas sus ingresos que aseguraran el bienestar de su familia, sus planes futuros una vez que cancele el préstamo es con las ganancias diversificarse en productos y ampliar el área de siembra, Félix espera seguir  contando con el apoyo de Kiva para salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Félix, Kiva client, is from Rosario in the region of Pueblo Nuevo and municipality of Estelí. He's a farmer, married, and father of three children. He farms corn, beans, and vegetables. He's thankful to Kiva for the support provided through loans, since it has helped to achieve his expectations of good yields and quality harvest. The last credit was used to buy agricultural inputs and pay for manual labor to sow 0.88 acres (½ manzana) of cucumber. 

Currently, he needs the new loan to invest more in his products, purchasing agricultural inputs and paying for manual labor. This time, he will sow 3.5 acres (2 manzanas) of corn and  0.88 acres (½ manzana) of beans since the season in which the product is sold at a good price is coming up. He believes that this investment will be helpful to increase his income even more. This will help to secure his family's well-being. His future plans, after paying off the loan, are to use the earnings to diversify his products and expand his planting area. 

Félix hopes to keep counting on Kiva's support to get ahead with his family.

loans.use: para invertir en la compra de insumos y pago de mano de obra.

loans.name: Maritza Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth nació en la ciudad de Quito en 1968, ella vive con su esposo Luis y su hija en el barrio de Chillogallo. Quito es la capital del Ecuador y también la segunda ciudad más grande. Esta ciudad está ubicada en las faldas de la cordillera montañosa de los andes a unos 2800 metros de altura sobre el nivel del mar. Quito aparte de ser la capital política del país es además la capital cultural y financiera. La ciudad se encuentra dividida en tres secciones principales, el centro histórico, donde uno puede ver de manera muy clara como era Quito en la época colonial, el Norte; donde tradicionalmente se sitúan las clases socioeconómicas altas, y el Sur; conocido como “el lado pobre” de la ciudad. 
Elizabeth establecío su negocio hace 5 años en uno de los mercados mayoristas de la ciudad, ella ahí dedica 4 horas diarias a vender diferentes frutas que se pueden obtener de Quito y sus alrededores. Al terminar su día de trabajo, Elizabeth cuida a su hija, sin embargo, su hija ya ha crecido y no necesita tanto cuidado como antes, por lo que Elizabeth desea empezar a trabajar más horas diarias. Ella solicita el préstamo a Kiva para poder comprar fruta en mayor volumen y así reducir sus precios unitarios. Además Elizabeth también cree que invertir más horas de trabajo diarias y vender más cantidad le va a ayudar a recibir más ingresos lo cual le permitiría cumplir su sueño de comprar una casa propia para ella y su familia.
texts.en: Maritza Elizabeth was born in the city of Quito in 1968. She lives with her husband, Luis, and their daughter in the barrio of Chillogallo. Quito is the capital of Ecuador and also the second largest city. It is located on the slopes of the Andes mountain range and is 2,800 meters (9,180 feet) above sea level. Along with being the political capital, Quito is the country's cultural and financial center. The city is divided into three main sections: the historic center, where one can easily see how it was like during the colonial period; the north, traditionally home to the upper class; and the south, known as "the poor side" of the city. Elizabeth established her business five years ago in one of the city's wholesale markets, where she dedicates four hours every day to selling different fruits from Quito and the surrounding areas. After her work day ends, Elizabeth cares for her daughter. Of course, her daughter has grown up and doesn't need as much care as before, which is why Elizabeth wants to start working more every day. She is requesting the loan from Kiva to be able to purchase larger quantities of fruit and thus reduce the unit price. Furthermore, Elizabeth believes that working more hours and selling larger quantities is going to help her increase income, which would allow her to fulfill her dream of buying her own home for herself and her family.

loans.use: to purchase fruit to sell.

loans.name: Jose Fernando

texts.es:
José, se dedica a la agricultura sembrando maíz y frijol, tiene 55 años de edad, vive con su esposa y dos hijos los cuales le ayudan en su trabajo, don José tiene más de 30 años dedicándose al cultivo de maíz el cual aprendió de sus padres, por lo que ya cuenta con una gran experiencia.
El está solicitando un préstamo para utilizarlo en la compra de materiales que serán aplicados al cultivo como lo es el abono, foliares, semilla y preparar la tierra, este préstamo ayudará a realizar la compra y a poder cultivar una manzana de maíz, de esta forma aprovechará la época de invierno para que su producción sea más abundante.
El objetivo de él es brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia trabajando arduamente, mostrándole a sus hijos la manera de hacer las cosas y buscando las alternativas para obtener mejores resultados en la producción.
texts.en: José is dedicated to agriculture, sowing corn and beans.  He is 55 years of age and lives with his wife and two children which help in his work.  José has been dedicated to the cultivation of corn for more than 30 years, having learned from his parents, who already had great experience.  He is requesting a loan to use for the purchase of materials that will be applied to the crops, such as supplements, foliar fertilizer, and seed and to prepare the land.  (Foliar fertilizer is a type of fertilizer applied directly to the leaves of the plant, commonly used in organic gardening.)  This loan will help to carry out the purchase and to be able to cultivate a field of corn.  In this way he will take advantage of the winter season so that his production will be more abundant.  His objective is to offer a better quality of life to his family by working arduously, showing his children how things should be done and seeking alternatives to obtain better results in his production.

loans.use: to buy supplements, foliar fertilizer, and seeds and to prepare the soil.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann previously took out a PHP 20,000 loan to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures. 

Mary Ann would like to apply for another PHP 20,000 loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Mary Ann's profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Mary Ann hopes to be able to expand soon. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business

loans.name: Duo Los Cipresales Group

texts.es: Duo Los Cipresales este Duo esta integrado por doña Fidelia ella tiene 41 años de edad nos cuenta que Dios le dio la bendicion de tener 12 hijos la mayoria de ellos son mayores de edad, Doña fidelia se dedica a la elavoracion y venta de tejidos como elavoracion de servilletas, guipiles, etc ellas ya tiene personas que le compra su produto y los venden en diferentes partes del pais,ella esta muy contenta porque tiene la oportunidad de un nuevo credito,espera que Kiva le pueda ayudar para que ella pueda cumplir sus metas y salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en: Duo Los Cipresales (“The Cypress Grove Duo”) is comprised of Fidelia who is 41 years old, and who says that god has given her the blessing of 12 children most of whom are adults. Fidelia works in the production and sale of woven products such as handkercheifs, traditional blouses etc. She already has many people who buy her products and sell them in various parts of the country. She is very happy she has the opportunity to ask for another loan. She hopes Kiva can help her reach her goals and to keep moving forward with her family.

loans.use: to buy premium material for the production and sale of woven products such as handkercheifs, traditional blouses etc

loans.name: Beronica

texts.es: La Sra. Beronica tiene 29 años y es soltera, se dedica a la venta de comida desde hace 2 años,  este préstamo es el su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra.  Beronica va a usar este préstamo para la compra de insumos como abarrotes, papa y verduras para la elaboración de sus comidas para ofrecer variedad de platillos en su pensión,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es incremento de capital de trabajo y así de esta manera generar sus ingresos, la Sra.
