Beronica enfrenta retos en su negocio que son salir de la pobreza y  va a utilizar los beneficios para mejorar su calidad de vida y la  de su familia, se siente agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Beronica is 29 years old, single and has made a living selling food for the past two years. This is her first loan with Kiva partner Emprender, and Beronica plans to use it to purchase ingredients like general groceries, potatoes and vegetables to make her meals. She offers a variety of dishes at her dwelling. Her reason for requesting this loan is to increase her working capital and thus generate more income. Beronica faces challenges in her business like overcoming poverty and plans to reap the benefits by improving the quality of life for herself and her family. She feels grateful to Emprender and Kiva for their support.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like groceries, potatoes and vegetables to make her meals.

loans.name: Sun

texts.en:
Sun, 30 years old, is in the business of cultivating rice crops and vegetables for sale. She is married to a local farmer, her business partner and the father of a single child. Sun typically earns an average of US $2.50 per day to support her family, especially for food and allowance for her school-aged child. Sun’s husband is a helpful man who assists her in all of their work and cares for their child. Moreover, he also operates a business selling firewood from a horse-pulled trailer to provide additional income for the family.

Sun wants to improve her family-owned business and better her living conditions. She would like to acquire a loan of KHR 4,400,000 to purchase an extra piece of land to expand and increase her rice production. With the remaining funds she will buy a young horse to pull her husband’s firewood trailer. In years to come, Sun will send her child to a good university and ensure a bright future for her.

loans.use: to purchase an extra piece of land to expand and increase her rice production.

loans.name: Ma. Clarita

texts.en:
Ma. Clarita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a billiards business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 2 years and earns additional income from renting her van. Ma. Clarita is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to repair and purchase a billiard table for her business.  

Ma. Clarita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To repair and purchase a billiard table

loans.name: Balbina

texts.es: La señora Balbina acude a nosotros ya que tiene un problema en su vivienda y realmente para ella es muy incomodo tener problemas de humedad y hasta goteras en su vivienda. La queremos apoyar para que pueda impermeabilizar su vivienda y así ya no se vera afectada por la húmeda que se genera con la lluvias. Ella trabaja en Laredo Texas para varios patrones ya que al ser quien sustenta los gastos de su familia necesita trabajar mucho para sacar adelante a su hijo y al mismo tiempo darles un buen hogar para vivir.
texts.en: Balbina has come to us as she has a problem with her house that is really, for her, very uncomfortable because she has problems with moisture and even leaks in her house.  We want to help her to weatherproof her home so that she will not be affected by the moisture generated by the rainy season.  She works in Laredo, Texas, for various employers and as she is the one who provides for the family’s expenses, she needs to work a lot so that her son can get ahead and at the same time they can live in a good home.

loans.use: to install thermal insulation in the roof of her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, soap, shampoo and beverages

loans.name: Uranchimeg

texts.en:
Uranchimeg, 45, lives with her 5 children in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Govisumber province, Mongolia. She has raised her children alone since her husband passed away a few years ago. Four of Uranchimeg's children are college students.

Uranchimeg operates a food making and sales business, selling food to train passengers. The trains come 2 or 3 times a day. Uranchimeg started her business in 1997, and her oldest son helps her with it. Uranchimeg operates her business in a ger. She is a hardworking and good-natured woman. Her children's education is very important to her, and she needs to expand her business to pay for her children's tuition. Uranchimeg would like to increase the types of products she sells. She says, "I am working for my children's future. I have to save enough money for their college tuition." Uranchimeg is requesting 500,000 MNT to buy a cover for her business ger, for protection from cold and rain.

loans.use: To buy a cover for her business ger (yurt)

loans.name: 29 De Noviembre Group

texts.es:
En la parroquia de Rio Verde en la ciudad de Santo Domingo Ecuador viven tres mujeres Gladys, Ketty y Bertha. Ellas son amigas y conocidas de hace mucho tiempo, y hoy solicitan un crédito grupal de Kiva para cada una poder mejorar diferentes aéreas de sus negocios. Santo Domingo es una ciudad bastante grande, que se ubica prácticamente en el centro de Ecuador uniendo la Costa y la Sierra por una carretera que va desde el nivel del mar hasta los 2800 metros de altura. Debido a esto Santo Domingo se caracteriza por ser una ciudad de bastante comercio y trafico turístico. Otro factor muy interesante es que por su ubicación e importancia Santo Domingo se ha convertido en una de las ciudades más multiculturales del Ecuador. Todo esto convive bajo un clima húmedo tropical a una altura de 200 metros.
Gladys tiene un pequeño puesto donde vende colas y aguas, este negocio es muy pequeño y no alcanza a cubrir las necesidades de Gladys y sus 4 hijos, por lo que el préstamo solicitado a través de KIVA es muy importante para ella, le permitiría comprarse un congelador y además comprar más mercancía, si todo sale bien con esto Gladys podría algún día cumplir su sueño de ser dueña de su propia tienda.
Ketty por otro lado, tiene un pequeño bazar y perfumería. Ella necesita su préstamo para poder invertir en materiales para la venta como lápices, libros, cuadernos etc. El sueño de Ketty es ver a su hijo convertirse en un profesional, por lo que necesita producir más plata para poder pagar sus estudios de colegio y universidad eventualmente. Ketty trabaja alrededor de 6 horas diarias y su esposo también ayuda en la casa con su trabajo de mecánico, pero Ketty necesita vender más para poder cubrir todos sus gastos.
Finalmente tenemos a Bertha, ella es dueña de un puesto de venta de carnes asadas, Bertha tiene dos hijos en edad de escuela y tiene muchos sueños, principalmente comprar su propia casa, ver a sus hijos convertirse en profesionales y ser dueña de su propio restaurante. Sin embargo el primer paso para ella es acceder a este préstamo para poder invertir en materia prima y mejorar sus ventas. 
Todas estas mujeres son ejemplos de madres. Para las tres ha resultado muy  difícil acceder a créditos ya que dos de ellas solo cuentan con estudios primarios y una con secundaria, ninguna asistió a la universidad y han tenido que ingeniárselas y aprender en el acto para poder sobrevivir. Todas tienen ya por lo menos algunos años de experiencia con sus negocios y resulta fundamental poder adquirir sus préstamos para poder dar el siguiente paso y seguir creciendo, por su bien y el de su familia.
texts.en: Gladys, Ketty and Bertha are three women who live in the parish of Rio Verde in the city of Santo Domingo, Ecuador. They are friends and have known each other a long time, and they are requesting this group loan from Kiva so each can improve different areas of their businesses. Santo Domingo is a rather large city located in practically the center of Ecuador, with a highway running through it linking the coast with the mountains going from sea level to 2,800 meters (9,180 feet) above it. Because of this, Santo Domingo is known for being a rather commercial city with a lot of tourist traffic. Another very interesting item of note is that thanks to its location and importance the city has become one of the most multicultural in Ecuador. All of this coexists under a humid tropical climate 200 meters (650 feet) above sea level. Gladys has a small drink stand where she sells colas and water. This business is very small and it doesn't meet the needs of Gladys and her four children. Requesting this loan through Kiva is very important to her because it will allow her to purchase a freezer as well as more merchandise. If everything goes well, Gladys will be able to one day fulfill her dream of being owner of her own store. Ketty, on the other hand, has a small store and perfume shop. She is requesting the loan to invest in items to sell like pencils, books, notepads and other items. Her dream is to see her son become a professional, so she needs to earn more money to be able to eventually pay for his college education. Ketty works about six hours every day, and her husband, who is a mechanic, also helps out, but she needs to increase her sales in order to cover all of their expenses. Finally there is Bertha, who owns a stand selling grilled meats. She has two school-age children and has a lot of dreams, chiefly to buy her own home, see her children become professionals and to own a restaurant. Of course, the first step is to get this loan so she can be able to purchase supplies and increase her sales. All of these women are model mothers, but it has been difficult to receive a loan since two of them only have elementary-school educations, and the other a high-school education. None of them attended a university, and they all have had to make do and learn on the fly to get by. All of them now have at least a few years of experience with their businesses, and acquiring loans is essential to be able to take the next step and keep growing, for their own good as well as that of their families.

loans.use: to purchase a freezer and buy supplies.

loans.name: Perveen's Group

texts.en:
Perveen is married and the mother of two daughters and two sons. Due to financial constraints, she couldn’t provide education to her children. At present, three of her children work while her eldest daughter remains at home and helps Perveen with her routine tasks.

Perveen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband, who is a fruit seller. He will use the loan investment to buy a variety of seasonal fruits to sell for profit. Perveen's husband is experienced in his business and Perveen is confident that the loan will help him make his business more profitable.

loans.use: To buy fresh seasonal fruits

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: El señor José es casado y tiene tres hijos, trabaja en una maquila como técnico en mantenimiento mientras que su esposa se dedica a las labores del hogar. Debido al incremento de la violencia en este país se ha tenido que preocupar por el bienestar de su familia procurando que en el interior de su casa estén seguros por ello planea la construcción de la barda trasera en su vivienda.
texts.en: José is married and has three children.  He works in a factory as a maintenance technician while his wife maintains their home.  Due to the increase in violence in this country, he has had to worry about his family’s well-being.  He is trying to make sure that they are safe inside the house and to do that he plans to build a fence behind the home.

loans.use: to build a fence behind his house.

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en: Chizi is married and is the mother of six children, three of whom attend school and the other three are adults. She operated a food stand in front of the local school. Chizi's biggest customers are students and teachers. Once in a while she travels to Mombasa to bring back merchandise because she still gets orders. Chizi  is requesting the loan to purchase bread products, meat, oils, vegetables, and other ingredients to make the meals she serves at the stand.

loans.use: to purchase bread products, meat, oils, vegetables, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a 35-year-old married man. He has 3 children who range in age from 2 years old to 5 years old. He describes himself as business-minded and visionary. 

Daniel operates a general store where he sells household products such as spare parts, balls, toothbrushes, house decorations, etc. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a conducive business environment and his primary customers are local residents. Daniel describes the delay of payment from his customers as his biggest business challenge. He will use the loan of 20,000 KES to buy more household products. 

Daniel's business goal is to improve his business and make it more profitable within 5 years. He hopes that in the future he will have ventured into the hotel business.

loans.use: to buy more household products.

loans.name: Touk

texts.en:
Touk is one of the residents of the Baray District, Kompong Tom Province. She is 44 years old and is married to Oum, her business partner. This couple doesn’t have any children but they wish to have one soon. Touk generates her income from crops husbandry. She owns a few plots of farmland for growing rice, vegetables, and other seasoning crops. She has been doing this for over 10 years. 

In order to further improve her farming business, Touk needs sufficient funds to purchase an additional plot of land to increase her production throughout the year. Consequently, she has applied for a loan from HKL in the sum of 2,400,000 KHR.  She believes that this loan will contribute to developing her business as well as improving her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase an additional plot of land.

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka lives with her partner Jumaa in Likoni, Kenya. They both work in the retail trade. Mwaka has a well-stocked vegetable store and she sells wholesale to retailers. In her store she sells vegetables, fruit, tomatoes, potatoes, and onions. Mwaka is a self-sacrificing person who works hard each day to get ahead and improve her quality of life.

Mwaka will use this loan to buy vegetables, fruit, meat, etc. She thanks Yehu Microfinance and Kiva for the assistance that she is receiving.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruit, meat, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, and feminine accessories to sell.

loans.name: Erdenchimeg

texts.en:
Erdenchimeg lives with her 2 daughters in a ger (mongolian yurt) in the Govisumber province, Mongolia. She is a single mother. Her older daughter is a college student in the capital city Ulaanbaatar and her younger daughter is a secondary school student. She has been selling foods, snacks, and beverages to train passengers at the train station in Govisumber. 

Erdenchimeg started her business in 1996. Her younger daughter helps her. She is a very hard-working, responsible woman. In the future, she wants to rent a counter in a market in order to expand her business. She says, "I want to expand my business to generate income. Soon, both my daughters will be in college. I have to be ready for their college tuition". The amount she is requesting is 850,000 MNT to pay her daughter's tuition fee.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's tuition fee.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
This is Olivia, 53, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Ruben, a driver, and is mother to their children. By the grace of God, Olivia has managed to support her children's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Olivia oversees operations of their tricycle transportation business. They have one tricycle that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. She earns the boundary (daily quota) their driver remits each day. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine pesos (PHP) every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 8,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan for spare parts and maintenance of her tricycle. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Olivia dreams of being able to buy another tricycle unit soon. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week. This is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of her tricycle unit

loans.name: Nyamsuren

texts.en:
Nyamsuren is a 44 year old man who lives with his wife and 5 children in a ger (mongolian yurt) in Uvs Province, Mongolia. His oldest son is disabled. The other four children are secondary school students. 

Nyamsuren has run an agriculture business since 2006. His wife helps with his business. He owns 6 acres of hayfield.  Every year, he cuts 35 tons of grass to sell. Nyamsuren is a hard working and open minded man. He needs to expand his business to support his family. Therefore, he would like to  plant organic potatoes in 1 acre of the land he owns to expand his business. 

Nyamsuren is requesting 2,500,000 MNT to buy organic potato seeds at wholesale prices and parts for a tractor, which will be used to plant potato seeds. He says: "My children soon will start college, I have to be ready for their college tuition. I want to expand my business and generate more income to support my family."

loans.use: to buy organic potato seeds at wholesale prices and parts for a tractor, which will be used to plant potato seeds.

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is from Samburu, Kenya. She is 34 years old and married to Munga, who is a driver. The couple have one child who attends school. 

Chizi has a small grocery store where she supplies her neighbors and casual customers, providing them with the best prices, quality, and variety of products. She is a very hard-working and unassuming lady who has been working with Yehu Microfinance for 2 years. She is very grateful for the trust they have placed in her.

Chizi is requesting this loan to buy drinks, sugar, rice, noodles, dairy products, and other supplies she needs to stock her business. This will allow her to keep working.

loans.use: to buy drinks, sugar, rice, noodles, dairy products, and other supplies.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 41-year-old married man. He has 3 children who range in age from 6 years old to 12 years old. He describes himself as a prayerful and honest man. 

David operates a motorbike with which he provides transportation services. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His business is located in a conducive business environment and his primary customers are passengers. David describes the stiff competition within the area as his biggest business challenge. He will use the loan of 20,000 KES to buy household goods for resale for running a new retail shop. His business goal is to run a supermarket within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will have had a succesful retail shop in his town.

loans.use: to buy household goods for resale for running a new retail shop.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 34 years old and a single mother to her eight year old son. She has a Sari-sari store business which she started 10 years ago. She sell items like toiletries, chips, seasoning, snack foods, noodles, eggs and canned goods. She is barely earning an income of 2000 PHP per month with her business. Yolanda is requesting for a loan to purchase additional items to sell, such as noodles and canned goods. 

In the future, she hopes to have enough savings to provide for her son's needs.

loans.use: to purchase additional noodles and canned goods to sell

loans.name: Phem

texts.en:
Phem, age 51, is picture in this photo with her husband in their home, located in the Baray district of Kompong Tom province, Cambodia. Phem is responsible for four single children, all of whom are working for garment factories in Phnom Penh. Recently, Phem has been operating a small canteen, from which she sells breakfast and lunch to young students of a primary school. Her husband works at a motorcycle repair service in his commune to contribute his income for the family. 

With loan amount of USD 800, Phem would like to buy timber to renovate and expand her canteen. And with the remainder, she will buy spare motorcycle parts for her husband’s business. Phem hopes that this loan will be granted to her to improve her business and living standard. She believes that she can raise her family out of poverty someday through her sacrifice and effort.

loans.use: to renovate and expand her food canteen.

loans.name: Hiari Ya Moyo Group

texts.en:
Mwanahamisi is in her late 40's and married with four children who go to school. Since earlier in 2012, she has been running a retail shop and sell clothes as well. She works from 9:00 am to 9:00 pm daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be Mwanahamisi's 6th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy chicken feed for her broiler chicken, restock the missing items in her shop, buy iron sheets, buy bricks, and pay school fees. She has paid back all her loans successfully. Now she would like a loan to increase her shop inventory and buy more clothes to resell. Her dream is to one day be able to finish building her house.

Mwanahamisi will share this loan with her loan group "Hiari ya Moyo," which has a total of 16 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to increase shop inventory and buy more clothes to resell.

loans.name: Esse Group

texts.fr: ESSE est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Roselyne Larissa (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 28 ans et est mariée à un certain Franck. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Roselyne Larissa vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Roselyne Larissa assure ensemble avec son mari, les différentes charges de la maison. Depuis près de dix ans, Roselyne Larissa vend des tissus et des glacières par le système de distribution. Roselyne Larissa s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin et au Togo. C’est la troisième fois que, Roselyne Larissa et les autres membres du groupe ESSE sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité afin de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. Les deux premiers crédits reçus ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The ESSE group consists of three members who live in the same neighborhood.  The group's representative (raising her hand in the photo) is named Roselyne Larissa.  She is 28 years old and married to a man named Franck. 

Roselyne Larissa and Franck have three children.  Some of their children go to school and all are their dependents.  Roselyne Larissa lives with her husband and children.  The couple jointly takes care of the various household expenses.

Roselyne Larissa  has been selling fabrics and ice boxes through the distribution system, for close to ten years.  She buys her goods at a market in Benin and in Togo.

It is the third time that Roselyne Larissa and the other members of the ESSE group are requesting financial assistance from ALIDé in order to strengthen their working capital and their activity, and to better meet their customers' demand.

Their two previous loans have been duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and ice boxes.

loans.name: Raheli

texts.en:
Raheli is 36 years old and has two children, all of whom still attend school. She has various sewing machines that she uses for her sewing and dressmaking jobs, which provide a large part of her household income. 

Raheli has been in this business for four years. She provides her customers with excellent service and also helps her family. Raheli's goals are to continue working and to become a successful micro-entrepreneur. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy supplies such as fabrics, thread, lace, and other items. Raheli is grateful for the assistance, which will allow her to grow in her enterprise and quickly accomplish the goals she has set for herself as an entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, thread, lace, and other supplies.

loans.name: Minangueze Group

texts.fr: MINANGUEZE est un groupe de quatre personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier.  La représentante  du  groupe, Évelyne (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 44 ans et est mariée à un certain Médard. Le couple a quatre enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Éveline vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Depuis près de dix ans, Évelyne vend divers produits vivriers (maïs, ignames, bouillie, et beignets) à son domicile. Éveline s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. C’est la deuxième fois que Évelyne et les autres membres du groupe MINANGUEZE sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité afin de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. Le premier  crédit reçu a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The MINANGUEZE group consists of four members who live in the same neighborhood. The group's representative (raising her hand in the photo) is named Évelyne. She is 44 years old and married to a man named Médard.

Évelyne and Médard have four children who are all in school and all their dependents.  Évelyne lives with her husband and children. The couple jointly takes care of the various household expenses.

Évelyne has been selling food products (maize, yams, porridge and fritters) from her home, for close to ten years. She buys her goods at a market in Benin.

It is the second time that Évelyne and the other members of the MINANGUEZE group are requesting financial assistance from ALIDé in order to strengthen their working capital and their activity, and to better meet their customers' demand.

Their previous loan has been duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy various food products (maize, yams, porridge and fritters).

loans.name: Semevo Group

texts.fr: Le groupe SEMEVO est formé de trois personnes qui habitent dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Lydia, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Lydia est âgée de 43 ans et a peu fréquenté l’école. Lydia est mariée à un certain François. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et sont à leur charge. Lydia vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et subvient ensemble aux divers besoins du ménage. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Lydia vend du jus de bissaps et des glaces dans un quartier du Bénin depuis près de dix ans. Lydia s’approvisionne dans une région du Bénin. Dans le souci de renforcer davantage son activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Lydia désire augmenter le stock de ses produits. Pour ce faire, Lydia sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe SEMEVO, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits consentis antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The Semevo group is composed of three individuals living in the same neighborhood.  The group’s representative, by the name of Lydia, is the one raising her hand in the photo. This is the third time that the group is seeking financial support from ALIDé in order to expand their business. Lydia is 43 years old. She has had little formal education. Lydia is married to Francois. They have three dependent children, all in school. Lydia lives together with her husband and children and, jointly with her husband, provides for household needs. In order to earn a living, Lydia has been selling hibiscus juice of and ice cream in a district of Benin for 10 years. Lydia stocks up in a region of Benin. With the goal of strengthening her business and better meeting customer demand, Lydia would like to increase her stock. In order to do so, Lydia, together with other members of the Semevo group, is seeking her third loan from ALIDé. Their prior loans have been duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy sugar, hibiscus leaves and plastic bags.

loans.name: Ofiyat

texts.ru: Офият-женщина средних лет,образованная и имеет троих детей.Опытный бухгалтер с большим стажем работы постоянно работает, так как её профессия очень востребована. Офият также после рабочего дня занимается рукоделием и мастерством- она золотошвейка.Шьет народные изделия и вышивает золотыми нитками.Её продукцию покупают невесты и женихи,на мероприятия также делают подарки её товар.Её муж и сын также работают в цехе по производству пластиковых окон и дверей.В семье все работают и вместе делят расходы.По совету своей подруги,которая кредитуется у нас,она пришла в нашу организацию и решила получить кредит на покупку скота.На этот кредит она купила два барана и откормила их несколько месяцев.Продав готовых баранов, Офият потратила вырученные деньги на мероприятие сына.Теперь на полученный кредит она хочет купить себе ювелирные изделия потому что давно об этом мечтала. Очень благодарит нас за помощь и надеется не прерывать сотрудничество.
texts.en:
Ofiyat is an educated middle-aged woman with three children. She is an experienced accountant with a long professional history and is constantly employed as her specialty is in high demand. In her free time, Ofiyat likes to work with her hands - she sews traditional items and decorates them with gold thread embroidery. Her products are popular with brides and grooms and are also used as gifts at other festivities. Ofiyat's husband and son are also employed - they work at a factory that manufactures plastic frames for doors and windows. Everyone in the family works and shares in all expenses.

On advice of her friend who is also a client of MDO Arvand, LLC, Ofiyat turned to this organization for a loan to purchase livestock. Using that loan, she bought two sheep and fattened them over the course of several months. Having sold the sheep, Ofiyat spent her profits on an event for her son. Using the current loan, she would like to buy some jewelry for herself, as this has been a longtime dream of hers. She thanks MDO Arvand, LLC for their help and hopes to continue using their services.

loans.use: to buy jewelry

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is from Samburu, Kenya. She is 25 years old and is the companion of Nimrod. She works selling fruits and vegetables in a little shed from home.

With sacrifice and dedication, and with the help of her husband, Joyce has managed to get her two children ahead. She is a very hardworking woman who always has worked and is not afraid of challenges. Her goal is to be able to continue growing and to have a bigger shed, so she can continue helping her family and her husband.

Joyce is applying for a loan from Yehu Microfinance and Kiva to buy vegetables such as tomatoes, green peppers, carrots, and onions as well as seasonal fruit to be able to supply her business with top-quality products for customers.

loans.use: to buy vegetables such as tomatoes, green peppers, carrots, and onions.

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en: Elenita is 54 years old and lives in Poblacion 2, Sikatuna Bohol. She is married with four children ages 18, 26, 28 and 30. She produces home-cooked snacks like rice cakes and sweetened rice cakes. She has been doing this business for 17 years now. She is requesting a loan to buy ground rice, sticky rice, coconut and sugar. In the future, she would like to have a bigger and better business that produces more so she can have a stable income.

loans.use: to buy ground rice, sticky rice, coconut and sugar.

loans.name: Adolat

texts.ru: Адолат 1962 года рождения. Она замужем имеет 2 детей, ее муж работает в гостинице. Адолат живет недалеко от города, в районе где она живет  есть небольшой салон красоты где она работает. Она  хороший специалист - парикмахер. В этом салоне есть также свадебные платья и другие аксессуары. Она наняла двух специалистов по дизайну бровей и макияжу. Им она платит определенную заработную плату. Сейчас у Адолат сезон, много свадеб и многие девушки приходят к ней делать стрижку и свадебные прически.На полученный кредит она хочет открыть новый салон так как  помещение  старого салона маленькое.
texts.en: Adolat was born in 1962. She is married and has 2 children; her husband works in a hotel. Adolat lives in the suburbs and works as a hairdresser in a beauty salon located in her neighbourhood. The salon also sells wedding dresses and accessories. Adolat has hired two assistants who specialize in eyebrow design and makeup, and pays them a regular salary. Currently, it is Adolat's busy season with many weddings taking place, and many young women come to her salon for haircuts and styling. Using this loan, Adolat would like to open a new salon as the current location is too small.

loans.use: to open a new beauty salon

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis tiene 37 años, es un hombre honesto, responsable y muy trabajador. Tiene una relación de convivencia desde hace 4 años con Mariela, aún no tienen hijos porque esperan consolidarse económicamente porque quieren que sus futuros hijos tengan todas las comodidades de los que ellos carecieron cuando fueron niños. Actualmente viven en la casa de su suegra y espera pronto conseguir su terreno para formar su hogar independiente.

Su negocio consiste en la venta de abarrotes al por menor, para eso ha designado un espacio amplio dentro de su vivienda en el que ofrece a la venta diferentes comestibles; tales como arroz, leche, azúcar, pan, aceite, huevos, tubérculos, menestras y verduras. El buen trato que ofrece a sus clientes y la calidad de los productos han convertido su bodega en la favorita y en la más concurrida de su comunidad, ya que los que acuden a su local saben que encontrarán justo lo que buscan, esto le ha traído muchos beneficios económicos y le genera muy buenas ganancias que le permite ahorrar un determinado monto semanal para conseguir una de sus metas lo más pronto posible, comprar una casa para vivir con su pareja. Lleva en este negocio alrededor de un año; sin embargo, eventualmente ha venido trabajando desde hace 10 años como mototaxista y le dedica a esta actividad de 4 a 6 horas al día y mientras hace esto, su pareja lo ayuda en la atención de la bodega.
Le gusta mucho lo que hace porque los ingresos que percibe de su bodega cubrieron todas sus expectativas económicas, ya que sus ganancias le han servido para pagar todas sus deudas y necesidades. Ahora, en su camino de crecimiento, espera pronto poder ampliar su negocio para poder vender más y seguir ahorrando para su casa.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por tanto agradece a quienes lo hacen posible, para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, está muy comprometido a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas con mucha responsabilidad. Y está muy contento de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos sus integrantes son muy buenos, amables y solidarios entre sí.
Con el monto solicitado (S/. 800) comprará más de los productos que tienen mayor demanda por su clientela: arroz, azúcar, tubérculos y menestras.
texts.en:
Luis, 37, is an honest, responsible, and very hardworking man.  He has lived with Mariela for four years.  They don't have children yet.  They want to strengthen themselves economically because they want their future children to have all the comforts that they lacked when they were children.  Currently they live in his mother-in-law's house, and he hopes to get his own piece of land soon to make a home on his own.

The good treatment he gives his customers and the quality of his products have turned his grocery store into the favorite and busiest in his community, because those who come to his store know they will find exactly what they're looking for.  This has brought him a lot of economic benefits and generates very good earnings that allow him to save a set sum every week to realize one of his goals as soon as possible, to buy a house to live in with his partner.

He has had this business for around a year.  Nevertheless, he has been working for possibly 10 years as a motorcycle taxi driver, and he devotes four to six hours a day to it.  While he does this, his partner helps him take care of the store.  His business consists of selling retail groceries, for which he has designated an extensive space in his home where he sells various food products such as rice, milk, sugar, bread, oil, eggs, tubers, mixed vegetables, and vegetables.  

He likes what he does a lot because the income he earns from his store covers all his economic prospects because his profits have served to pay all his debts and needs.  Now, on his road to growth, he hopes that soon he will be able to expand his business to be able to sell more and continue saving for his house.

This is his first loan with MFP.  He is grateful to those who are making it possible to continue with his goals.  On the other hand, he is very committed to making his payments punctually and very responsibly.  He is very happy to belong to his communal bank because all of the members are very good, kind, and supportive among themselves.

With the requested amount (800 soles [PEN]) he will buy more of the products that are in greatest demand from his customers: rice, sugar, tubers, and mixed vegetables.

loans.use: to buy products to stock his store.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Najminiso

texts.ru: Нажминисо 1955 года рождения, вот уже много лет живет одна с дочерью. Но она не падает духом и надеется на то что у нее все будет хорошо. Дочь также помогает поддерживать семейный очаг работает домработницей в одной семье. Сама Нажминисо работает учительницей в местной школе. Но получаемая заработная плата  недостаточна для улучшения жилищных условия проживания.  Настоящий кредит получила для ремонта своего дома. Она давно не делала ремонт в своем доме и после сильного дождя весной у нее протекает крыша. Она с дочерью  очень рада, что могут получить поддержку от Арванд, и улучшат свои условия проживания.
texts.en: Najminiso was born in 1955. For many years now she has lived alone with her daughter, but she stays positive and hopes that everything in her life will be fine. Najminiso's daughter helps keep the home fires burning and works as a housekeeper for a family, while Najminiso works as a teacher in a local school. However, their salaries are not sufficient to improve their living conditions. Najminiso received this loan to carry out repairs in her home. No renovations have been done in the house for a long time, and the roof leaks after spring rains. Najminiso and her daughter are very glad to receive support from MDO Arvand, LLC and to be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to repair her house

loans.name: Uy

texts.en: Uy is from Baray district, Kompong Tom province. She is 28 years of age, married, and has two school-aged children. She sells groceries at a neighborhood store located in her house, earning approximately USD 2.00 each day to supplement her husband's income. She has been in this business for four years. Recently Uy’s family began experiencing difficulties in living because her present house is suffering from the rain during this rainy season. It was built a long time ago and some parts of it are decayed, so it’s hard to for the family to live. To solve the problem, Uy wants to borrow some funds to add to her capital to buy timber, columns and wooden boards used in construction. She hopes that lenders will help to better her situation and lend her this loan.

loans.use: to buy timber, columns and wooden boards used in the construction.

loans.name: Melissa

texts.en:
This is Melissa. She previously borrowed a 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) loan that she used to purchase spare parts and supplies needed in her vehicle repair shop. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for a 8,000 PHP loan for her to buy spare parts and supplies and for maintenance of her shop. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Melissa dreams to be able to send all of her children to college. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts, other items and supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica is a 25-year-old married woman. She has a daughter who is 11 months old. She describes herself to be honest and faithful. She operates a retail stall where she sells plastic items such as bowls, plates, spoons, etc. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located within a market and her primary customers are retailers. In addition, she practices farming so as to increase her daily income. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) loan to buy plastic items. Veronica had taken a loan of 10,000 KES from SMEP DTM which she managed to repay well. Her business goal is to buy a motorbike to help in distributing the products to customers within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have had expanded her business and venture into a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to purchase plastic items.

loans.name: Ek

texts.en:
Ek, age 34, is a humble villager from Baray district, Kompong Tom province. She lives there with her family: her husband and three school-age children. She earns a living through crops, primarily growing and harvesting rice and potatoes for sale. She has been doing this since 2009. Ek’s husband is the main income provider of the family. He buys and collects firewood to stock, and then he transports them to sell in the marketplaces of the province.

As of now, Ek would like to take out a loan in the sum of $1,000 USD to add to her savings to buy two cows, which they will use in transporting the firewood and also for the farming business. She is very happy and grateful for the support of her family’s business. With the help of the loan, Ek believes that she will be able to stabilize their financial income to ensure a good living status for her children.

loans.use: to buy two cows, which she will use in transporting firewood and also for her farming business.

loans.name: Goodwork Group

texts.en:
Agropina, who is in her late 30s, is married with three children who are still going to school. She has been running a food vendor business and selling charcoall for five and a half years now. She works from 6:00 am to 8:00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be her 10th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to buy a plot of land, pay school fees and household expenses, start selling charcoal, restock missing items in her food store, and start building her house.  She has paid back all of her loans successfully.  She wants a loan to buy more stock of food in order to sell to more people and to buy more sacks of charcoal.  Her dream is to one day be able to finish building her house.

Agropina will share this loan with her loan group, "Goodwork," which has a total of 16 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more stock of food to sell to more people and to buy more sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Shallon

texts.en: Shallon is an old client in her second loan cycle now. Her first loan was 500,000 UGX (Ugandan shillings), which she serviced well, and she is now borrowing UGX 1,000,000. The client rears pigs, which is her main source of income. She buys piglets that she de-worms and feeds until they are mature enough for sale. The client has managed to supplement her husband's income, and together, they have managed to buy a piece of land from which they have planted coffee which will supplement their income. From her piggery, she has also managed to take her children to fairly good schools and also provide for her family needs. She hopes to borrow more money from Ugafode to expand her business so that she can buy a larger piece of land to rear more pigs.

loans.use: To restock more pigs for sale.

loans.name: Cerapio

texts.en:
Cerapio is a Peruvian textile artisan who specializes in hand woven rugs and tapestries. He would like to renovate and expand his workshop.

Cerapio has been selling through NOVICA since 1999. This is his story:

Cerapio was forced to leave his home in Ayacucho during the 1980s. "Terrorists were bleeding my people to death and there seemed little hope. I inherited my passion for weaving from my parents and grandparents. But the quality of my work is the result of my long experience, and a product of my careful observation over the years. I draw inspiration from our ancient Peruvian cultures, Andean village life, and from our snow-capped mountains."

"Over the past 12 years, I've expanded my artistic repertoire from a few designs to a large collection of rugs and tapestries. I've been able to offer work to other textile artisans from my hometown, and train new ones as well. I am proud of carrying on my family's artisan legacy, and I'm very grateful for your support."

Use the link below to view Cerapio's rugs and tapestries on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=194

loans.use: to renovate and expand his workshop

loans.name: Kenari

texts.en:
Kenari creates handcrafted silver jewelry with semi-precious gemstones. She'd like to buy silver and gemstones in bulk to obtain the best possible price.

Kenari has been selling through NOVICA since 2006. This is her story:

"I come from Celuk, famous for its gold and silversmiths, so I learned to design and craft jewelry from a very young age," says Kenari. "In 2003, I married an artist from Gianyar and went to live with his family, as Balinese tradition dictates. However, I was obsessed with crafting jewelry and, fortunately, my husband understood."

"My family and I would like to send our gratitude to all of you who support me with this micro credit. I hope to continue developing my workshop. Thank you so much for helping me. God bless you."

Use the link below to view Kenari's jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=5467

loans.use: to purchase sterling silver and gemstones in bulk

loans.name: Sarjana

texts.en:
Sarjana is an artisan who specializes in Balinese jewelry. He would like to purchase a good stock of silver to continue crafting his creations.

Sarjana has been selling through NOVICA since 2000. This is his story:

Sarjana has fine-tuned his skills over the years to become one of the most talented and innovative craftsmen in his village. "I am the eldest of three children from a family of artists, but I was the first in my family to work with silver. My main inspirations come from nature and the daily life around me. Flowers and animals are my favorite subjects, but sometimes abstract geometrical shapes come into my mind."

"I really expect this support will make the work process at my workshop run smoother. This interest-free micro credit is like a lubricant that can help move along the crafting process so we can build up our stock and fulfill increasing orders. Thank you so much!"

Use the link below to view Sarjana's jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=823

loans.use: to purchase sterling silver in bulk

loans.name: Kadek

texts.en:
As an artisan specializing in jewelry, Kadek would like to invest in the purchase of raw materials such as natural gemstones and sterling silver.

Kadek has been selling through NOVICA since 2006. This is his story:

Kadek was literally born into the world of jewelry making. "My parents and most people in my neighborhood are silversmiths. My parents used to say, if you make something, don't use only your hands but also all of your heart. This way everything you make will have spirit. This is really true. My favorite activity is to combine the skill I have with the beauty of Balinese tradition and nature – like dance, carvings, beaches and landscapes – to create silver jewelry. I love something simple, comfortable and good to look at."

"The problem with not being able to purchase significant amounts of raw materials is that it slows down production when demand is high. I am grateful for your support through this interest-free micro credit, and I hope it can help me develop my business."

Use the link below to view Kadek's jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=5917

loans.use: to make a bulk purchase of raw materials for his jewelry

loans.name: Jihad

texts.en: Jihad, 42, is a married woman caring for three children.  She buys and sells birds at home to make additional income for the family. She has applied for this loan in order to buy more birds with new cages.

loans.use: to buy more birds with new cages.

loans.name: Milton

texts.en: Milton is an old client with Ugafode in his 5th cycle now. The client has borrowed a loan of 2,000,000 UGX to complete his house. The building doubles as a commercial and residential house for his family. The client has acquired several loans to complete the building and it's now in the final phases. He attributes his decent housing to the Flexible Housing Loan product offered by Ugafode. The client's source of income is a maize mill, which he also acquired from a loan borrowed from Ugafode. He uses it to process maize into flour ready for sale. He engages in agriculture and grows most of the maize, though he buys some to supplement his stock. The client has managed to construct a shed for his mill and a decent house for his family as a result of The Flexible Housing Loan offered by Ugafode.

loans.use: To complete his house

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal is a 33 year old, divorced woman. 

Amal is a member of the neighborhood committee, she has agreed with the committee to use one of their rooms to conduct different training courses, mostly for youth.  She also works reviewing and editing books before publishing for some publishers.

Now Amal has applied to this loan to enhance the training room and add more tools so the training will be more effective.

loans.use: to enhance the training room and add more training tools.

loans.name: Kawthar

texts.en:
Kawthar, a 34 year old, single lady, is the oldest among 11 brothers and sisters.

Kawthar works as a farmer.  She also used to sell snacks and candy from her house.  Recently a committee has been established for kids and also a public garden and playing ground for the neighborhood, so Kawthar decided to seize this opportunity to expand her business.  She went to the committee and signed a renting contract to open a small snacks shop in the garden.

Now Kawthar has applied for this loan in order to buy more snacks and drinks to sell in the shop.

loans.use: to buy more snacks and drinks to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy spare parts and supplies to repair his motorcycle.

loans.name: Celia Julia

texts.es:
Celia es una mujer de 48 años, vive en la ciudad de Pisco con su pareja y su pequeño hijo, ella es una persona muy alegre, entusiasta y trabajadora, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos para sacar adelante a su familia y brindar un mejor futuro para su pequeño hijo, lamentablemente Celia concluyó sus estudios secundarios, pero por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar una carrera universitaria, por ello Celia desea asegurar el bienestar y futuro de su pequeño para que sea un buen profesional y una persona de bien.
Con el apoyo de su pareja y el gran deseo de salir adelante, desde hace 2 años Celia puso en marcha su pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes, ella dedica a su negocio un aproximado de 12 horas diarias, en las cuales puede atender un promedio de 35 clientes, ella cree que su negocio marcha bien debido a los buenos precios y al trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Celia se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mercadería, tales como arroz, azúcar, aceite, leche, detergentes, entre otros; de esta manera Celia tendrá su negocio mejor abastecido y podrá incrementar sus ventas e ingresos económicos, ya que con ellos poco a poco en futuro no muy lejano desea poder terminar de construir su vivienda y así brindar una mejor calidad de vida para su familia.
texts.en:
Celia is 48 years old, she lives in the city of Pisco with her partner and her young son. She is a very happy, enthusiastic and hard-working person who makes every effort to provide for her family and give her young son a brighter future. Celia unfortunately finished her studies at secondary school level, due to a lack of financial resources she was unable to pursue a university course, which is why Celia wants to secure the well-being and future of her son so that he can be a good professional and a true person. 

With the support of her partner, and her keen desire to get ahead, Celia opened her small grocery store 2 years ago. She works roughly 12 hours a day, during which time she serves an average of 35 customers. She believes that her business is doing well thanks to the good prices and the friendly service she gives her customers.

Celia is extremely grateful to the Kiva loan lenders as thanks to the help they give, she will be able to buy merchandise such as rice, sugar, oil, milk and detergents amongst others. In this way, Celia will have a store that is better stocked and she will be able to increase her sales and financial income. With these increased sales, little by little and in a not-so-distant future, she hopes to be able to finish building her home and give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as rice, sugar, oil, milk and detergents, etc.

loans.name: Rita

texts.es:
Rita tiene 50 años, está casada con Julio, de 51 años. Tienen nueve hijos, pero sólo viven con tres de ellos: Gerson de 14, Ursula de 12 y Jordan de 10 años de edad. Todos viven en su casa propia, la que construyó poco a poco durante varios años. Se ubica en la localidad cafetalera de Sanchirio.

Ella es una mujer de coraje y empeño, su trabajo es la agricultura. Todas las mañanas, junto a su esposo, se dirigen a cuidar sus plantaciones de café, plátanos y yuca. Lo que más le gusta es ver crecer con salud y firmeza a sus cultivos, pues ve reflejado todo su esfuerzo. La venta la hacen a las cooperativas acopiadoras de café y a los compradores de plátanos y yuca de la ciudad. Para ello, debe trasladar su producción en una hora de viaje. Sus principales compradores son de la misma zona, ya que en los 20 años de experiencia en esta actividad obtuvo buenos clientes quienes conocen la calidad de sus productos. Ahora Rita está pensando en mejorar su producción, para ello deberá limpiar y abonar con mayor frecuencia.

Es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP y agradece la oportunidad que le ofreció su banco comunal “Progreso del Palomar”, donde está segura que saldrá adelante, porque es uno de los grupos más íntegros de la provincia.
Ella invertirá el dinero en la compra de varias bolsas de abono orgánico, lo que esparcirá en sus cultivos de café.
texts.en:
Rita is 50 years old, she is married to Julio, who is 51. They have nine children, but only live with three of them: Gerson, 14, Ursula, 12, and Jordan, aged 10. They all live in their own home which was built little by little over several years. It is located in the Sanchirio coffee region.

Rita is a courageous and determined woman who works in agriculture. Every morning, along with her husband, they head for the coffee, banana and yuca plantations to tend them. What she likes the most is seeing her crops grow to become healthy and strong, as it reflects all her hard work. They sell to coffee cooperatives, and to banana and yuca vendors in the city. To do so, she must transport her produce for one hour. Her main customers are from the same area, as with 20 years of experience in this activity, she has obtained good customers who recognize the quality of her products. Rita is now thinking of improving her production, and to do so, she will clean and fertilize more frequently.

This is the second loan which she has taken out from MFP and she is grateful for the opportunity which the communal bank “Progreso del Palomar” has given her. She is confident of getting ahead, as this bank is one of the groups with the most members in the province. 

Rita will invest the money into the purchase of several bags of organic fertilizer which she will spread on her coffee crops.

loans.use: to buy bags of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis tiene 23 años, es soltero. Vive en una casa humilde, pero propia, que construyó a base de mucho esfuerzo, en un terreno que sus padres le heredaron. Se ubica entre los cafetales de la localidad de Sanchirio.

Él es un joven ejemplar y con visión emprendedora. Desde que era niño sus padres le enseñaron todo lo que tenía que aprender sobre la agricultura. Desde entonces disfrutaba del tiempo que pasaba en el campo, ayudando a sus padres. Ahora, desde hace 5 años atrás, adquirió un terreno agrícola donde pudo, por fin, comenzar su propia producción. Sus cultivos son de café, plátano y piña. El café lo ofrece en la cooperativa de su localidad, mientras que las piñas y plátanos, en la ciudad, para ello viaja como una hora en auto. Luis tiene sus metas son claras; quiere mejorar su producción y adquirir más terrenos para convertirse en un próspero agricultor.

Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP, por eso dice que pagará con puntualidad las cuotas mensuales. Pertenece al banco comunal “Progreso del Palomar” que es uno de los más sólidos de la provincia. 
Con este préstamo, Luis podrá adquirir bolsas de abono para fertilizar su cafetal, ya que ha quedado débil luego de su última cosecha.
texts.en:
Luis is 23 years old and is single. He lives in a humble house, but it is his own, which he built with a lot of hard work on a plot of land which he inherited from his parents. It is located amongst the coffee plantations of Sanchirio.

He is an exemplary young-man, with an entrepreneurial vision. Since he was a boy his parents taught him what he needed to know about agriculture. Since then he has enjoyed the time he has passed in the countryside helping his parents. 

Five years ago he acquired a plot of agricultural land where he was finally able to start his own production. His harvests are of coffee, plantain and pinapple. He supplies the coffee to the cooperative of his locality, whilst he sells the pinapples and plantains in the city and he travels around an hour by car to do so. Luis has clear goals; he wants to improve his production and aquire more land so that he can become a prosperous farmer. 

This is his second loan with MFP, and he says that he will make his monthly repayments punctually. He belongs to the communal bank “Progreso del Palomar” which is one of the biggest of his province. 

With this loan, Luis will be able to acquire bags of manure to fertilize his coffee plantation, as it has been deficient since the last harvest.

loans.use: to buy manure to fertilize his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es:
Marcelino tiene 56 años, se separó de su esposa con la que tuvo ocho hijos, pero sólo vive con dos de ellos: Jesús de 19 y Alfredo de 16 años. La casa de Marcelino es propia, ubicada en la localidad de Sanchirio, Palomar. 

Lleva cerca de 10 años en las labores del campo, produciendo café, plátano y otros productos como yucas, que son mayormente para su consumo. Se siente contento por haber aprendido a negociar con inteligencia sus cosechas, las cuales lleva a la cooperativa de su localidad. En el caso del plátano, tiene que llevarlos cada 20 días a la ciudad, la que se encuentra a una hora de viaje. Él sabe que al sembrar plátanos y café puede contar con buenos ingresos, ya que el café se cosecha una vez al año, pero el plátano dos veces al mes. Una de sus metas es ampliar su producción de café, por ello arrendará otros terrenos para iniciar con una siembra.

Este es el quinto préstamo que tiene con MFP, por eso da su palabra de ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Progreso del Palomar” y se siente cómodo de tener compañeros responsables.
Marcelino destinará los 600 soles en la compra de fertilizantes para sus cultivos de café.
texts.en:
Marcelino is 56 years old, he is separated from his wife with whom he had eight children, but he only lives with two of them: Jesús, 19, and Alfredo, 16 years old. Marcelino has his own house which is located in the town of Sanchirio, Palomar. 

He has spent roughly 10 years working in the fields producing coffee, bananas and other products such as yuca, which are mainly for his consumption. Marcelino is pleased that he has learnt how to sell his crops wisely, which he carries to the cooperative in his area. In the case of bananas, he has to transport them to the city, which is a one hour away, every 20 days. He knows that by planting bananas and coffee he can rely on a good income, as the coffee is harvested once a year, but bananas are harvested twice a month. One of Marcelino's goals is to increase his coffee yield, as such he will rent other fields to start a crop.

This is the fifth loan Marcelino has taken with MFP, which is why he gives his word that he will be prompt in meeting the monthly payments. He belongs to the “Progreso del Palomar” communal bank, and he feels comfortable having responsible partners. Marcelino will spend the 600 Peruvian Nuevos Soles on the purchase of fertilizers for his coffee crops.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his coffee crops.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
Sandra tiene 22 años, a su corta edad es una joven empeñosa, emprendedora y muy trabajadora. Hace 6 años que convive con Frank en su casa propia, la que obtuvo como regalo de sus padres. Aún no tienen hijos, pero lleva 3 meses de gestación y desde que se enteró de esta gran noticia ha empezado a sentir mayores deseos de progresar y forjarse un mejor porvenir por el amor al nuevo ser que lleva en su vientre.

Su negocio es la venta de abarrotes, para ello acondicionó un pequeño espacio dentro de su vivienda donde ofrece diferentes comestibles; tales como arroz, leche, azúcar, aceite, huevos, tubérculos y verduras. Su carisma y su jovialidad hacen que tenga las cualidades precisas para tratar bien a sus clientes y regalar siempre una sonrisa y palabras gratas a quienes acuden a realizar alguna compra. Lleva en este negocio alrededor de un año, sin embargo, precisa que para lograr establecer su pequeña bodega tuvo que luchar mucho; ahorró por varios meses, ya que durante 5 años vendió madera, pero por el gran esfuerzo físico que requería para manipularlas optó por dedicarse a lo que ahora considera es la mejor opción. Trabaja sola en su bodega, mientras su pareja lo hace de forma independiente en algún oficio.
Le gusta mucho lo que hace porque los ingresos que percibe de su negocio han cubierto sus expectativas y le dan tranquilidad y sosiego para cubrir sus necesidades básicas y además de ello no hace esfuerzo alguno, lo cual por ahora la mantiene contenta porque puede llevar su embarazo sin preocupaciones. Espera poder consolidar su negocio poco a poco y más adelante construir una tienda más grande.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá más segura de avanzar con su trabajo. Asimismo, se compromete a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas. Y está satisfecha de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos sus integrantes son muy responsables y solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado (S/. 700) incrementará la cantidad de productos en su bodega comprando arroz, azúcar, huevos y otro artículos necesarios que antes no vendía porque no los podía comprar por falta de capital.
texts.en:
Sandra is 22 years old, and at such a young age she is an earnest and hard-working entrepreneur.  6 years ago she moved with Frank into her own home that she received as a gift from her parents.  They don't have children yet, but she is 3 months pregnant and since she received this great news, her desires to progress and carve out a better living have gotten stronger because of the love that will come into her life.

She sells a variety of items and has a small store inside her home where she offers different groceries such as rice, milk, sugar, oil, eggs, potatoes and vegetables.  Her charisma and her cheerfulness are exactly the qualities needed to properly serve her customers.  She always smiles and speaks with kind words to everyone that visits her store.  She has worked at this job for about a year.  However, in order to succeed in starting her own store, she first had to struggle and save money for many months. 

She had worked for 5 years selling wood, but because of the great physical strain required to work there, she chose to dedicate herself to her current work, which is a better option for her.  She works alone in her store while her partner works for himself in a trade.  He likes what he does because his income covers theirs expenses and provides them with peace and quiet to meet their basic needs.  Furthermore, because of Frank's work, Sandra doesn't need to worry and for now she can be content in her pregnancy.  She hopes to be able to build her business and eventually build a bigger store.

This is her first loan from MFP and she is very happy to know that she has financial support and she will feel more secure to move ahead with her work.  She promises to comply with the payment terms and be punctual with payments.  She is satisfied with her community bank since all of its members are responsible and caring people.

With this loan (700 soles) she will buy more products for her store, such as rice, sugar, eggs, and other necessary items that she previous couldn’t sell because she was not able to buy them due to a lack in capital.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, eggs, and other products for her store.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Martha Alicia

texts.es:
La señora Martha esta solicitando un préstamo con nosotros ya que tiene que pagar la inscripción de uno de sus hijos a la universidad. Un hijo podrá entrar a la universidad que el quiere y podrá empezar sus estudios universitarios y así con el tiempo convertirse en un profesionista de éxito. 
La señora trabaja como comerciante de arreglos para ocasiones especiales ya sea navidad, san Valentín, cumpleaños, aniversarios; y su esposo trabaja para una maquila, juntos se encargan de solventar los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Martha is seeking a loan with us as she needs to pay the university enrolment fees for one of her children. A child can attend the university they wish to and will be able to start their university studies and in that way, become a successful professional over time.

Martha works as a sales person for the planning of special occasions such as Christmas, Valentine's Day, birthdays and anniversaries, while her husband works in a bonded assembly plant. Together they make sure they can cover the household spending.

loans.use: to pay university enrolment fees.

loans.name: Abeer

texts.en:
Abeer is 28 years old and a single lady. She has seven brothers and sisters. 

Abeer established a small convenience store in the neighborhood where she lives. She has applied for this youth loan in order to add more food products to the store.

loans.use: to add more food products to the store.

loans.name: Ashur

texts.en: Ashur always tries to find new sources of income. He is clever and effective in business deals.  He has a big family and must comfort them with all modern conveniences. Ashur has worked in a  collective farm for more than 10 years. He grows sweet watermelons. In his business Ashur is helped by his wife and their elder daughter. They sell watermelons to local people. In the market they have their own selling place and a lot of customers. Ashur is a good friend and careful father. His children love him very much. His aim is to buy mineral fertilizers for the land in which he works.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Zoya

texts.en:
Zoya, 64, lives with her daughter in a 'ger' (Mongolia yurt) in Arhangai province, Mongolia. Her husband passed away. She has 12 years of  experience in mobile retailing of organic dairy products and the garment business. She has sheep and cows which are located in the countryside and she brings her organic dairy products and sells in Arhangai province. She has already developed many regular customers and suppliers. 

While saving for the future, she is expanding the business little by little. Even though she is quite old, she still wants to continue the business. She is a clever woman who says, "I would like to expand the business activities by getting the necessary refrigerator to store more products in it, so that I could get the supplies in large quantities." The total amount she is requesting is 1,000,000 MNT to purchase a bigger refrigerator to keep her organic dairy products in.

loans.use: To purchase a bigger refrigerator to store her organic dairy products

loans.name: Dilrabo

texts.en: This young and hard-working woman, lovely wife, careful mother is Dilrabo. From early morning till late evening for more than seven years she has been working the land. She raises different kinds of grains. Her goods have many consumers because the grain grown by Dilrabo has high quality and is prized. In her business her mother-in-law helps her. Dilrabo’s husband has gone to Russia. He has been working there for some years. Dilrabo has a child and loves him very much. Her aim is to buy seeds and fuel for new planting.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fuel

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos es un joven de 25 años de edad, es soltero y vive en casa de la madre en la zona urbano marginal del distrito de Morrope su domicilio cuenta con servicios de agua, el lugar es una comunidad pequeña con un aproximado de 100  familias.

Se dedica a la confeccion de gorras con una experiencia de 4 años en el rubro. El aprendió del negocio gracias a su hermano mayor, perfeccionandose en Lima, actualmente cuenta con un taller, con dos maquinas industriales planas y una planchadora.

Santos desea adquirir materiales para la confección de sus gorras las cuales actualmente cuentan con gran demanda en el mercado , vendiéndolas en otras ciudades como Bagua y Jaen. Por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 4000 nuevos soles. Con esta inversion  espera poder cumplir con los pedidos de mercaderia que son solicitados.

El es un joven bastante responsable y trabajador, Santos agradece de antemano a las personas que le ayudarán con el financiamiento de su crédito.
texts.en:
Santos is 25 years old, single and lives in his mother’s home in the periurban area in the district of Morrope. His home has water. The community is small, with approximately 100 families.

He makes hats and has four years of experience in this craft. He learned the business from his older brother, perfecting his craft in Lima. Currently, he has a workshop with two sewing machines and a presser.

Santos wants to acquire materials for the production of his caps, which are currently in great demand in the market, selling them in other cities such as Bagua and Jaen. That is why he has requested a loan of 4000 new Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa. With this investment, he hopes to be able to meet the requested merchandise orders.

He is a quite responsible youth and a hard worker. Santos thanks in advance the people that will help him by financing his loan.

loans.use: to buy material such as cloth to make caps.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis tiene 64 años de edad, casado y sin hijos. Vive en casa propia con su esposa en una comunidad alejada a unos 15 minutos de Tambogrande y cuenta con servicio básico de luz.

Luis se dedica al cultivo de limón y mango, en parcela heredada de 1,5 hectarias, además de la crianza de aves de corral. Este oficio lo lleva haciendo hace aproximadamente 15 años. Solicita crédito de 1800 nuevos soles para el mantenimiento de cultivo de limón en la compra de abono para fertilización del terreno y compra de alimento balanceado para animales.  Dicho préstamo lo ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa. 

Esto le ayudara a mantener siendo un productor fiable y mejorar el bienestar de el y su esposa.
texts.en:
Luis is 64 years old, married and without children. He lives in his own home in a community 15 minutes away from Tambogrande and has basic electricity.
Luis grows lemons and mangos in an inherited plot of 1.5 hectares, in addition to raising fowl. He has been doing this business for about 15 years. He is requesting a loan of 1800 new Peruvian soles to maintain his lemon crop, purchase fertilizer to fertilizer the land and buy balanced feed for his animals. Said loan has been requested from Edpyme Alternativa.
This will help him to continue being a reliable producer and improve his wellbeing and that of his wife.

loans.use: to maintain his lemon crop, fertilizer his land and buy feed for his animals.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es: DANIEL ES UNA PERSONA QUE YA HA HECHO PRESTAMOS CON LA ORGANIZACION, MOSTRANDO GRAN SERIEDAD Y PUNTULIADAD.  VIVE CON SU CONYUGE Y TIENEN 2 HIJOS MENORES DE EDAD. DANIEL ES CONOCIDO EN EL MEDIO, POR SU LABOR EN LA CRIANZA Y VENTA DE ANIMALES  EN SU LOCALIDAD. SU  CONYUGE  LO APOYA EN LAS LABORES DEL NEGOCIO Y EN EL SOPORTE ECONOMICO FAMILIAR. DANIEL TIENE BUENAS REFERENCIAS Y UNA FAMILIA UNIDA. VIVE EN UNA COMUNIDAD DEDICADA AL COMERCIO, AGRICULTURA Y GANADERIA. EL CUENTA CON MAS DE 5 AÑOS DE EXPERIENCIA Y EL PRÉSTAMO LO  INVERTIRÁ EN SU NEGOCIO Y ARREGLOS DE SU CASA. EL HA PENSADP QUE DE ESTA MANERA LOGRARÁ ATENDER LA DEMANDA INSATISFECHA EN EL LUGAR,  AMPLIARÁ SU CARTERA DE CLIENTES E INGRESOS ADICIONALES PARA INCREMENTAR EL BIENESTAR DE SU FAMILIA.
texts.en: Daniel is someone who has already taken out loans with the organization, showing great seriousness and punctuality. He lives with his wife, and they have two children who are minors. Daniel is known in the area, for his work in raising and selling animals in his locality. His wife supports him in the work of the business and financially supporting the family. Daniel has good references and a united family. He lives in a community based on trade, agriculture and livestock. He has more than 5 years of experience and will invest the loan in his business and repairing his home. He has thought that in this way he will manage to meet the unsatisfied demand in the area, expand his customer base and achieve additional income to improve the wellbeing of his family.

loans.use: to invest in his business given the greater demand for his product and in repairing his home.

loans.name: Katia

texts.es: KATIA ES UNA NUEVA PRESTMISTA, TIENE 41 AÑOS Y ESTA CASADA. VIVE CON SUS HIJOS DE 21 Y 24 AÑOS Y NIETO RECIEN NACIDO. ELLA TIENE MUY BUENAS REFERENCIAS Y VIVE EN FAMILIA MUY UNIDA. VIVE EN UNA COMUNIDAD DEDICADA AL COMERCIO, AGRICULTURA Y GANADERIA. KATIA SE DEDICA AL NEGOCIO DE ABARROTES DESDE HACE 12 AÑOS EN SU CASA EN EL NORTE DE PERU. CON EL PRÉSTAMO COMPRARÁ VÍVERES Y BEBIDAS PARA OFRECER AL PÚBLICO, PARA SÍ OFRECER UNA MEJOR ATENCIÓN Y ASÍ CONTAR CON MAYOR CLIENTELA Y OFRECER MEJOR PRODUCTO. ELLA PIENSA QUE SU ESTRATEGIA LOGRARÁ ATENDER LA DEMANDA INSATISFECHA EN EL LUGAR, AMPLIARÁ SU CARTERA DE CLIENTES Y CONTANDO CON CLIENTES NUEVOS PODRA TRAER INGRESOS ADICIONALES A LA FAMILIA.
texts.en: Katia is a new borrower.  She is 41 years old, married, and lives with her children, who are 21 and 24, and a newborn grandson.  She has very good references and her family is very united.  She lives in a community where people work in commerce, farming and livestock raising.  Katia has been selling groceries for 12 years.  She sells from her house which is located in the north of Peru.  Katia will use her loan to buy food products and drinks to sell to her customers.  She will be able to provide a better service, increase her number of customers and offer better products.  She believes that her strategy will allow her to respond to the currently unmet demand in her area.  She will expand her customer base and gain new customers which will enable her to make extra income for her family.

loans.use: to buy food products and drinks to sell to her customers

loans.name: Nonvigbe Group

texts.fr: NONVIGBE est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans la même zone. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité et de faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupe s'est rapproché de ALIDé, en vue de l'obtention d'un autre prêt. La représentante du groupe, Anne-Marie (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 57 ans. Anne-Marie est mariée à Donatien et est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés, dont un reste à leur charge. Anne-Marie vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Anne-Marie n’a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour contribuer aux diverses charges de la maison, Anne-Marie a commencé depuis cinq ans la vente de divers produits alimentaires (huile, maïs, farine de blé). Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de son activité, tout en la diversifiant, Anne-Marie sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe NONVIGBE, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The NONVIGBE group has three members who all live in the same area.  In order to boost their businesses and meet customer demand, this group approached ALIDé with a view to obtaining another loan.  The group's representative, Anne-Marie (who is raising her hand in the photo) is 57 years old.  She is married to Donatien and has three children who have all been to school.  One of her children is still in her care.  Anne-Marie lives together with her husband and children.  The couple jointly cover their household expenses.  Anne-Marie herself never went to school.  Five years ago, she started selling food products (oil, corn and wheat flour) in order to help towards their various household expenses.  Anne-Marie and the other members of the NONVIGBE group are requesting a third loan from ALIDé with the aim of boosting their businesses.  Their two previous loans were paid back correctly.
