loans.use: to buy food products (wheat flour, corn and vegetable oil)

loans.name: Eternel Group

texts.fr: ETERNEL est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Antoinette (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 46 ans et est mariée à un certain Anatole. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Antoinette vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Antoinette n’a pas fréquenté l'école. Il y a longtemps que Antoinette vend des fruits, de l'"akassa" (préparé à base d'amidon de maïs), et de la boisson locale à son domicile. Antoinette s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. C’est la deuxième fois que Antoinette et les autres membres du groupe ETERNEL sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. Le premier crédit a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The ETERNEL group has three members who all live in the same neighborhood.  The group's representative, Antoinette (who is raising her hand in the photo), is 46 years old and married to Anatole.  The couple have four children.  Some of their children attend school and all of them are still in their care.  Antoinette lives together with her husband and children.  The couple jointly cover their household expenses.  Antoinette herself did not attend school.  

Antoinette has been selling fruit, 'akassa' (made from cornstarch) and local drinks from her home for a long time.  She stocks up at a market in Benin.  This is the second time that Antoinette and the other members of the ETERNEL group have requested a loan from ALIDé in order to strengthen their working capital, strengthen their businesses and better respond to their customer demand.  Their first loan was repaid correctly.

loans.use: to buy corn, vegetable oil and local drinks

loans.name: Sahar

texts.en:
Sahar, 43 years old and a conservative woman, asked her daughter to take her place in the photo.

Sahar is a public sector employee who has three daughters and two sons.  One of her daughters is Nojoud who is appearing in the photo.
 
Nojoud is a 19-year-old single lady who is attending university to study political science. Now Sahar has applied for this loan to pay for her daughter’s semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter’s semester fees

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica is a food vendor. She cooks rice and fish stew for sale at Kagebil near Takoradi. Veronica is married   and has six children. She has been in this business for 10 years now.  She uses her income, along with her husband's, to support and feed her children.  Veronica  will use her loan to purchase bags of rice and fish to cook for sale. With the new profit, Veronica  plans to build a better stall for the sale of her food.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice and fish to cook for sale

loans.name: Saad

texts.en:
Saad is a 20-year-old single guy, with eight brothers and sisters.

He is a third-year law student who applied for this loan to pay for his summer semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for his summer semester fees.

loans.name: Alia

texts.en:
Alia is a 26-year-old conservative married lady.  She asked her aunt to take her place in this photo.
Alia cares for two daughters and one son by working in a factory to support the family.  She also makes pickles at home to sell.  Most of her customers are neighbors, friends and family.
Alia wants to expand her business to be able to sell at food markets or restaurants.  To be able to do so, she will have to increase her productivity.  She has applied to the youth loan in order to buy more containers to keep pickles in.

loans.use: to buy more containers to keep pickles in.

loans.name: Vida

texts.en: Vida cooks  maize  porridge for sale, which she serves with bread and milk.  She is married  and has four children.  Vida  has been in this business for four years now. She uses her income to assist her husband and to feed and clothe her children as well as pay their school fees.  Her loan will be used to purchase bags of maize and flour to prepare her bread and  porridge. With the new profit, Vida  will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize and flour to prepare her bread and  porridge to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a petty trader. She sells foodstuffs and vegetables at Kajebil near Takoradi. Mary  has been in this business for some time now and she wishes to buy other food items requested by her customers. Therefore, a loan from Kiva will be used to buy more foodstuffs and vegetables to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to expand her store's variety.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.en:
Sharifa is a conservative married woman, so she asked her daughter Saja to take her place in the photo.

Sharifa is a 50-year-old public sector retirement employee. She is caring for four sons and daughters. Saja is one of Sharifa’s daughters; she is 19 years old and is majoring in child care and education at the university. Sharifa has applied for this loan to pay for her daughter’s semester fees so she will be able to continue and graduate.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter’s semester fees

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en: Leticia sells canned tomatoes and raw rice at  Kagebil near Takoradi. In her picture, Leticia is holding a box of canned tomatoes and in front of her is the rice she sells. She is married and has five children. She has been in this business for 10 years now. She uses her income to raise and feed her children. Leticia will use her loan to purchase bags of rice and boxes of canned tomatoes. With the new profit, Leticia plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice and boxes of canned tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica is a food vendor. She cooks rice and fish stew for sale at Kagebil near Takoradi. Veronica is married and has six children. She has been in this business for 10 years now. She uses her income to supplement her husband's income and to feed her children. Veronica will use her loan to purchase bags of rice and fish. With the new profit, Veronica plans to build a better stall for the sale of her food.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice and fish to cook for sale.

loans.name: Vida

texts.en: Vida is a food vendor. She cooks rice and fish stew, which she sells at Kagebil near Takoradi. She has been in this business for four years. Vida is married and has three children. She currently uses her income in conjunction with her husband's to support their children. Vida will use her loan to purchase bags of rice and fish to cook and sell. With the new profit, Vida plans to build a better stall to sell her food from.

loans.use: purchase bags of rice and fish to cook for sale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary operates a small grocery store at Kajebil near Takoradi, and she has been doing this for six years. She sells a variety of groceries, such as milk, Milo, sugar, soups, soft drinks, canned tomatoes, canned fish, biscuits, toffee, powdered milk, and other things. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a driver. Mary uses her income to support her husband in paying their utility bills. She will use her loan to purchase a variety of grocery items to sell. With the new profit, Mary plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Eliseo

texts.es:
Eliseo es un padre de familia de 34 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y a sus 2 hijos en el caserío Manco Inca, perteneciente a la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande, en la región Piura.

Trabaja en actividades relacionadas con la agricultura. Por una lado se dedica a la crianza de ovinos, cerdos y aves de corral, los cuales cria engorda y comercializa en el mercado local. Ademas cuenta con una hectárea de terreno agrícola sembrado de limón que cosecha semanalmente, su esposa cria aves de corral y lo apoya en sus actividades.

Eliseo desea adquirir fertilizantes para su cultivo de limón y ademas realizar labores de poda y limpieza del cultivo, lo cual le permitirá lograr una mejor producción y por ende seguir creciendo y mejorar su nivel de vida. Para financiar estas actividades ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Eliseo agradece de antemano a las personas que le apoyarán con su préstamo.
texts.en:
Eliseo, 34, is a father who lives with his wife and two children in the hamlet of  Manco Inca in the rural area of the district of Tambogrande, in the Piura region.

He works in agriculture-related jobs.  On the one hand he raises sheep, pigs, and poultry, which he raises, fattens, and sells in the local market.  He also has one hectare of farmland growing lemon, which he harvests weekly.  His wife raises poultry and helps him in his activities.

Eliseo wants to get fertilizer for his lemon crop and also do crop pruning and weeding, which will allow him to have a better crop and, consequently, continue to grow and improve his living conditions.  To finance these activities he has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1500 nuevos soles [PEN].

Eliseo thanks in advance the people who will support him with his loan.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and do crop pruning and weeding.

loans.name: Helena

texts.en:
Helena cooks waakye (rice and beans cooked together), which she sells at Kajebil near Takoradi. She serves her waakye with gari, macroni, meat, and fish stew. Helena has been selling waakye for the past three years. 

She is married to a farmer and has five children. Helena  assists her husband in paying their children’s school fees. Her loan will be used to purchase bags of rice, beans, and fish to cook her waakye. Helena will use her new profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice, beans, and fish to cook her waakye.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bags of maize for her kenkey production.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua sells cooking utensils, saucepans, bowls, and cloth at Kajebil near Takoradi. Ekua has been selling these for three years.  

She is married and has four children. Her husband is a driver. At present, she uses her income to support her husband in paying their children’s school fees.  

She will use her loan to purchase more cooking utensils, saurcepans, bowls, and cloth for her business. She hopes to use the new profits to build a shop.

loans.use: to purchase more cooking utensils, saucepans, bowls, and cloth for sale.

loans.name: Agartha

texts.en:
Agartha is a baker. She bakes bread for sale at Kagebil near Takoradi, which she has done for five years. 

Agartha is married and has three children. She uses her income to support her husband in feeding, clothing, and paying her children’s school fees. 

Agartha will use her loan to purchase flour, sugar and cooking oil to bake her bread for sale. With the new profit, she will purchase the modern type of oven to make her work more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, and cooking oil to bake her bread for sale.

loans.name: Benigno Fredy

texts.es:
Benigno es un padre de familia de 26 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y sus hijos en el distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace cinco años a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores, específicamente de ovejas y aves de corral. El cría a sus animales en algunos ambientes situados en su domicilio, cuando ya ha desarrollado lo suficiente los ofrece en venta a los negociantes de la zona. Esta actividad le permite sostener la economía de su familia. Adicionalmente percibe ingresos por labores agrícolas.

Actualmente desea adquirir alimentos balanceados para el engorde de ovinos y así poderlos vender a un mejor precio en el mercado, esto para lograr seguir creciendo en su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2300 nuevos soles con los cuales piensa lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Benigno is a 26 years old father who lives with his wife and their children in the Tambogrande district, an agricultural area found in the province of Piura, in the region with the same name, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region.

Since five years ago, he has worked raising and selling small animals, specifically sheep and poultry.  He raises his animals in some spaces within his home and when they are sufficiently developed, he sells them in the local businesses.  This business allows him to sustain the family economy.  Additionally, he receives income from his agricultural labor.

Currently, he wishes to acquire balanced feed to fatten his sheep and thus, enable him to sell them at a higher price in the market, in order to be able to continue expanding his business and improving his quality of life.  To that end, he thought it convenient to request a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 2300 nuevos soles (Peruvian currency) with which he hopes to achieve his goal.

loans.use: purchase a balanced diet [for his sheep].

loans.name: Kholboi

texts.en: Kholboi is a good collective farmer. For the past10 years, he has grown rice to sell to citizens. His land is very good for planting and that’s why Kholboi gets a big harvest every season. Many cooks prepare testy foods with rice that was grown by Kholboi. Kholboi is married and has 4 children. His wife does house work.  His sons help to him in his business. They sell rice in the local market. With the help of his sons, Kholboi develops his business year by year. His aim is to buy mineral fertilizers for the land on which he works.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua sells cooking utensils and saucepans at Ankaful near Abura. She has been selling these for some time now.  Efua has completed junior high school. She is married and has 4 children. Her husband is a mason. She uses her income to support her husband in paying their children’s school fees.  She will use her loan to purchase more cooking utensils and saucepans to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a shop.

loans.use: to buy cooking utensils and saucepans to sale.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth cooks Ga kenkey (a corn dumpling), which she sells and serves with fried fish, pepper, and tomato sauce at  Kajebil near Takoradi. Elizabeth has done this for 31 years. 

She is married and has three children. Currently, she uses her income to pay her children’s school  fees. 

Her loan will be used to purchase bags of maize and fish that she uses in preparing her Ga kenkey. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize and fish for her Ga kenkey.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret sells eggs and frozen meat at Kajebil near Takoradi. She has been in this business for six years. She uses her income to pay for her children’s school fees. 

Margaret will use her loan to purchase eggs and more frozen meat to sell. With the new profit she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase eggs and more frozen meat to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bags or rice and groundnuts.

loans.name: Japhet

texts.en:
Japhet is 30 years old and married with one child who is 3 years old. He sells various goods such as lotions, soap, juice, milk, sugar, etc., for re-sale. Japhet has three years of experience in this work. 

Japhet has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to buy various goods such as lotions, soap, juice, milk, sugar, etc., for re-sale. With any profits, he will be able to save money for his future and he will be able to buy a mill for milling sorghum because his community needs it.

loans.use: to buy various goods such as lotions, soap, juice, milk, sugar, etc., for re-sale.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria lives with her husband and 3 children at Kajebil near Takoradi. She sells palm fruit, which she has done for 10 years. Victoria uses her present income to support her husband in paying their rent and utility bills. She will use her loan to purchase more palm fruit. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: purchase more palm fruit to sell

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria operates a grocery shop at Kajebil near Takoradi. She has done this for 15 years. She sells rice, canned fish, canned tomatoes, Milo, different kinds of drinks, biscuits, toffees, milk, soap, etc.  

She is married to a driver. Victoria currently uses her income to support her husband to pay their utility bills. 

She will use her loan to purchase a variety of groceries for her shop. With the new profit, Victoria plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of groceries to sell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama is a food vender. She cooks and sells banku (cooked and fermented corn or cassava dough), which she serves with okra and fish stew. She has done this for five years. 

She lives with her husband, who is a farmer, and two children at Mfuom near Abura. She uses her income to assist her husband to pay their children’s school fees.  

Ama will use her loan to purchase bags of maize and fish, which she uses in preparing her banku. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to create a place for her customers to eat.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize and fish that she uses in preparing her banku for sale.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia sells charcoal at Kajebil near Takoradi, which she has done for two years now. 

Lydia is married and has five children. She uses her income, in conjunction with her husband's, to feed their children and pay for their school fees.

Lydia will use her loan to purchase bags of charcoal that she will then sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita is a baker. For eight years, she has baked bread to sell at Mfuom near Abura. Anita is divorced and has 2 children. She uses her income to feed, clothe, and pay school fees for her children.  Anita will use her loan to purchase flour, sugar, and cooking oil to bake her bread. With the new profit from her expanded business, she will purchase a modern oven to increase her productivity.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, and cooking oil to bake her bread

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is 52 years old and married with three children between the ages of 17 and 25 years old. He sells various goods such as lotions, soap, juice, and biscuits. He works from 6 am to 8 pm daily, except weekends, and he currently employs one person to help him. Jean has 2 years of experience in this work. 

Jean has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to buy various goods for resale. With any profits, he will be able to save money for his future, pay school fees for his children, and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to buy various goods for resale.

loans.name: Moise

texts.en:
Moise is 34 years old and married with three children between the ages of 6 and 13 years old. He owns a room where he shows movies. He works from 7 a.m. to 9 p.m. daily, and he currently employs one person to help him. Moise has 1 year of experience in this work. 

Moise has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to buy more movie DVDs and music CDs. With any profits, he will be able to save money for his future and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to buy more movie DVDs and music CDs.

loans.name: Barnabe

texts.en:
Barnabe is 30 years old and married with one child who is 4 years old. He also takes care of two relatives. He sells shoes. He works from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily, except weekends, and he currently employs one person to help him. Barnabe has 5 years of experience in this work.

Barnabe has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more shoes for resale. With any profits, he will be able to save money for his future and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes for resale.

loans.name: Maka

texts.en:
Maka is 28 years old. She is married and lives in a small village of the Kharagauli district with her family: her husband, George, and three children (5, 8 and 10 years old). The elder children study in the local school and the younger goes to kindergarten. 

Maka and her husband earn their living through an agricultural business. In particular, they have five cows, four calves, two bulls, five pigs and 24 goats. They produce dairy food: cheese, curd, and yogurt.  Part of the dairy food is used by the family and the other part is sold on the local open market. They sell piglets and beef together with dairy products on the local market. Also, they own one hectare of land, where they grow various vegetables such as cucumber, tomato, potato and carrot. The total average monthly income of the family is 550 GEL. 

Maka requested a loan to finance seasonal work on the plot. She will rent a tractor for tilling the land and purchase fertilizers and seeds. Maka and George will work hard during spring and summer seasons. They will sow more vegetables there and after the seasonal work  is properly done, she hopes to get a better harvest. This will increase sales, and with the increased income, she will be able to reinvest in the family's agricultural business.

loans.use: to cultivate land and purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino is 36 years old. She is married and lives in a small village of the Gardabani district with her family: her husband, Nikoloz, her mother-in-law, a pensioner, and two children. 

Nino and Nikoloz earn their living through an agricultural business. They have beehives with bee colonies. They make ecologically clean honey and sell it on the local open market. Also, they have three milking cows and produce dairy products, mainly cheese and curds. Nino sells them in nearby villages. The total average monthly income of the family is 1,000 GEL.

Nino and Nikoloz requested a loan for purchasing beehives with bee colonies and one more milking cow. With the increased number of cows and bees they will be able to produce more dairy products and honey. This will increase the sales from their business. As a result of the increased income, the family will be able to repair the house and finance their children’s studies. It will positively affect the family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase beehives with bee colonies.

loans.name: Eter

texts.en:
Eter is 59 years old. She lives in the Gardabani district with her husband, George, who is a pensioner. 

Eter and George run a family agricultural business. They have four milking cows and eight calves. They work hard and take good care of their livestock. Eter produces cheese every day and sells it locally. In addition to the agricultural business, Eter works in the village school. She is a librarian and gets a salary. The family’s total average monthly income is 600 GEL.

Eter requested a loan for purchasing a milking cow. She will be able to produce and sell more dairy products: cheese, curds and yogurt. With the increased profits, she will be able to reinvest in her family's agricultural business, as well as spend more on the family's daily needs. The living conditions of the family will be improved.

loans.use: to purchase a milking cow.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi is a fish monger, selling both fresh and smoked fish.  She is married with 4 children. She uses her income, in conjunction with her husband's, to raise her children and send them to school. A loan will help Esi buy more fresh fish to smoke and sell. This will result in an increased income to save towards her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fish to smoke and sell.

loans.name: Layli

texts.en: Layli is an owner of developing business. She sells beautiful fabrics used for sewing national women dresses. In the local market she has selling place. Layli’s goods have a lot of consumers because she sells beautiful and high quality fabrics with a cheaper price. Nowadays she has widened assortment of selling goods. She is married to a taxi driver and they have 4 children. Layli is kind and hard-working woman. All of the members of her family love her very much. Layli’s aim is to buy new fabrics for sewing national women dresses to sell.

loans.use: To buy new fabrics for sewing national women dresses

loans.name: Bayan

texts.en:
Bayan is a 19-year-old single woman.  She is the only girl in her family and has three brothers.
Bayan has applied to this loan in order to pay for her registration fees for college.

loans.use: to pay for her college registration fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy furniture-making tools.

loans.name: Antoine

texts.en:
Antoine is 47 years old and married with six children between the ages of 3 and 12 years old. He sells food and drinks like beans, rice, meat, Fanta, and water. He works from 6 a.m. to 7 p.m. daily, and he currently employs four people to help him. Antoine has 2 years of experience in this work.

Antoine has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to buy large quantities of food and drinks for resale. With any profits, he will be able to save money for his future, pay school fees for his children, and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To buy large quantities of food and drinks for resale

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es:
Dolores tiene 57 años, es una mujer buena, honesta y muy amable. Está casada, hace 40 años, con Eduardo, de 67 años, con quien tiene cinco hijos ya adultos. Su casa es propia, la obtuvo como regalo de matrimonio, allí viven con dos nietos menores, a quienes cría desde hace algún tiempo.

Su actividad principal consiste en la preparación de alimentos variados, ella posee el don  de la cocina y es conocida como una de las mujeres que tiene la sazón más exquisita en la ciudad. Es por eso que su restaurante es uno de los más concurridos de la zona, ya que sus clientes acuden a diario para degustar los deliciosos menús que prepara con tanto esmero y cariño. Desde muy pequeña ha sentido pasión por el arte culinario y con el tiempo ha venido desarrollando su capacidad y sus sentidos para mejorar su sazón, y ahora sabe y conoce rápidamente cual es el mejor sabor que su clientela prefiere. Aún recuerda  con nostalgia, pero con mucho orgullo como se inició en este trabajo hace 20 años, cuando soñaba con tener su propio restaurante y a través del paso del tiempo ha visto como su esfuerzo y constancia han dado frutos y logros que ahora puede disfrutar. 
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es preparar sus comidas, disfrutar de los aromas y sabores y saber que sus fieles comensales disfrutan de cada platillo. Es por eso que realiza su trabajo con mucho amor y entrega, aunque a veces siente que no puede complacer a todos de manera rápida como quisiera, porque algunas veces trabaja sola; sin embargo, con un poco de paciencia, mucho respeto y una gran sonrisa, consigue que su clientela salga contenta y muy satisfecha de su restaurante. Espera continuar con el mejoramiento de la infraestructura de su restaurante e implementarlo con algunos detalles de vajilla.

Este es el crédito número 7 con MFP, por tanto agradece a quienes hacen posible su crédito para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, está muy comprometida, una vez más, a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas, como lo hizo en anteriores créditos. También está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos sus integrantes son muy buenos, amables y solidarios.

Con los S/.2000 solicitados comprará más de los ingredientes que utiliza a diario para preparar sus comidas, ya que la demanda ha aumentado. También adquirirá materiales de construcción para mejorar las condiciones de su local y ampliarlo un poco más.
texts.en:
Dolores, age 57, is a good, honest, and very kind woman.  She has been married to Eduardo, age 67, for 40 years.  They have five children, who are now adults.  Her house is her own, and she got it as a wedding present.  She lives there with two minor grandchildren, whom she has been raising for some time.

Her primary business activity consists of preparing various foods.  She has a gift for cooking, and she is well-known as one of the women who have the most exquisite tasting food in the city.  This is why her restaurant is one of the busiest in the area.  Her customers come daily to enjoy the delicious meals that she prepares with such care and affection.

Ever since she was very young she has had a passion for the culinary arts.  In time, she has been developing her capabilities and her senses in order to improve her seasoning.  She now knows how to do that, and she rapidly knows the best flavor for her customers’ preferences.

She still remembers nostalgically, but with great pride, how she started in this work 20 years ago.  She dreamed of having her own restaurant.  With the passage of time, she has seen how her effort and constancy have produced the fruits of her labor and accomplishments that she is now able to enjoy.

What she likes the most about her work is preparing the food.  She enjoys the aromas, the flavors, and knowing that her loyal diners enjoy each dish.  That is why she does her work with a lot of love and dedication.  She does this, even though, at time she feels that she cannot please everyone as quickly as she would like to do.  This is because she sometimes works alone.

Nevertheless, with a little patience, a lot of respect, and a big smile she succeeds in making her customers happy and very satisfied with her restaurant.  She wants to continue with the improvement of the infrastructure of her restaurant.  She also wants to set the business up with some specific dishes.

This is her seventh loan with MFP.  She is grateful to the people who make this loan possible so that she can continue with her objectives.  She is very committed, once more, to making her payments punctually, as she did with the previous loans.  Also, she is very happy to belong to her communal bank because all of the members are very good, kind, and supportive.

She will use the requested 2,000 soles to buy more ingredients that she uses daily to prepare her food because the demand has increased.  She will also get construction materials in order to improve the conditions of her place and to expand it a little more.

loans.use: to buy the ingredients that she uses daily to prepare her food and to improve her place.

loans.name: Barno

texts.en: Barno is a business woman. She sells children’s and men’s clothing. She has lots of experience selling clothing. She has enough income to feed her family. Barno is a woman of taste and that’s why she has a wide assortment of clothing. She is also a careful mother.  Barno has 5 smart children. Her husband went to a foreign country to find a job. Barno is a happy woman because she has a developing business and a good family. Her aim is to buy clothing for the new season.

loans.use: To buy clothing for the new season

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is a conservative woman so she asked her son to take her place in the photo. 
Khadija, a 53-year-old mother,  is married and cares for  six sons. Khadija and her husband are both public sector retirement employees.
Laith, a 21-year-old single guy, is one of Khadija’s sons who is currently attending university to study Arabic Literature and Language. She has applied to this loan to pay for his semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her son's semester fees

loans.name: C7833 Abakweto Group

texts.en:
Jean Bosco is 33 years old and is married with four children between the ages of 6 months and 10 years old. He sells shoes. Jean Bosco is a leader of this group, which is called "C7833 ABAKWETO" in the local language. In the photo, he's the one raising his hand. He works from 6 a.m. to 5 p.m. daily, except weekends, and he currently employs two people to help him. Jean Bosco has 8 years of experience in this work.

Jean Bosco has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more shoes for resale. With any profits, he will be able to pay school fees for his children, save money for his future, and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes for resale.

loans.name: Zoia

texts.en:
Zoia is 48 years old. She lives in a small village in Zestaponi District with her family: her husband Merab, two children (19 and 21 years old), mother-in-law, daughter-in-law, and one-year-old grandchild. Her elder son is a construction worker who earns a service fee. Her mother-in-law and husband are pensioners. 

The family members are busy with agricultural activities. They have a dairy farm with 2 milk cows. Zoia produces cheese and sells it at the local open market. In addition to the cows, they have 5 sheep and 2 pigs. They sell piglets and lambs in nearby villages each year. They work hard but still live in poverty; their income is not enough even for everyday expenses. According to government estimates the family belongs to the "vulnerable poor" category, and they receive monthly social assistance. The total average monthly income of the family is 400 lari.

Zoia has requested a loan to purchase a tractor. There is quite a high demand for tractors in agricultural areas, especially in the spring season.  Her husband will provide agricultural services to local farmers. He will be mainly busy with tilling land and mowing. He will be paid for providing these services, so the family will earn additional income. They plan to use the additional income to purchase household goods and improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a tractor

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino is 48 years old. She lives in a small village in Zeztafoni district with her two sons (20 and 22 years old). The elder son works in auto service and repairs cars. He gets service fees there. Nino and her younger son are busy with an agricultural business. They have a pig and sell piglets at the local open market. Also, they have a vineyard. They work hard during the spring and summer seasons to get a good harvest. They pick grapes in late summer and sell them locally. The total average monthly income of the family is 700 laris.  

Nino requested a loan to purchase a milking cow. She will be able to produce and sell cheese. Thus, she plans to expand her business in order to earn a good profit. With increased profits, she will be able to reinvest in her family's agricultural business as well as spend more to meet the family's daily needs. The living conditions of the family will be improved.

loans.use: to purchase a milking cow

loans.name: C7851 Abakangukiramajyambere Group

texts.en:
Epaphrodite, age 45, is a rice farmer and rice vendor. He and his wife have three children aged between 5 and 12 years old and he also takes care of one relative. He is the leader of this group, which is called "C7851 ABAKANGUKIRAMAJYAMBERE" in the local language. In the photo, he's the one who is standing in front of the others. He works from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. every workday.

Epaphrodite has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to cultivate larger quantities of rice to offer for sale. With the profits expected from this loan, he will be able to re-invest in his business.

loans.use: toquantities to cultivate larger quantities of rice to offer for sale

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Silika

texts.en:
Silika is a dairy farmer living in Malindi town, Kenya. She has been keeping dairy cows since she started her business two years ago, and she earns additional income by selling fruit juice. Silika and her husband have 11 children, six of whom are in school.

Silika learned about Milango from her friends and was introduced to Milango earlier this year. She is applying for a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings in order to construct a milking shed and buy a calf. Her aspiration is to own a larger milking farm in future.

She believes that the additional income will enable her to better provide for the basic needs of her family.

loans.use: to construct a milking shed and buy a calf

loans.name: Min

texts.en:
Min, age 42, is a villager from Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. To earn a living, she cultivates and harvests rice twice a year to support her family. She and her husband are responsible for five school-aged children. The couple helps each other to maintain the rice field in order to ensure good care and growth of their crops. Min has been been engaged in this business for almost 27 years, earning a suitable income each harvesting season.

At the present, Min is experiencing financial difficulties due to having inadequate funds to fix the family house, which is under construction. As a result, she has decided to borrow credit from HKL to purchase timbers and wooden boards to continue the construction. She hopes that she can finish constructing her house soon through using this loan. In the years to come, Min plans to expand her rice farming business.

loans.use: to purchase timbers and wooden boards for the construction of the family house

loans.name: Cristina María

texts.en:
María, age 39, lives in Isla de Chira, Costa Rica. She lives with her husband and their daughter, who is currently attending high school. 

María has a business selling catalogue items door-to-door in her community. She offers potential clients items such as colognes, cosmetics, underwear, and jewelry in an effort to make a contribution to the family income. María's husband earns a living as a fisherman when he can, but often the fishing season is restricted, forcing him to find other types of work in order to meet the familiy's basic financial needs.

María plans to use this loan to finance the purchase of various catalogue products. She has already collected the orders from clients in her community. All she requires now is the working capital with which to purchase the items she intends to sell. In order to make these purchases, María must travel by boat to Puntarenas, across the Nicoya Gulf, which takes about two hours each way. 

María is a hard-working, ambitious entrepreneur. She organizes her day in order to optimize her productivity. In the mornings, she carries out the domestic tasks at home and sends her daughter to school. When María travels to Puntarenas, she wakes up at 4 a.m. because the boat leaves at 6 a.m. and the walk from her home to where the boat leaves is long. In the afternoons, she visits her clients and collects orders. At night, María attends night school, where she is in the process of completing her high school certificate.

María's goals are to increase her client base and to gain clients in all parts of the Isla de Chira, the island where she lives. She hopes to be able to finance the studies of her daughter in the future. María says her main obstacle is the competition she faces from other vendors. She doesn't let this deter her, though, because she says ¨there is sufficient diversity in products.¨

loans.use: to purchase various catalogue products to offer for sale

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.pt:
Casado e pai 2 filhos dos quais 1 frequenta Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta 2 sobrinhos que vivem com ele.
Trabalha a conta própria como carpinteiro, com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (chapas de zinco, barrotes, aros de janelas e outros) para dar continuidade com a obra da sua casa.
No futuro pretende continuar com o ensino superior, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é adquirir uma viatura que possa ajudar no transporte de material para a conclusão da sua casa.
texts.en:
Ernesto is married and the father of 2 children, 1 of whom attends School. He lives in his own house with his family and supports 2 nephews who live with him.

He works for himself as a carpenter and with this loan he plans to buy construction materials (sheets of zinc, beams, window frames and others) to continue building his house.

In future, Ernesto intends to continue with higher education and to this end, he commits to duly paying off his loan so that he can solicit further loans from Hluvuku. 

His challenge is to purchase a vehicle which can help with transport the materials to finish building his house.

loans.use: buy construction materials (sheets of zinc, beams, window frames and others) to continue building his house.

loans.name: Erastus

texts.en: EErastus is a 26-year-old single man. He describes himself to be an honest man. He operates a farm where he sells eggs, chickens and milk. He has been involved in this business for 2 years and employs 1 staff member. His primary customers are retailers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. He will use the Kes 15,000 loan to buy chickens for resale. His business goal is to expand his poultry business. He hopes that in the future, he will buy a lorry to help distribute poultry to customers.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia sells frozen beef at Kajebil near Takoradi. She has been in this business for 6 years. She uses her income, along with her husband's, to pay their children’s school fees.  Felicia will use her loan to purchase more frozen beef to sell. With her new profits, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more frozen beef to sell.

loans.name: Elan Hector

texts.es:
Elan es un hombre de 22 años, soltero, vive con sus padres y hermanos en la ciudad de Camaná, caracterizada por clima cálido y hermosas playas; Elan es un hombre muy trabajador, persevante, con un gran sentido del humor, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos y hermanos, y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo “Seco de Pollo” para compartir con su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar una carrera profesional, pero sueña con poder estudiar la carrera de Agronomía. 
Gracias a su espíritu emprendedor y al apoyo de su familia, Elan se dedica a la agricultura ya que cuenta con un pequeño terreno en el cual cultiva frejoles, él dedica a su negocio un aproximado de 12 horas diaria,él se encuentra muy a gusto en su negocio, ya que siempre le ha gustado mucho las labores del campo.
Elan se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de abono, fertilizantes y podrá realizar el mantenimiento del cultivo; de esta manera podrá sostener la cosecha de su cultivo e incrementar sus ingresos económicos para con ellos adquirir una motocarga que le servirá para el riego de sus futuras siembras y así de esta manera espera poder cumplir su gran sueño de estudiar la carrera de agronomía para poder ayudar a su familia a salir adelante.
texts.en:
Elan is 22 years old, he is single and he lives with his parents and his siblings in Camaná, a town famous of its hot climate and its beautiful beaches. Elan is a very hard-working and persevering man, and has a great sense of humor. In his free time he likes playing soccer with his friends and his brothers, and at times he like cooking the delicious “Seco de Pollo” (chicken stew) to share it with his family. Unfortunately, he hasn’t been able to study a professional career as he did not have enough money, but he dreams of succeeding in studying Agricultural Science.
Thanks to his enterprising spirit and to his family’s support Elan engages in agriculture: he owns a small plot of land where he grows beans, and he spends approximately 12 hours a day in his field. He enjoys his activity very much, as he has always liked working in the country.
Elans is grateful to Kiva lenders, as thanks to their help he will be able to buy manure and fertilizers to perform maintenance on his crops. This way, he will be able to sustain crop cultivation and increase his income in order to buy a motorcycle trailer for hauling water for his future crops. In this way he hopes to makes his dream come true and finally succeed in studying Agricultural Science, as this will allow his to help his family’s development.

loans.use: To buy manure and fertilizers.

loans.name: Florinda

texts.pt:
Viúva e mãe de 4 filhos dos quais 2 ainda frequentam Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Tem um negocio próprio de venda de produtos de primeira necessidade, com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (óleo, massas, ovos, cerveja, caldo e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.
No futuro pretende adquirir mais produtos para diversificar, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é construir um estabelecimento comercial de raiz.
texts.en:
Florinda is a widow and mother of 4 children, 2 of whom still attend School. She lives in her own house with her family and doesn't support anyone else. 

She has her own business selling essential products and with this loan she plans to buy goods (oil, pasta, eggs, beer, stocks and others) to increase the quantity of her stock.

In future, Florinda intends to purchase additional products to diversify her business and to this end, she commits to duly paying off her loan so that she can solicit further loans from Hluvuku. 

Her challenge is to build a commercial establishment from scratch.

loans.use: buy goods (oil, pasta, eggs, beer, stocks and others) to increase the quantity of her stock.

loans.name: Dulce

texts.pt:
Solteira e mãe de 1 filho que frequenta a Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta 2 irmãos enviando dinheiro para ajudar a pagar as propinas Escolares e alimentação.
Tem um negócio próprio de venda de produtos diversos, com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (cervejas, arroz, óleo, açúcar, sabão, e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.
No futuro pretende construir uma mercearia com capacidade de armazenar grande quantidade de produtos, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é adquirir uma viatura que possa ajudar no transporte de produtos para o seu estabelecimento.
texts.en:
Dulce is the single mother of 1 son who attends School, lives in her own house with her family and supports 2 brothers by sending them money to help pay for their Education and food.

She has her own business selling various products and with this loan she plans to buy goods (beer, rice, oil, sugar, soap and others) to increase the quantity of her stock.

In future, Dulce intends to build a grocery store with the capacity to store large quantities of products and to this end, she commits to duly paying off her loan so that she can solicit further loans from Hluvuku. 

Her challenge is to purchase a vehicle that can help with transporting products to her establishment.

loans.use: buy goods (beer, rice, oil, sugar, soap and others) to increase the quantity of her stock.

loans.name: Kheng

texts.en:
Kheng is 43 years old. She is married and was blessed with four children, one of whom is married. She is a hard-working farmer who is involved in the rice farming business while her husband devotes himself to providing construction services. She has learned to manage from her parents and has been doing it for almost 17 years. She and her husband aim to stabilize their income so that they will be able to provide basic necessities and educate their children. Currently, they live in a small village of Prey district, Kompong Cham province

Due to insufficient funds, Kheng is asking for a loan in the amount of USD 450 in order to buy construction supplies to support her husband's business. She believes that this loan will enable her husband to work out his plans and hopes that he will be able to generate a good income by providing his construction services.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to support her husband's business.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is fifty years old and married with four children. She generates her income from the tailoring services she provides to her customers. She has previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya.

Since she has become a client of Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to save money, because she has been trained in financial management. She hopes to expand her business in future. She needs a loan of 50,000 KES to buy 15 rolls of materials.

loans.use: To buy 15 rolls of materials

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is 37 years old and married and with two children aged 6 and 8 years. He runs a cereal shop. Besides that, he owns a pick-up, which he uses for his transport business.

Since he has become a client of Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to manage his business, because he has been trained in business management skills. He has actually managed to grow his business and employ two people. He hopes to open more stores in different locations in the future. He needs a loan of 100,000 KES to buy maize, beans, and green grams.

loans.use: To buy maize, beans, and green grams

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen tiene 28 años, es una mujer humilde, optimista y muy trabajadora. Tiene una relación con David, de 31 años, con quien tiene una hija de 6 años llamada Milena, por quien se esfuerza y se sacrifica día a día trabajando arduamente para poder brindarle una mejor calidad de vida. Actualmente viven en su casa propia, la que han logrado conseguir con esfuerzo y dedicación, ahí comparten sus días felices y tristes como una familia unida.

Ella se dedica a la venta de repuestos, piezas y accesorios para todo tipo de vehículos, pero básicamente para motocarros. Asimismo, realiza el mantenimiento y reparaciones de éstos; y gracias a la excelente calidad de su trabajo es considerada como una de las mejores en este rubro y se ha convertido en una de las más conocidas de la ciudad, fama que comparte con su esposo, quien trabaja junto a ella desde que se inició el negocio, hace un año y 6 meses. Tienen muchos clientes, esto le genera seguridad y estabilidad económica. Este trabajo lo realiza en un local que alquilaron, aunque al principio fue un poco difícil por el temor y las dudas que sentían, pero no se dejaron amilanar y hoy por hoy siguen adelante con el deseo de seguir creciendo. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es ver que sus clientes se sienten contentos cuando observan que sus motocarros terminan en buenas condiciones y funcionando a la perfección, satisfacción que ella conoce y comparte de cerca ya que también tiene dos motocarros que alquila para transporte de pasajeros. Es por ello que su meta es conseguir un local más grande, en el que pueda brindar una mejor atención a sus clientes y donde pueda contar con una mayor cantidad de repuestos de distintas marcas, ya sea para ofrecerlos en venta como también con los que pueda continuar su trabajo de reparación.

Este es su crédito número 5 con MFP, por tanto agradece la oportunidad y confianza que ponen en ella para recibir este crédito. Por otro lado, se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual. Y además le agrada ser parte del banco comunal al que pertenece, ya que ha visto que sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias.

Con el monto solicitado (S/.2000) incrementará su stock de repuestos, piezas, accesorios y herramientas en su taller. Entre ellos: cámaras, rodajes, llantas, pernos, aceites, etc. Por otra parte, también refaccionará uno de sus motocarros, comprando un motor nuevo, cambiará el tapiz, pagara el seguro obligatorio y actualizará la documentación de circulación.
texts.en:
Carmen is 28 years old.  She is a modest, optimistic and very hard-working woman.  She has a 6-year-old daughter called Milena and she works hard every day in order to provide her with a better quality of life.  The family currently live in their own home which they acquired through a lot of hard work and commitment.  There they share their happy days and sad days, as a united family.

Carmen's business is selling spare parts and accessories for all kinds of vehicles but mainly motorcycle taxis.  She also services and repairs these vehicles.  Thanks to the excellent quality of her work, she is considered one of the best in her field and has become one of the best-known mechanics in the city, an honor she shares with her husband who has been working alongside her since she opened the business 18 months ago.  The couple have a lot of customers which provides them with security and financial stability.  They carry out their work in premises that they rent.  At first things were a little difficult owing to the fear and doubts that they had but they remained undaunted and now they continue wanting to grow their business.  What Carmen most enjoys about her work is seeing that her customers are happy when they find their cars in good condition and working well.  She is familiar with this feeling of satisfaction because she has two motorcycle taxis of her own which she hires out for transporting passengers.  Her goal is to acquire larger premises so that she can provide her customers with a better service and to have a larger quantity of different brands of spare parts both to sell and to use in her repair work.

This is Carmen's fifth loan from MFP and she is grateful for the opportunity and the trust that is being placed in her with this loan.  She pledges to make her repayments on time.  She enjoys being a member of her community bank because she has seen that her fellow members are responsible and supportive people.

Carmen will use the sum of 2,000 soles that she has requested to increase her stock of spare parts, accessories and tools for her workshop.  These include inner tubes, wheels, tires, bolts, oils, etc.  She will also refurbish one of her motorcycle taxis, buying a new engine, replacing the upholstery, paying the obligatory insurance and updating the vehicle's papers.

loans.use: to increase her stock of spare parts, accessories and tools for her workshop

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok, age 31, works for a garment factory in a suburb of Phnom Penh city. Sewing clothes is the main part of her family’s income. Sok is married to a humble man who works with a construction team to provide construction services around the country. She has three school-age children who completely depend on her care. Sok told us that she still has financial difficulties because the income generated from their businesses seems barely enough to cover the high cost of commodities. However, Sok has tried hard in her career, working overtime to get extra profit to support the family.

In order to reduce some of the family's transportation expenses, Sok would like to take out a loan of USD 500 to purchase a second-hand motorcycle for the household use as well as for support of her business. She and her husband can travel to work by themselves without taking other taxi services. She believes that she will be able to better her living standard someday as she strives to work harder.

loans.use: to purchase a second-hand motorcycle.

loans.name: Virgen Del Rosario Group

texts.es:
Este grupo llamado Virgen del Rosario es de ciudad del Este y cuenta con 15 integrantes, donde todas ellas trabajan con gran entusiasmo y dedicación. Gracias a su trabajo ya están en el noveno ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación Paraguaya.
 Alicia es la presidenta del grupo, ella se dedica a la peluquería, y cuenta que tiene un negocio muy bien mantenido, donde  atiende a sus clientes. Gracias al buen trato que les da, ya tiene clientela fiel que siempre acude a ella. Alicia nos comenta que sueña con poder ampliar su local y de esa forma poder tener mayores ingresos para ayudar a su familia,  y también quiere dar fuentes de trabajo a las demás personas.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de tintes, esmaltes, peines, tijeras, secador de pelo, planchitas y otros insumos para poder seguir trabajando en su negocio.
texts.en: This group, called "Virgen del Rosario," is from the city of Este and has 15 members, all of whom work with great enthusiasm and dedication. Thanks to their hard work they are already in their ninth loan cycle in the program for enterprising women with the Fundación Paraguaya. Alicia is the president of the group, and she works in hair styling. She tells us that she has a very well maintained business where she waits on her customers. Thanks to the good treatment she gives them, she has loyal customers who always come back for her. Alicia tells us that she dreams of being able to expand her shop, and in this way have greater income in order to help her family. She also wants to provide a source of work for other people. She is asking for the loan to buy dyes, nail enamel, combs, scissors, a hair dryer, straightening irons and other supplies to be able to continue working on her business.

loans.use: to buy dyes, nail enamel, combs, scissors, a hair dryer, straightening irons, and other supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase large quantities of bananas to sell
